Reviews.Title: “Park Hotel Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Will K
Reviews.Content: An ideal location for visiting Amsterdam. Next to the Rijksmuseum and the Rembrandt museum, a short walk from the iconic canals of the inner city and overlooking an outer defence canal. Good parking also. This a well run, welcoming, clean hotel with comfortable beds and a minimalist trendy lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant stay”
Reviews.Author: Stephen M
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location to start with- located right beside Ledsplein with all its bars, restaurants and transport networks to the other parts of the city, Also, on the other side of the hotel is Vondelpark, which is great for a stroll on a nice day. The interior of the hotel is very impressive- all modern furnishings and a warm comfortable atmosphere. Added to this was the exceptional staff who made every effort to ensure we had a good stay. The bedroom itself was also of a very high standard- luxurious bed, full size bathroom, tea/coffee, mini bar, flat scren tv etc. There was wi fi in the room, but cost extra. There is free wifi in the main reception area. Overall, we had a fantastic stay here. If we ever return to Amsterdam, we'll be sure to go back here.

Reviews.Title: “An real amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: Kalai_holiday_junkie
Reviews.Content: The exterior of the hotel blends in well with the surrounding building with a vintage (but less that promising) look, the entrance to the hotel looks more like a shop front with a scooter in the entrance and artsy mannequins. The interior feels more like the website promises, with an inviting fire and relaxing lunge packed with couches, books, and art. The staff at the front desk are friendly and warm. When i walked into my room, it was a welcome sight after a 10 hour flight. egyption cotton sheets only made the bed feel more dreamy especially since it felt like i slept on a marshallow. the bathroom was well stocked with toiletries and other amenities. the room also had a small seating area and a mini business centre with ipod dock, internet, writing desk and a big screen tv. the mini-bar was well stocked but didnt sample the wares for the usuall reasons. Great views of Liedseplein and Vondel park. Across the canal from the Hard Rock Cafe Would 100% visit again. Great bang for my buck.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable property”
Reviews.Author: Lorna C
Reviews.Content: We had 3 nights here at found the hotel to be really well run, with nice (large) rooms and helpful staff. The location is excellent, near museums, canal cruises and bike rentals, with an easy walk to other points of interest. Great buffet breakfast too.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location”
Reviews.Author: Franklin19
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights as we went to amsterdam to go to a gig at the Paradiso -a 2 minute walk. Check in was smooth -- the room was lovely, at the front with views across to the Hard Rock cafe and beyond. Beiing at the front there was a little bit of tram noise but we don't mind that. My husband loved the bed - he rated it the best he has ever slept in - a little bit too soft for me - but still comfortable. We hadn't booked breakfast but there were plenty of places locally. The location is good, near the museums and art galleries, and lots of good restaurants nearby. The hall area doubles up as the bar. We left our camera there and when we went back about half an hour later in a panic when we realised, the staff had put it away safley for us. Very impressive and much apppreciated! The overall feel was a little more sterile and a little less warm that we usually like, but overall it was a great place and a great location, and we would definitely return if travelling to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Barnsleygeordie
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stopped here and they obviously read the reviews because the rooms were further improved from last year by double glazing the windows. The tram noise could be clearly heard last year but this year the lack of noise made us enjoy the really comfy beds even more. Plenty of full sized mirrors, a hairdryer and even a 3 pin plug socket for British plugs helped my wife settle in. A choice of drench or ordinary shower spoilt us. Everything is on your doorstep here and the staff were very friendly. We will definitely be back again.

Reviews.Title: “not wow”
Reviews.Author: Anna K
Reviews.Content: The lobby of the hotel is very cosy with a fireplace and a good collection of books a tired traveller may be interested to run through when taking a cup of hot tea or smth else. The room is rather an unexpected disappointment for the price, humid and cold despite of the AC working all night at +27. Breakfast is nothing special, same as anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “The best beds EVER!”
Reviews.Author: Aucks67
Reviews.Content: We arrived to the Park Hotel on our first visit to Amsterdam. We arrived late at night and we received an upgrade, which I was extremely pleased with. We checked in with no problems and entered our room, it was delightful, clean and had the most cloud like beds! Oh my goodness, I can't explain how good they were! Slept so well here. We wandered around at about 11:30pm and found we were in an excellent location with the Casino and Hard Rock Cafe across the road with plenty of options for eating etc. We really enjoyed Amsterdam, I was dubious about the city hence, only a 2 night stay..... how wrong I was! We will be back and I will definately stay here again and for longer next time.

Reviews.Title: “march 2012”
Reviews.Author: Mona M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for two days ( my first time to Amsterdam - he had been there several times) It was very stylish and I felt an adult hotel. Great location, very friendly staff ( they upgraded us for free - nice bonus)

Reviews.Title: “Not for families”
Reviews.Author: Victoria C
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in Feb with my husband and our 1 year old son. While the staff were lovely (one even gave my son a free stuffed dog!) and the hotel itself was clean and well presented, we were very disappointed with our actual room. We were given a street view room, and the road noise was almost intolerable, trying to get a tired toddler to sleep when it sounds like you are practically outside was a nightmare, and even with earplugs I found it difficult. Plus, the bathroom was basically a wetroom, which was no good for our son. He was terrified of the shower, and also slipped over as the water almost reached the door after we had taken a shower. Overall, if I had the promise of a courtyard room, I would stay here again. But not with my son, and NEVER in a road side room again !

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in the best part of town”
Reviews.Author: Des B
Reviews.Content: On our first trip to Amsterdam and not really knowing what to expect from our hotel we were very pleased with our choice of the Park Hotel, on arriving from the hotel shuttle service the hotel is really impressive and the staff couldn't have been more helpful and professional. The room was very clean and well presented, the bathroom was also clean and modern and the bed very very comfortable, we were at the back of the hotel and the room was very quiet. After discovering the city it was nice to come back to a relaxing atmosphere at the hotel in what we thought was the best part of town not being too busy and noisy but only 200 yards from a multitude of bars and restaurants. Vondel park is literally next door and a pleasant safe area for a nice stroll, the art museums are 5 minutes walk away, the staff organized return shuttle tickets and museum tickets which saved us the long queue for the Van Gogh. All in all an excellent stay in a very friendly place and hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: H P
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Park Hotel for 2 nights and was impressed with the hotel. I've not stayed in that many hotels in Amsterdam so hard to compare within the same price range in Amsterdam. Room was clean, well maintained and the bed was very comfortable. Had a room facing the courtyard so it was really quiet and I was not in the room for views. Had a good sleep and the iPhone stand next to bed was nice touch so didnt have to fiddle with chargers & cables. Breakfast was good with nice selection but they could invest for second coffee machine to avoid queue forming in front of it. Took part in conference in the hotel and the conference room was comfortable, tech. and airco was working well and the catering for lunches and breaks was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Good bed”
Reviews.Author: Rune&B
Reviews.Content: This hotel has good standard. From you arrive in the lobby you sence quality. Our room was spacious. An excellent bed, a bit short for longer people though. The location is good, for sights, citylife and public transport (bus 197 from the airport). The only complain is that the hotel should have free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Guest Service”
Reviews.Author: Craig1212
Reviews.Content: Location is great but that's where it stops The staff at this hotel are rude and disinterested.Rooms are small not properly serviced avoid street view room extremely noisy. Very poor value for money.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic short break”
Reviews.Author: debbie d
Reviews.Content: Booked the park hotel and upgraded our room as it was my husband's birthday,as we were checking in the receptionist couldn't of being any more helpful and pleasant,we booked an executive room which was fantastic,the views across the city were definately sweeping, overlooking the casino and the hardrock cafe,we loved the mood lighting and the beds were so comfortable.Within easy reach of bars, museums and tram stops.We had breakfast in momo restaurant, there was so much choice and serving until 10.30 was briliant after a late night.Thankyou for a lovely weekend away and for the chocolates that were left in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Good for museums”
Reviews.Author: Paula S
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights as a young couple. It's right beside the museums such as the van gogh museum if you are into the museums, but a good 25 minutes walk away from dam square for the shopping, madam tussauds, the dungeons, red light district etc. Rooms are very clean and the bed was unbelievably comfy. The staff were very friendly and extremely helpful What we didn't like is that you have to pay if you want wifi, it was 9.95e for 24 hours. We found that very pricy, especially as you can get it free in restaurants

Reviews.Title: “All a mother could ask for...”
Reviews.Author: pbgvluv
Reviews.Content: My college age daughter was traveling along through Amsterdam on her way back to Italy. She had be touring for days and was exhausted and not feeling well. I decided she need a treat, and booked her a room at the Park instead of yet another hostel. She was SO pleased. As a family, we travel quite a bith in luxury hotels, so she knows a quality hotel. The location was perfect for her to visit the museums she wanted and was safe a walk-able for a young woman on her own. Her room was clean and comfortable - she said the bed was the best ever! Thanks, Park Hotel, for treating my girl so well!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Harriet1994
Reviews.Content: As soon as we arrived the people there were so friendly and helped us with our bags. Lovely room and the bed was the most comfy bed I have ever slept in! I would go back to stay at the Park Hotel purely to stay in the bed, The room service is fab. Great menu and they deliver food to your room whatever time it is! Just a lovely atmosphere and I looked forward to returning the hotel every night. Definitely want to go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Would I Stay Again?..........Without a Second Thought.”
Reviews.Author: Thomas L
Reviews.Content: Having arrived at Schipol rather late, my wife and I decided to take the 197 bus which will take you to the Museumplein right next to the Rijkmuseum. Luckily, next door you will find the Park Hotel. Upon setting foot in the hotel lobby, you will be impressed by the lovely warm decor and the aroma of "Under a Fig Tree". By the time you get to the reception you are anticipating if your room will differ from the pictures you have seen through the lens of another's camera. However, in my case, I was given a vacant expression and the news that my booking had failed to appear on the system. Great. Once I had controlled my rage and could construct a coherent sentence in my already confusing Scottish tongue, I asked what could be done. From here, the Park Hotel had arranged a room with breakfast in another hotel and would provide transport to get there (despite being a stone's throw away). They had asked us to come back tomorrow and they would guarantee an upgraded room. The hotel we were placed in was the NH Amsterdam, which was reasonable but we did witness a rat scuttle across the floor with a piece of toast someone had dropped during breakfast. So, the next day upon returning to the Park Hotel, I was pleased to be back. The hotel staff had upgraded our room to a Junior Suite. After some thorough apologies, I made my way up stairs and was instantly impressed by the hotel's standard of apology as the suite was a considerable upgrade from my initial booking and expectation. The suite has a large lounge area which had enough room to cater to all the mess we would make while staying in the hotel and was also nicely covered with nice dark warm colours. The bathroom was nicely decorated with a large Audrey Hepburn Ikea picture watching over the toilet. The shower was spectacular, the rain shower head produces so much power and water that I thought the cubicle may fill before the water can drain. The hotel provides an exceptionally comfortable bed with high thread count sheets and duvet's and I am honestly still missing the warmth. In terms of location, the hotel it situated just outside the center but it is for this reason, the area is not as run down and dusty looking. The hotel has trams, taxi's, buses and canal bus's all within two minutes walking distance, which will take you right to Dam Square if required. Given that the hotel is within the Museumplein, it is obvious but it is very easy to get to the Rijkmuseum and the Van Gogh museum, as well as others. The hotel also has a number of small restaurants within a half mile radius where you will find good food without the hustle and bustle of the center and also at a more reasonable price. However, the Momo restaurant, which is attached to the hotel is a good choice, with nice meals. All together, I stayed in Amsterdam for three days and found the hotel to be amongst the best I have stayed in which includes long list from Los Angeles to Shanghai. I would recommend this hotel to anyone making the trip to Amsterdam. Also, today I received an apology in letter from the hotel regarding the initial booking problem. This was a kind and an act which didn't have to be carried out but displays the thought and quality of the hotel and people that work within it's walls. Well done.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality at it's best”
Reviews.Author: Thekingsolomon
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at tha Park hotel. The hotel is well designed, the lobby is warm and welcoming and the rooms are cozy and not very big. The bed wasn't comfy for me ( the extra foam under the sheet is not necessary). Some of the rooms have balcony but the windos are not insulated from noise so keep that in mind if you are sensative (BTW- this is a non smoking hotel). The WiFi is NOT free !!! But there are few computers near the lobby for self use. The location is not central but close to some few atractions (Van gogh museum). The transportation is very easy in Amsterdam anyway so this is not an issue). E X C E L L E N T service, very nice staff (front desk, bell man, duty manager) , very helpfull and informative. We didn't had breakfast included in the rate but the restaurant of the hotel (Momo) is known for all. You have a very good breakfast across the street for 14 euro if coffee at starbucks is not enough. I will come back soon...just keep on the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mambo_2369
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3nights and could not have asked for anything better! Staff were friendly and hotel was clean and modern. Its in a great location of Amsterdam and it's easy to walk everywhere. The gym was good. The only negative was that the wifi was not free.

Reviews.Title: “great location, staff and ameneties!”
Reviews.Author: pooni21
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Park Hotel with my partner for a long weekend. The hotel is roughly 30 minutes away from Schiphol airport. As soon as we arrived the staff were incredibly nice and checking in was a breeze. The hotel entrance was great - fresh perfume, nice big couch areas to lounge in and a bar to the left. The staff checked us in but unfortunately no one showed us to the room, we were just given directions to get there. Our baggage was also just left for us to take ourselves. Our room was on the 5th floor which meant that we had to get the lift to the 4th floor and then go up 2 flights of stairs with our luggage. The room was spacious, but I was expecting a much bigger room. The gym was available for all visitors but we did not use this. We drank at the Momo bar/restaurant next door which was very convenient. The shower was the best, a huge shower head, but be warned none of the toiler or shower doors locked. All trams went past the hotel so getting into dam square was very easy. The location itself was pretty good. Staff pretty much helped us find where most touristy things were, which was a big help. One thing I didn't like, and being a geek, this was an issue for me, the internet was 9.95 euros per day. This only worked in the room and not the lobby or anywhere else. if you wanted internet in the lobby you would have to pay extra. I would have hoped given the current time, that this would be free and much more widely available. Overall the service was great and I would highly recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel That Caters For Your Every Need”
Reviews.Author: AJB1966
Reviews.Content: This hotel made our stay a most memorable one. Plush, Quiet and discreet. Nothing for the excellent staff was too much trouble. A real pleasure to have stayed at such a fine hotel. We applaud you. Thank You.

Reviews.Title: “Great location pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: royalgirl5
Reviews.Content: Ideal location , 2 minute walk from bars and restaurants beside tram line. Across the road from the big blue boat cruise which we enjoyed and beside mac bike rental that offer good value. The rooms were comfortable and modern. Request a room away from the trams. We asked for a new room as after our 1st night of the tram noise we didn't get much sleep. Wifi is expensive and we didn't bother as many cafes offer it for free.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary break”
Reviews.Author: David W Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a very nice 3 night break at the Park Hotel. The location to all places of interest was within walking distance or a tram ride. The Mo Mo restaurant in the hotel was terrific. We thought the hotel was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: harry_martin14
Reviews.Content: I was in room 213.. it was a lovely room, although it would of been nice to of given the option of front view or back, as it would of been nice to of faced onto the Hard Rock and the canal, but I'm not complaining. I really enjoyed my stay, the beds were amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, restaurant and cocktail bar, friendly staff in Amsterdam center”
Reviews.Author: Frank H
Reviews.Content: Received by the very friendly staff, I got a great duplex suite, had a super diner that was specially prepared by the chef of the restaurant, drank cocktails at Momo's the hotspot cocktail bar Amsterdam center just around the corner of the hotel. Best of all everything in Amsterdam at walking distance!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bukilester
Reviews.Content: Just back from a weekend in Amsterdam and stayed at this hotel. The hotel is great, very clean, modern and the staff are helpful. Rooms are very modern, and the lobby is very nice. The bed was so soft I thought I wasn't going to like it, but infact I had the best nights sleep ever. As mentioned by others, you should only stay here if your comfortable with the people you are going with as the toilet & shower are in the room with just a curtain to hide behind. It's not that bad though honest! - PS The shower is fantastic!! Hotel is 5 minutes from the Van Gogh museum, and about 5/10 mins on tram to Central station, the tram stop is a 2 minute walk away. I personally thought the location was perfect, I only used the tram on arrival to get to the hotel, walked everywhere after that. There are plenty of bars and restaurants within walking distance to the hotel, there is a large restaurant attached, however I never tried that. Would def stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Unscrupulous”
Reviews.Author: utente230072
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a double room for 3 nights and the cost was 400â‚¬. In the cost wasn't included any services: no breakfast, no wireless, no access to gym. The prices of minibar foods and drinks were crazy. We paid 40â‚¬ for 4 glasses of wine. Hey! I'm italian,this price is totally ridicolous. The last straw was that they asked my credit card to charge temporarily 150â‚¬ as guarantee until the end of stay, when the room was already paid. RIDICOLOUS!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: StoutTraveller
Reviews.Content: I visited the Park Hotel for a business trip and overall I had a good experience. The price was fair and the location was great. If you are looking to stay close (closer than a 15 minute walk) to the Red Light District then this is not the place for you. You are close to the Casino and the Heineken Brewery along with a loading point for the canal tours (pretty cool to see once). The rooms were a very good size compared to other hotels I have stayed at in Amsterdam. The wifi was good and the service was decent. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location, poor service”
Reviews.Author: carinecork
Reviews.Content: I spent a week business travel end of January. I chose the hotel because of the central location. I was not disappointed on that. The restaurant adjacent to the hotel is a very hype restaurant and brings in a crowd of trendy people. It's a nice feeling of being in a good place. Room was very clean. Staff at the reception desk and luggage were very nice and helpful. The breakfast is lovely and varied.However, for the full week I stayed there, only 1 lift was working. The other one was not being repaired ! Being on the 7th floor, I did a lot of waiting at the lift during my stay. Did not appreciate that. I also had a bad experience with room service. I've ordered a full meal on night = pasta and fruit salad with ice cream. I was told that the wait would be 20mn. Being busy working, it's after an 1hour that I realized that the food was still not delivered. I called room service again to let them know. And I was told that they came around but nobody was in the room. This is not the answer I was expecting...! I've asked them to come around again and make sure that the food is hot. The food was not hot, even the ice cream for the dessert had completely melted but they didn't bother to replace it. I do understand that this can happen but it's the way it is dealt with that shows the quality of the service in a hotel. I complain when checking out and I didn't have to pay for the meal. So just the room service and lift not working put my rating down on this hotel. All the other boxes are ticked.

Reviews.Title: “Horror nights”
Reviews.Author: Annett P
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that design is really nice in the lobby and rooms kinda look nice, yet the beds are horror, at least for people that dont like to sleep very very soft... boxspring matresses. Also as showers are in the room - you need to like the smell of wet rooms. make sure you make dinner reservations in the hotel ahead of time otherwise, staff will tell you that they try to get reservations to then tell you that you can eat at 6pm in the hotel or not at all. Good one to remember - what they dont tell you on their website - if leave out breakfast booking upfront you can get discount when you book there on arrival!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Location”
Reviews.Author: Palmtreetheory
Reviews.Content: If the Red Light district is too intense for you or to expensive, then the Park Hotel is the answer. The hotel is very close to a bunch of museums, right next to Leidseplein, and right by a tram stop where you can take it right into the Red Light District or other neighborhoods in Amsterdam. The hotel is very modern and trendy, the hotel staff goes out of their way to accommodate you, and they have the best beds I have ever slept in. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average rooms.”
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is great, right in-between the museum district, glamorous shopping streets and the centre. Although the hotel is quite modern, its not high quality. The details are not so great. Its not very clean, although clean enough to somewhat satisfy the average person. I don't think I would stay there again, I think I would rather try something else. We had a basic room, and I found it tiny. There was barely any space to walk next to the bed, no space to put your suitcase really (we had travel hand luggages, one was on the floor and one in the only chair in the room). The roof was skewed so it created a small scene. The view was very nice, but the windows were small. We also couldn't raise the temperature above 20 degrees Celsius, and it was quite cold. The bathroom was fairly spacious, in comparison to the bedroom. The shower wasn't great, it splashed water on the ground and was in the bathtub. The bathtub wasn't very comfortable either. Service was very average, they made me wait 10 minutes when I came to collect my bags before leaving which was very annoying because we had a train to catch.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: leeomalleyring
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in January 2012 and arrived by bus. The rooms are standard European (smallish and modern)...and the bathroom is nice, although the tub is rather narrow. However, this bathroom had an amazing oversized shower head and great water pressure, which almost made the trip for me personally. The hotel had Wifi for about 10 Euros a day, which is about standard for Europe. The hotel and restaraunt staff were both extremely accomodating and nice. The hotel is located just across the street from the Hard Rock and the Holland Casino (which actually has American style Black Jack...very rare in most European casinos). The Rijks Museum and the Van Gogh museum are only a few blocks away, and the rest of the city is easily accessed by foot or public transportation. There is an Irish pub across the street and there are a couple of good sushi places near as well. Overall, a solid five stars for a great hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again...”
Reviews.Author: Mistermark_21
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 6 nights and found the rooms very comfortable, staff helpful and location very suitable. Walked into the center of Amsterdam in about 15 mins. Ann Frank House is a nice walk away and takes about 20-30 mins. Once you find your way around the city you have no trouble. 3 mins away from Italian restaurants, Van Gogh Museum literally round the corner. There was also a full sized ice skating rink just down the road. When we checked in, as we don't use credit cards, we were asked for a 150 Euro deposit in case we used the mini-bar. This did sting us a bit but i suppose a hotel of this standard needs to do that. We did get our deposit back though later on in the week. Room was very comfortable, bed well made and very soft. Shower and toilet were modern, small but not a problem. TV has about 4 English channels, some German, Italian and Dutch. Plenty of storage space. Mini-bar is WAY overpriced though (8 euro for a small can of Heineken!), we didn't use it. We did make full use of the veranda though, we simply bought milk, tea, break etc from a supermarket in Amsterdam and used the veranda as an outdoor fridge! iPod docking station in the room didnt work. My overall opinion is that this is a decent hotel and i'd stay here again when i return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Park Hotel Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Hornbill007
Reviews.Content: Location is not exactly ideal if you want to walk to the popular tourist areas in Amsterdam. But if you are interested in casinos, the Holland casino is just a stone's throw away. Rooms are very small, especially the shower cubicle. If you drop your soap, there's no way you can bend down and pick it up!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: Near to the centre of Amsterdam. Staff were very good, courteous and professional. Breakfast was fantastic and worth paying for. Rooms were clean, attractive and modern, with the comfortable bed. The room had an iPhone charger & speakers which was a nice gesture. The parking and WiFi was too expensive!!!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and Stylish in heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: practicalperfection
Reviews.Content: i started our trip a couple of weeks before we arrived by emailing the guest services manager to organise some treats for my husband for when we arrived as we were visiting Amsterdam over valentines and our anniversary. She was amazing and planned flowers, chocolates and champagne to be in our room and it was extremely reasonable prices. on check in we were welcomed by very friendly staff and that set the tone for the rest of our stay. from restaurant waiters to bar staff, all were knowledgeable and attentive. our room was spacious and contemporary. the u toiletries were supplied by spiritual and we have been trying to find them ever since as they were amazing. the hotel is very close to Leidseplein which is great for us as we love that area. it is also close to some amazing restaurants and bars. we have stayed in many hotels in amsterdam and would not consider staying anywhere other than the Park Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but little room!”
Reviews.Author: Riky1980
Reviews.Content: We stood for a week in december, on new year eve. Very good, so clean, good position to visit the city. Near Leidesplaine. The room was really little, the shower near the bed, without the door, but not bad! The employers are kind and available to each request. The lobby is really gorgeus with fireplace and bar.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad.”
Reviews.Author: littlesean73
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend break and enjoyed ourselves once we had a room upgrade (which Cost us!). The original "superior" room we were given was dark and small so we asked for another and got a room at the front of the hotel which was also higher up with views of the canal and bridge. The hotel itself is modern and clean with a nice relaxing area with books, coffee etc near reception. Staff were professional but basic and make sure you check your bill/s as you may be charged for all manner of things and they did make numerous mistakes on our bill. The location is good and you can walk to many interesting places within 10 minutes. The hotel has a restaurant which is very nice and very pricey and all the "best shops" are just around the corner. The Vondel park is just across the road and is great for a stroll. make sure you go on a cruise around the city, you can get a boat opposite the hotel on the canal, prices are reasonable too. Its a great city so enjoy yourself, if you can afford it stay at the Park Hotel you will enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: gardengirl92
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a weekend in June 2011. I enjoyed my stay. The hotel is clean and comfortable and is close to public transportation. There was a grocery store within walking distance and it was within walking distance of all the shops and restaurants downtown. I booked this hotel specifically because I was looking for one with 2 beds, as I knew a friend would stay with me one night. As soon as I got to the room, I saw it only had 1 bed. I called the front desk to ask about it and was told they upgraded my room and unfortunately there were no rooms with 2 beds available. They offered to bring in a cot, but the bed was large enough to share with my friend and the room was great, so I declined the cot. The room essentially had 2 floors with a floor to ceiling window. The first level had a small seating area, a wet bar, a desk, a powder room/water closet, and a door that opened up to the outside. There was no real balcony that you could step out on to, but I did open the door to the outside and read a bit overlooking the street and canal. A spiral staircase led up to the loft area where there was a bed and a beautiful bathroom. The room came appointed with robes and slippers too, which was a nice touch. I'd recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - staff let them down”
Reviews.Author: km0161
Reviews.Content: Lovel hotel, great location. Unfortunately our room wasn't ready so we had quite a long wait. The staff really didn't go out of their way to be helpful. However the hotel itself was lovely, rooms great - and we had a lovely view! would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “the friendliest staff i met!!”
Reviews.Author: kaikyB
Reviews.Content: have been on a short business trip in this hotel, so i can't say that i chose it, but what a great surprise!! my room was amazing, and it was the standard! the bed sheets are to die for... the breakfast was very rich, but what really made my stay was the super nice staff, always smiling, always helpful, always there, they remember you, they ask how you are, i just felt like i went back to a very familiar place (even though i never been there before) - totally home. i recommend it with all my heart.

Reviews.Title: “nice modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: ParisFifi
Reviews.Content: this was a nice modern hotel which was good for business travel. An easy walk into the city. The restaurant is good value for money and the food relatively innovative. The service was slow enough though and the service in the bar at night from the cocktail waitress was hopeless until she was motivated by a tip. Staff nice and discreet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value and a wonderful breakfast”
Reviews.Author: KevinHogarth
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to the the Rijksmuseum and in a lovely part of Amsterdam. The hotel lobby is really nice - lots of lovely big chairs to sit in. My room was up on the 5th floor and if you are carrying heavy luggage it is a bit of a pain because the elevator stops at the 4th and there a is short set of stairs to negotiate. The room itself was on the small side and a bit noisy because there was no double glazing. The highlight of the stay was breakfast - excellent choice and great value

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: Chris M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed @ the Park Hotel in early December 2011. The hotel is excellent, the service good, Bar Momo's is a great place for a meal or drink. The hotel is also handy for all the sites of the city. We particularly enjoyed the Van Gogh museum which is 5 minutes away and also the canal ride which is literally across the road. But my biggest thanks must go to Robert the duty manager who quickly and professionally helped my wife who had a medical emergency whilst we stayed. He and his staff were superb and we both thank them. I can't recommend this hotel highly enough! Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Content: We adore and love this hotel because of the location. We walk everywhere from this hotel. We have stay @ this hotel 4 times. And the reason is location close enough to action and far enough from the action . The hotel is across from the park across from a beautiful canal.the front desk staff and hotel manager were Excellent. Both check in and check out. The hotel Manager even sent us a wonderful fruit tray to our room. He is a manager who cares about his guest. The hotel lobby is a great place to relax and have a coffee or a glass of wine by the fireplace.

Reviews.Title: “overall somewhat OK I guess, but I slept in banana shape in their bed”
Reviews.Author: trlster
Reviews.Content: Good location, price I guess OK for Amsterdam. The room was modern but small. Not too small, but I did not like the in-room toilet and bath. Imagine airplane toilet with a small glass door. 2 feet from bed to sink with your tootthbrush. You could however draw a small curtain to separate it, but the steam from showering would enter the room a bit. The bed was so soft I slept on my back in a sort of banana shape. On the positive side, excellent breakfast. Friendly helpfull staff, location. Clean room. Really nice lounge area with fireplace. Good espresso etc. etc. Amendeties are great, I suppose if you went for a more expensive room (I booked from a company portal thus getting a discount, so I got I guess a discount room) it could be great.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good lounge, terrible smell!”
Reviews.Author: Samar D
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Park Hotel. The location is excellent and I had read the reviews about the small rooms and made sure to book a big one. On first impression, the lounge and lobby are warm and welcoming. Checking in and out though can take some time. The room and the bathroom are good and spacious and the bed extremely comfortable. With all this, it really is a pity that the management of the hotel has not done anything about the terrible cooking smell that wafts from the lounge into the corridors and settles in the rooms and bathrooms! For five out of six nights I stayed there, it seemed like someone was frying fish just outside my door. The fishy smell hits you the minute you step out of the lift and into the corridor. They try to camouflage it in the lobby with smells of relaxing candles but once you're out, nothing can overcome the smells from the open kitchen of Momo's. My room was on the 4th floor and I visited a friend's room at the third floor and it was the same. It seems all rooms on the canal side over Momo's suffer the same. I travel frequently to Amsterdam and thought I had discovered an hotel to go back to. I definitely won't. It's a pity.

Reviews.Title: “HOW THINGS HAVE CHANGED!!”
Reviews.Author: jerseyrock
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying at the park hotel and felt i had to write another review, what a differance a year makes!! I booked the room i wanted over 2 months before i travelled, i was in amsterdam to play poker so i wanted a room with no noise as i would not be getting back till late. Got to the hotel only to be told i could not have the room i had booked and was given another, all i can say about that room is you would have more room in a shoe box!! They then gave me another room witch had the people from hell next door!! and the loudest cleaner i have ever heard!! Would i now say this is a good hotel to stay while in amsterdam? NO i wouldnt, how things change!

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully done hotel in a great spot”
Reviews.Author: mp6283
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful inside and out and nicely located near museums and galleries as well as shopping. We were lucky enough to be upgraded to the honeymoon suite despite the fact that we had bought the room cheaply through a third party website. The room was huge with enormous circular(!) bed. The bathroom too was excellent with huge shower head in one corner and a smallish (but very comfortable) bath in the other and two basins. Service was a little slow whenever we needed help at the front desk but this is a minor quibble in an otherwise perfect weekend away.

Reviews.Title: “All (average) Style, No Substance”
Reviews.Author: napple
Reviews.Content: So let me start by saying that I'm basing my review of this hotel on several visits. I travel to Amsterdam frequently for work and, unfortunately, this hotel is the preferred hotel closest to my office. I'd like to start on a positive note. The first impression of the hotel when you arrive into the lobby is good. It's modern, elegant and leads you to believe this is going to be quite a slick operation. It doesn't take long for the cracks to appear. The staff on reception are polite but don't seem genuinely interested in making you feel welcome. Every time I arrive I'm asked if it's my first time at the hotel, I tell them that in fact I've been there several times. Nevertheless, every time I have to fill out a customer information card. Any half decent hotel saves your customer details to save you the hassle and time of filling out yet another guest card. When I last arrived I was informed that I was in a room on the 4th floor but that the lift was broken. It was late at night and they didn't even offer to help with my bags. So I was left to walk up the four flights to reach my room. I opened the door and it was ice cold inside. Not because of overactive air-conditioning (which they have) but because they had thoughtfully left the window wide open and it was about 7 degrees outside. The rooms itself was ok otherwise. Don't take OK to mean good. It looks relatively stylish but everything is quite cheaply done from the bathroom fittings that are loose on the wall to the sockets that are so thoughtlessly placed that you can't fit a power adaptor into them. So you might struggle to charge your computer, I also found I struggled to get online as the cable network didn't work. Thankfully the overpriced Wifi was available. On the plus side, the bedsheets are nice and the bed is comfortable (if you like them very soft). I did end up with some insect bites which I can't positively attribute to bed bugs but all I'll say is my colleague staying at the hotel had the same (!) So back to the lift. Four days and it was still not working. Beware the basic rooms, they are tiny. So tiny in fact that the bathroom is in the room just separated by a curtain. The breakfast is OK, nothing special. And they have the tiniest cereal bowls I've ever seen. If you like a decent bowl, you'll be making several trips back to the buffet. On my last checkout, they asked me if my stay was nice. I did think about listing off my many complaints with this hotel but I didn't. Why? I didn't think they would actually care.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Berny M
Reviews.Content: Good sized rooms, stylish decor an friendly staff. The restaurant Momo is great especially for a hotel restaurant. Parking is quite limited so it is worth reserving a space if you want to park directly at the hotel (EUR 49,00 for parking though, so it's not cheap) Still, a good hotel, overall good value so we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “The worst experience in the last year”
Reviews.Author: Andreas_H151
Reviews.Content: First of all I have to say, that I'm a very frequent traveller having about 250 hotel nights per year. I'm frequent flyer with Lufthansa and KLM, frequent traveller with Deutsche Bahn and drive with a chaffeur about 12,000 km per month. I booked this hotel because I supplier wanted to meet me there. He had been there some years before and had spend a lot of money for a distributor meeting. So I thought, it can't be that bad, although I was astonished that the price was just 130 EUR per night. When I saw the room I was shocked. The room was stinking and had a very humid air. Obviously the carpet had been under water and was still wet. I went to the reception and asked for another room without carpet - because I had seen in the internet that they have rooms without carpet. The offered me a room without carpet for an upgrade price of 80 EUR per night. After some negotiations I took it for 60 EUR more per night. Then I tried to eat something in the restaurant. It was 10.55 pm and they told me at the front desk the restaurant would be open until 11 pm but the restaurant didn't want to serve me food anymore as it was closed since 10.30 pm. The next day we tried to have lunch at the restaurant at 2.15 pm. The reception told us again that the restaurant would be open but the restaurant refused to serve us food - because they were closed. So we had food in the lobby and went to my room to work - until we saw ants on the floor walking between the small carpet underneath the living room table and a flower. We called the reception and three people came to my room and offered to spray poison in my room. I heavily refused because I didn't want to have poison in my room but they told me it's biological. Also some mushrooms are biological but can be nonetheless lethal. What a stupid idea. I told the three people that I'm not willing to pay an upgrade price of 60 EUR per night, because they had in first step given me a room with wet floor and mould fungus in the air and on top now having the ants in the room. He said he would consider it. We left the room to have dinner and when I came back I found a box of cookies for about 3 EUR in my room. The service was bad, the people were not helpful, the stairs in my room to the upper level were with carpet and the carpet was dirty, overall just a horrible place. On top they charge 19,90 EUR for going online per day plus 24 EUR for breakfast, even if you just want to have just a muffin and a cup of coffee. And the parking btw costs 49 EUR per night. So if you come by car, want to stay in a room without mould fungus, want to have breakfast and wifi, you have to add almost 100 EUR to your room rate and that doesn't include any meals in the restaurant where they most of the time don't want to serve you. Great hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - but very expensive internet”
Reviews.Author: msstrips
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, recently refurbished and upgraded. Great location, in the Museum Quarter, you can walk everywhere. The no. 5 tram stops just around the corner from the hotel, and goes to the Central Train Station, so very handy to get to the airport too. Rooms: Good comfortable beds (and warm duvet covers!), spacious enough bathrooms with underfloor heating. Beware, not all rooms in this hotel are the same. Some bathrooms are open plan - which is not for everyone. The only negative is that there is no double-glazing, therefore the room feels a bit cold (in October) and you can hear the noise from the street. Lobby: the lobby area - or "Living room" as they call it - is very nice, with books, magazines and newspapers available for everyone to browse, nice music and in general a good atmosphere. Check in was fast, and everyone in reception was very professional and helpful. Restaurant: Momo is a very popular restaurant, so do book if you want to have dinner there, because tables get booked up fast. The bar is quite busy too. The very annoying drawback at this hotel is that internet is not free - there is a charge or â‚¬19.50 for 24 hrs! And by 24 hrs they mean from, say, 11 am on the day to 11 am the following day. So not 24 hrs of use.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Rosiesmartypants
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Hotel in Amsterdam last weekend. This is a lovely hotel, with quite possibly the most comfortable bed in the world! The public areas are fresh and modern, and our room, which was in the older park of the hotel, was spacious, clean and bright. The staff are friendly and helpful, and we had breakfast in the hotel both mornings, which really hit the spot. The surrounding area can be a bit noisy at night, so earplugs are recomended if you are noise sensitive! The hotel is in a great location for many of the main attractions, with many lovely restaurants within a short walk. All in we had a lovely stay in Amsterdam and the Park Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lacks any charm but a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: R A
Reviews.Content: I have had better experiences buying eurostar tickets at Brussels Midi. Just there for one night and pleased with the hotel itself - clean, modern rooms with good facilities (bike rental etc) - although there is no double glazing on the roadside rooms and the trams and revellers can be awfully loud in the evening. Problem was the staff were pretty aloof and condescending - at check in and check out. We did also leave train tickets in our room, and the concierge insisted the room had been cleaned, checked and checked again but no tickets were found. Thanks only to our persistence and a request to see the duty manager was the room checked after "nothing else could be done" and the tickets recovered.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special...”
Reviews.Author: doktordod
Reviews.Content: I was there for 4 days, in sept 11. Well, not a great position, rooms are small ( even if we were in the executives one), the overall impression is about a mefium quality hotel. The price is too high for the service is offered ; a plus is the good breakfast. Staff is ok. It s true that Amsterdam is expensive, regarding the hotel, but for sure you can find something much better.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: HoraceChestwig
Reviews.Content: The Park Hotel is great. It's in a good location next to loads of bars and a lovely park. The entrance is like a living room so is very welcoming. My room was great. Comfiest bed of the year! Business rooms were good and staff were very attentive. There is a shared eating area for the different business meetings which is slightly chaotic as we discovered we had eaten someone's lunch!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & Inviting”
Reviews.Author: Judy222222
Reviews.Content: What really surprised my husband & I was the lobby areas. So inviting after coming in from the rain every day. Enjoyed wine and lunch one day in the lobby. One evening had wine and apps in another part of the lobby. Sat and read for awhile one afternoon too. The buffet breakfast was another thing that impressed. Great coffee and lots of choices for foods. Staff was very friendly. Great atmosphere and food at the MOMO. Don't miss a dinner there. It's nice for a change not to have anything negative to say about a hotel. Nice going Park Hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Clean but small, good service, good price.”
Reviews.Author: joesmoe00
Reviews.Content: This is one of my preferred hotels in amsterdam. They provide excellent service, quick internet, and a nice, newer, clean room. Note that the rooms are very small though. Nothing fancy here, just the bare basics, also its a bit far from the central station, so learn to use the trams! Comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “So-So”
Reviews.Author: ufgator27
Reviews.Content: Location is great (as are many hotels in the city center). Attached MoMo restaurant has a fab steak. Other than that, everything very mediocre/average...except the servce - I would call it bad. I have stayed here 4 times for business in last month and every single time, they cannot manage to get my coffe/eggs for breakfast to me on time. I have done the card on the door, I have called first thing in the morning to confirm, I have skipped the doorknob hanger and just called first thing in the morning... every single time - I do not manage to get breakfast - even if I called 90 minutes in advance to order or double-check the doorknob hangar. Seriously - how difficult is that!!?? I even mentioned to the brekafast room woman in charge and while she was very apologetic on two different occasions, there were no solutions offered or suggested. (other than, "pls come down to the buffet" - for 23 euros. If I wanted to eat in the main dning room - I would. Front desk is slow - friendly enough but not highly professional (routinely shouting to each other from each desk when they have a question while making other guests wait). I have told my secretary not to book me here anymore. If you aren't worried about the service, the rooms are fine - comfy enough. The rooms on the back side of the hotel are a LOT quieter and darker and I would recommend these. oh! be wary of the closet! I almost broke my finger opening the closet. My fault - but to open the closet, you don't pull on a knob, you put your finger thru a hole and pull. When I did this, the closet opened much fast than I was expecting and my finger got very twisted - it is still swollen and sore after 3 weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Dutch service 'at its best' - faulty towers at most...”
Reviews.Author: selmasbh
Reviews.Content: When the assistant general manager tells you 'I don't want to talk about you problems' you realise why the staff are so adamant to be arrogant and unhelpful

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL IN A BEAUTIFUL LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: OLGAGreece
Reviews.Content: Park hotel is a nice hotel.For sure not the greatest hotel that i have ever visited.It is near the park,the casino the museums.The room wasn't very big the toletries in the bathroom were "poor"but the room was clean and the breakfast was very good.Also the hotel has a nice bar where you can enjoy a drink or a fusion snack.Park hotel is an O.k.HOTEL in beautiful distict of Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Great location and clean!”
Reviews.Author: TradeshowMagician
Reviews.Content: The location cant be better! Great service, comfortable rooms and breakfast at Momo restaurant was first class! Great business hotel, BUT internet was EXPENSIVE at â‚¬20 each day.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed with Expensive but Small Room”
Reviews.Author: Floridatravelerlady
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Amsterdam yesterday. We booked through hotels.com and pictures there looked good. I did notice that the room we booked did not have a picture, and now I know why: the room is rediculously small, has a shower closet, and a toilet, but no real bathroom. Apparently this is what they call an "open bathroom." The room is barely big enough for one person to walk round, and there is no room for suitcases. We asked for an upgrade because we felt deceived by the high price and very small accomodations of which pictures were deliberately omitted...........the only pictures they showed was of their other rooms, so it felt like a bait and switch! Since we thought we had splurged on this expensive hotel room, it was very disappointing and not at all what we had expected. They were only willing to upgrade us for an additional 40 euros, which after a lot of arguing they lowered to $25. We did not receive a free upgrade as one of the other reviewers said they received ( I wish I had checked tripadviser before booking). I told them no thank you, as I wasn't going to spend any more money on this hotel and the staff wasn't even friendly. I asked for a refund to cancel the room, but the room was pre-paid and they couldn't give us any. Another thing that shocked us was that the hotel manager was on vacation even during the busy IBC convention that week in Amsterdam! Then the front desk told us of a bus service to Schiphol (bus #197)around the corner from the hotel, only to find out that the entire month of September this bus service had been discontinued due to construction. I was fortunate to be able to read this in Dutch or we would waited for nothing and missed our flight entirely. When we ran back to the hotel we were told that their airport shuttle needed a 2 hour advance reservation, so we were forced to take a taxi instead to make a mad dash to the airport. Their wrong information caused us a lot of stress, and you'd expect hotel staff to be properly informed of a month-long cancellation of the schiphol bus service. We would not recommend this hotel to our friends. The only good thing about the hotel was the location, but there are other less expensive hotels nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Average rooms, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Hemsedal
Reviews.Content: I just got back from IBC and our group stayed at the Park. Now I loved the place for its location and the MoMo bar is a good place to hang out. Hoping we stay there again next year. Beds where excellent and the food/drinks at MoMo was very nice. Thanks to all who worked there. You did take good care of us ;) Its next to the large museums and Leidseplein is across the river, so if you are there for work the location is great since there are great hang out places very close. Nothing "authentic" about it, or romantic, but a good location and sometimes that is all you need.

Reviews.Title: “A nominal 4 star hotel with 2.5 star facilities and service”
Reviews.Author: brodger
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three nights on our travel agent's suggestion. Location is excellent and individual staff can be friendly and helpful but I wouldn't return. Hotel was renovated ~4 years ago with lots of emphasis on glitz and Euro/Asian chrome style and now it's all coming apart. First afternoon people kept coming in to check the minibar and tried to charge us for drinks we hadn't had (just got into the room) and got snarky when we complained about the intrusion. First full day room wasn't made up at 4:30 in the afternoon and staff got snarky when we complained. First room was OK (great beds, actually) until the air conditioning condensation began leaking from the ceiling -- new room had a phone whose buttons didn't work and a broken window that I jammed shut with the handy dandy aluminum cover of the hotel services booklet. Weirdest thing -- rooms have fiberoptic LCD lighting above the curtains that comes on automatically -- spent one sleepless night bathed in turquoise light until we found out how to turn it off. Restaurant is very expensive for dinner but a decent breakfast buffet. Furniture is shabby and worn. Lounge/bar area is a small collection of uncomfortable semi-couches and basked chairs jammed against the front window-- and bar service was a challenge (had to chase the server down). Concierge service was non-existent -- only once did I see someone at the desk. The receptionist did make dinner reservations for us at a local restaurant which was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: lotte032
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend last year and we were pleasantly surprised. We got upgraded without asking into a duplex room which was beautiful. Would definitely go back again. The location was good and within walking distance of most things and near to a tram stop.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely design”
Reviews.Author: Linda T
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Park Hotel Amsterdam for a romantic couples weekend. Although the room was on the small side, it was very comfortable, had all the amenities we required and a very comfortable bed. Lobby area of the hotel is very stylish and inviting. Breakfast area stylish as well, and had a good buffet breakfast with high international standard. Hotel has a central location, with shops and restaurants in walking distance, and also easy access by tram to other areas of the city. I recommend this hotel to my friends going to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Unhelpful receptionist - smelly room1 - impractical room2”
Reviews.Author: A C
Reviews.Content: Girlfriend and I stayed at the Park Hotel for two nights during our stay in Amsterdam. My 'Poor' rating is based on the following incidents: - We arrived at 10am on the first day and enquired about early check-in. The receptionist said no without any investigation. Fine - we were early, so we could see pass this. But as it was pouring outside, we asked if we could borrow an umbrella, to which her response was 'we have no more - you'll have to buy one'. We subsequently asked concierge the same question as we dropped off our bags, and miraculously one appeared. So first gripe is this particular receptionist clearly did not care for us much at all. - When we eventually returned to check-in, we were assigned a room in the older quarters of the hotel. The room was refurbished but had a god awful sewage stench. I had my suspicions when I noticed the room was to the very end of the corridor and so it proved. We called reception and requested to switch rooms. - Our second room was up on the fifth floor - again in the older quarters. To reach this room you have to take the lift to the fourth floor and walk up another flight of stairs. Interesting. Again, room was reasonably refurbished and thankfully no smell. The problem with this room was the practicality of the layout - as one reviewer has previously pointed out. The shower and toilet cubicle doors get in the way of each other and it is impossible to step out of either without having to play some sort of physical exercise game. Apart from this awful design, everything else was decent. - We received a letter the following day to apologise - again, as highlighted in a previous review, these letters seem quite common and impersonal. BUT CONCIERGE WERE GOOD. So conclusion - reviews I have found to be quite accurate and consistent. Maybe we were unlucky.

Reviews.Title: “A great Hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Neil D
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park hotel for 3 nights over the bank holiday weekend. I got a really good deal considering it is a 4 star hotel. We checked in which was very easy. the room was perfect size with the most comfy bed I have ever stayed in. This meant it was hard to get up in the mornings ha ha. The bathroom was big and there was a good choice of programmes on the television. The room was made every day, and the staff on the desk were very helpful with any questions or queries I had. The hotel is in a great location as you can easily walk everywhere. Me and my girlfriend had a lovely time here and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, nice place in the centre off amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: jeffrey d
Reviews.Content: hotel is nice, in the centre of amsterdam. first time here we had a terrible leakage. we got a free stay, in an upgraded room. got back to the hotel a couple off months later, liked it al lot. can not have breakfast here, no gluten free breakfast. fitness is good, restaurant looks great. good atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms”
Reviews.Author: kingkelly77
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Park many times for business as its in a great location. I last stayed a few nights ago and got room 209, which at best can be described as a luxury cupboard. It was tiny, had the sink by the bed and the toilet and shower hidden behind glass panelling. Although the hotel is about â‚¬117 a night i'd expect a bigger room. I checked the floor map on the back of the door and it was the smallest room on the floor, guess they didn't like me. Its all very clean and given i was only there 1 night i didn't complain. It just felt very claustrophobic and more of a luxury bedsit.

Reviews.Title: “Good location...”
Reviews.Author: jasse_1234
Reviews.Content: Air conditioning didnÂ´t work at all, balcony door didnÂ´t close and when in the shower found out that the bath tub is stuck. For a superior room it was also quite tiny. As we were both busy with meetings the day, we only noticed them faults when going to bed. Next morning asked to change the room to another then. The staff, the lobby and the bar/restaurant are quite nice and the location is really good.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: FemaleTraveller0411
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the weekend, lovely, clean and tidy room/hotel, with beautiful orchids in every available space. One minus was that despite having a "do not disturb" sign on our door, we received a telephone call to ask if we wanted our room cleaned & clean towels supplied. We specifically had the DND sign on the door because we were up at 2:30am on Friday morning for our flight to Amsterdam, spent the whole day sightseeing, having been awake for 24 hours we specifically didnt want to be disturbed on Saturday morning as we intended having a well deserved lie in, however our early morning telephone call ruined that. However, despite that, I wouldn't hesitate to re-visit Park Hotel again, the beds and pillows are so comfy and excellent quality, and the bathroom toiletries are of lovely too.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service! No recommendable !”
Reviews.Author: Pam70
Reviews.Content: I was decided to book in The Toren, but my husband had been in the Park Hotel last year on a Business trip and thought it was better to go to and hotel he already knew. Big mistake! On arrival, we had booked a Superior room and were given a tiny dark room without space to stand, with a small high located window. We returned right away to the front desk were an unhelpful young woman told us that was the Superior (canâ€™t even imagine how is a Standard room here!) and she could upgrade us to a Executive room the next day for 40 EUR. We agreed and moved on the 2nd day. They have even different elevators for the different rooms, the one of first room looked like a cargo elevator! Executive room was bigger, looked cleaner, and was more satisfactory for us. We never had breakfast in the hotel, 24 EUR per person is outrageous! We didnâ€™t use the internet either, 20 EUR per person or device (imagine Blackberry+Computer+Ipad!). We just walked one block to a Starbucks. The location is not nice, totally tourist, surrounded by bad restaurants and bars. On our second day we rented bikes and went to The Toren. We fell in love with that hotel and the location! For the same price we could have a better room, with internet and a buffet breakfast included, in a totally nicer location on the canal!! We got back immediately to the Park Hotel trying to cancel the following nights but again, and unhelpful and rude front desk woman told us they were going to charge us for the hole 4 nights! So we sadly stayed there and booked 3 nights at The Toren to leave Amsterdam with the feeling we had enjoyed our stay, thing that was impossible for us in the Park Hotel, with their hight extra prices for everything, and terrible bad, rude, unattentive and unkind service.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: SouthJerseyTravelbug
Reviews.Content: Traveling with another couple who arrived a couple of days ahead of us, we discovered that the Park Hotel has two very different rooms both considered basic...and for the same price. The older basic rooms are large with a small sofa in the sitting area and a large separate bathroom with a tub. The newer basic rooms are quite small, with a curtain separating the bath area/shower and a door only for the toilet. The older rooms could use a facelift, naturally, while the newer rooms are bight and shiny. We were happy with the extra space and privacy; our friends (once they adjusted to the smallness) were happy with the newness...they felt our room was dreary. It's a trade off and you might want to request one or the other when booking. You can buy minutes on an Internet card here and use it on their computers. Wifi is pricey...it's much cheaper to walk down to Starbucks and enjoy free Wifi with a cup of coffee. Location was good...we were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go. We skipped the restaurant given the high prices and the fact that there were so many terrific, reasonably priced restaurants in the area. We had martinis at the bar, though and liked the energy of the place. Hotel service was adequate. We'd consider a stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Dodgy start but loved this hotel and will definitely be back.”
Reviews.Author: Hazells
Reviews.Content: We booked the Split Level Loft Suite and based our choice on photos on the hotel website. On arriving at the hotel we were taken to a split level suite that only had one window, unlike like the advertised photos which had two large french windows. As such, the room we were initially given was MUCH smaller than expected and quite claustrophobic. We telephoned reception from the room to say that we were far from happy and were quite prepared to leave immediately and search for an alternative hotel. Luckily we noticed the door to a neighbouring room was open as the room was being cleaned. On peering through the open door it was clear that it was the room we thought we had booked. The staff on reception were not very helpful, telling us there was no other room available and there was nothing they could do about it. We then spoke to a member of staff who happened to walk into the reception area who we discovered was the food and beverages manager by the name of Joost (spelling?) who turned out to be our saviour! He was so helpful, nothing was too much to ask, and he went out of his way to ensure that we were given the room we believed we had booked. We had to wait a little while for the room to be ready but it was worth it. We sat in reception, with Joost telling us to order as many drinks as we liked while we waited and that they were on him. We can't speak highly enough of Joost, we were watching him potter about in the reception area and it was clear that this was a man who only cared about the experience of the guests whilst in the hotel, fully prepared to get stuck in and sort out things that were outside of his remit. Bram van der Hoek.....give Joost a substantial pay rise! To sum up, our stay at the hotel was nothing but pleasurable. The room was beautiful, THE MOST comfortable bed EVER, like sleeping in a cloud! The facilities, i.e. the gym, are outstanding, the food in the restaurant, MOMO, is exceptional as are the cocktails in the bar, even though it takes an age to get served, but this is because the bar is evidently very popular with the local 'beautiful' people!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: yehiaCairo
Reviews.Content: great hotel, amazing location, staff and room, recommended

Reviews.Title: “TRUE REVIEW OF THE PARK HOTEL AMSTERDAM”
Reviews.Author: ccfceuropesNO1
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 4 day trip at the Park Hotel. The hotel is everything you could want from a 4star hotel. Its very clean and modern and in a great location for all of Amsterdams attractions,especially shopping,bars and resturants. We stayed in what seemed like the "older" side of the hotel.This side has no double glazing and overlooking a very busy main road can be very noisy at times. Directly oppersite the hotel are some lovely bars/resturants including an Irish Bar and Hard Rock Cafe,these were lovely to sit outside and watch the world go by. Although we never ate in the hotel the new modern bar and resturant always looked quite busy with regulars and guests. One small gripe we did have was that the shuttle service to the airport which was offered by the hotel was GREATLY over priced.We took the tram to central station and caught the direct train service to the airport,total journey time was approx 30mins and saved ourselves quite a bit of money!!! Overall we would most definatly stay at the park hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent hotel, OUTSTANDING restaurant”
Reviews.Author: NelsonTB
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Hotel for a three day city break to Amsterdam. It is ideally situated being close to the best designer shops and some good restaurants & bars, whilst at the same time a good distance away from Amstedam's seedier areas. The hotel is modern, light, airy and well-kept. Staff were friendly & helpful, particularly at reception. They have a 'living room' around the foyer in which snacks & drinks are served which is pretty good. However, if staying here (or for that matter anywhere in Amsterdam) a visit to Momo, the hotel restaurant is an absolute must. Yes, it is expensive, but you certainly get what you pay for here. Try the beautiful lobster & mango sushi roll or the perfectly cooked teriyaki fillet steak. The only complaint we had with the hotel was that, on our first full day, our room was not serviced until 5.15pm, but this was sorted by the next day. Overall, I would recommend and return to the Park Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Holiday_3335
Reviews.Content: Great hotel right next to the vondelpark, the rijksmuseum is about a 15 minute walk but was no problem as was Dam square but you can also get the number 5 tram that stops just down the road from the hotel. Lovely big room overlooking the canal, really comfy bed. Breakfast was nice with a choice of hot and cold food was in a buffet style. Staff friendly and helpful would most definitely return, couldn't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lici3
Reviews.Content: Very well located Hotel, close to all. Very clean but small rooms. Front Desk personel not too helpful like others hotel I have been. No Free Wifi.

Reviews.Title: “To the General Manager at Park Hotel Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: hanne_ns
Reviews.Content: Dear Bram van der Hoek, Too late we have read the bad reviews your hotel has received here at tripadviser.com. All we can do is agreeing with all your dissatisfied guests and conclude that your hotel is not doing anything with the complaints. To sum it all up: the shower flooded/leaked into the toilet floor, the room had a bad smell, the reception staff were not helpful and very rude. They did not communicate with each other and certainly not with us. Good service seams to be words unknown to them, and we even heard one of them making a rude comment about us. Whilst being out someone had been to our room opening bottles from our mini bar. Complaining to the reception staff about this was not doing any good, just feeling that they did not believe us. Altho we received the apologizing "personal" letter from you, the words written there now seams very poor, as we now understand that it is a standard letter, very similar to the replies we see you have posted here.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room and foyer, expensive internet and dangerous steps!”
Reviews.Author: JayBones
Reviews.Content: My wife and i arrived just after 7pm and checked in to the hotel. It seemed quite busy but we got straight to the desk very quickly. The young lady seemed very busy but quickly asked how our flight was and efficiently checked us in. It wasn't the warmest greeting we have had on our Europe trip but I'll put it down to how busy they were at that particular moment. We got quite a nice room on the top floor which over looked some of the surrounding buildings, not the canal which was ok as I didn't pay for or request a canal view. The room itself was very nice with bar a very comfy queen sized bed, LCD TV which got quite a few English speaking channels, safe and bar fridge. The room and bathroom were both very nice. You are able to get both wired and wireless internet in your room. For a price. For a ridiculously expensive price. It was around 24 euro for 24 hours! What the! It's 2011 and it is just unacceptable for this sort of extortion. One word of warning when leaving the Park Hotel. Watch the steps when leaving the hotel. There are only three steps, but when we left to get breakfast in town prior to checking out I used the little steps instead of taking the ramp which we would normally do. There had been some rain the night before and as I went to stand on the middle of the three steps, which I hadn't noticed was very small, my foot slipped out from under me and I was able to just put my hand down under me before my butt collided with the steps. Unfortunately my hand got a lot of skin torn from it by the steps. Luckily I am fairly fit person and was able to save myself from getting seriously hurt, as a simple slip and fall onto concrete can cause serious damage. The doorman saw what had happened and showed a lot of concern for my welfare. He told that this is a very common occurrence and has seen someone very seriously hurt on those very steps. He insisted I let them know at the reception desk and I said I would when I checked out. So, when checking out I let the young lady know of my little mishap, as I didn't really consider it a big deal, but thought it really needed to be highlighted before someone was seriously hurt on them. The young lady at the reception desk didn't seem that concerned when I told her my story, showed her my hand and told her what the doorman had told me. Eventually she gave a half hearted sorry and finished checking me out.. I bumped into the doorman on the way out and he asked how I was. I filled him in on the lack of interest and concern during check out and he told me to email the management later on. So big thumbs up to the doorman and a thumbs down to the check out personnel. Apart from the crazy internet fees I'd highly recommend this very suave hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: malvern09
Reviews.Content: Before we arrived I was a bit worried by comments on room size. Our room was small, but seemed to have been well thought out to make the best use of the space. Decor was very modern and stylish, with a lovely comfortable bed. The public areas were also very contemporary, but looked very comfortable - wish we'd had more time to enjoy them. Staff very friendly & helpful. Right next to the major museums and upmarket shopping, and tram stop just around the corner. Excellent value via Expedia - a stylish place like this would cost a fortune in London!

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: Tiredeastcoaster
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at this hotel. The room was incredibly tiny with a soft twin bed. The room felt like a bathroom with a twin bed at one end. The room was also on the fifth floor, and the elevator only goes to the 4th floor. For a part of the evening, the elevator was broken, and there was no way up to the room other than climbing 5 flights. I would never stay here again and I would never recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “fine by me”
Reviews.Author: Joe_petr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two weeks back myself and two friends. The only bad thing i can say about this hotel is i booked for one king or queen size bed and they gave me two singles for one person staying in the room and they told me this was a upgrade. The hotel was modern close to everything you can pretty much walk everywhere within 15 min shopping night life and so on. The room was fairly small but the bed as small as it was a very good sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Shoebox rooms and they have the nerve to charge for Internet”
Reviews.Author: JMCToronto
Reviews.Content: First let's start with the good....GREAT location, museums, shopping, canel cruises as 5 minutes walk from the hotel. The design of the public areas of the hotel are fantastic, the restaurant great an the staff while slightly aloof were helpful. When I was shown my expensive room I was stunned....shoebox is an understatement. The bathroom was fantastic though an at times seemed almost was large a the room....it was all black, large soaker tub etc. The room itself was so cramped I could not even pull the chair out from the desk to actuall use the desk because the chair and desk were crammed so close to the bed. Also the carpet was filthy with dirt, bits of paper and stains, the white walls of the room were marked and dirty. I know the Hotel is going to respond with "this is Europe and an historic building excuses, however now that I am done my trip I have stayed in several boutique hotels in historic buildings in northern Europe and the rooms were in some cases double the size for the same cost.
