To add insult to injury the hotel actually has the nerve to charge for Internet....again no other hotel I stayed at for the time I was in northern Europe charged for Internet

Reviews.Title: “Not worth of the money!”
Reviews.Author: coupleonholidays
Reviews.Content: Very bad quality to price ratio! The "superior double-room" offers a strip of about 80 cm (100 cm at the window side) around the bed. The decoration cover on the bed is unbelievably dirty and shows more than 10 stains, that makes you believe, that it has not been washed for a month. Extras are very expensive: breakfast 24 Euro/P., Internet access 20 Euro/24h!! This hotel tries to be a business hotel, it is that expensive like business standard, but it is not worth of the money.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, 4 stars ?”
Reviews.Author: StephenHavill
Reviews.Content: 4 stars yes maybe, but to describe a room as superior when the shower and toilet cubicles (cupboards) are screned off by a curtain is stretching it a bit. If you must stay here book direct, go for the full ensuite facilities and don't go through a tour operator.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, will come again!”
Reviews.Author: jonandcass
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great! Lovely modern rooms and a close walk to many places e.g Van Gough museum, Heineken museum and red light district. Good service too! There is a nice park across the road (walk left outside of hotel) which was nice to relax in on a hot day! Would recommend this place and reasonably priced compared to many others.

Reviews.Title: “40th Birthday Surprise”
Reviews.Author: sausagemeister
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two night stay at the Park Hotel. It was fabulous, clean, modern, upmarket and the staff were very pleasant and helpful. Did not eat in the restuarant as this was too expensive. The bathroom layout or rather lack of it - as it is just a shower curtain separating the bed from the washing facilities - was the only down side to this hotel. I would definately stay here again. The location is great next to Leidseplein which is great for a night out. We would definately recommend getting a boat ride from across the hotel, and the place to eat are Bagel & Beans (6 euros each) - delicious as we booked room only and we ate at Sampurna near the Flower Market - expensive but lovely Indonesian food - worth a treat 30 euro per person without drinks. To travel from the airport either get the train and then tram no. 5 approx 15 euros per couple or get the No. 197 bus direct to Hobbemastraat which is 2 mins walks away and cost 4 euros per person. We've had an excellent time and would highly recommend this hotel and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Amsterdam visit”
Reviews.Author: badgertravelers
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Park Hotel for 4 nights while visiting Amsterdam this April and found the location to be great. We were within easy walking distance to most of the museums, great restaurants, Vondel Park. Very close to 2 tram stops. We stayed in the older section in an updated room. Beds are very comfortable with very nice linens. Great bathroom with heated tile floor! Only negatives are that the restaurant on site is very expensive and internet is not free.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, would love to return!”
Reviews.Author: bandannaUk
Reviews.Content: This hotel really made our holiday and I would definitely stay again. The location was ideal, opposite Leidesplein which was a lovely lively square, and walking distance to the very centre, or a short tram ride if you don't fancy the walk. The hotel staff were really friendly and helpful, thanks to you all for making our stay. The room was really stylish and modern, like the rest of the building. I really would say this was one of my favourite hotels ever.

Reviews.Title: “Chic modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarahlou12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Hotel in Feb 11 for 3 nights. First impressions of the hotel were very good the lobby is lovely really chic & modern, at check in the guy at the desk gave me a little bag of heart shapped chocs as it was valentines day I thought this was lovely! The room was very modern with a fab rain shower that we really loved, the bed was a double with a headboard with lights that you could change the colour of, there was aslo a mini bar in the room. Breakfast was amazing so much to choose from really fresh too, the breakfast room is in MOMO restaurant & the decor is so cool, colourful & modern, although we didnt eat at the hotel judging by the breakfast it would prob have been amazing! The hotel also has a gym & fitness centre where you can hire trainers if you have forgotten yours! Would def reccommend the Park Hotel & Amsterdam for a fun break!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for weekend in Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: TravelAddict3000
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a perfect location! Vondelpark right next door, museum down the road, and canal cruise across the street. Room service rocks too.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Modern hotel for seeing Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: PhillyMatty
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled with a group of friends to visit Amsterdam and could not be happier with the hotel that we choose. The Park hotels is conveniently located in the quieter museum district and right next to the number 5 tram line which goes direct to the central station. The hotel was clean, modern, and well staffed. I would definitely stay here again. My only note is to be careful of the 2pm check-in which is often incorrectly posted as 1pm on most travel booking sites. We arrived early but the staff was very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Location excellent, customer service poor”
Reviews.Author: jo1963
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with friends originally to escape the Royal wedding, only to find it was Queens Day in Amsterdam on the Saturday. What a way to celebrate & how well they do it. Like Nottingham Carnival on a 'large' scale.....The hotel was disappointing. On the positive side, it was only approx 4 tram stops from Dam Square so location is good.. The female staff at the hotel are rather intimidating & not very friendly, but the male staff extremely helpful. Rooms are not very big & not a good layout so make it feel cramped. The shower is excellent but the toilet is just another shower cubicle, so not very appealing in the room with just a calico curtain in front of it for privacy. We asked for a canal view room but were not given one, but on staying there we know it would have been very noisy so maybe they did us a favour. Beds were soft & not good for a bad back if you needed support. Complimentary tea/coffee was poor, only 2 tea bags/coffee sachets each & asking for more was frowned on. Also only powdered milk & when asking for fresh the receptionist wanted to charge us for room Service. For location I would recommend this hotel but for atmosphere and customer service I would not.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing customer service !! Great stay !!”
Reviews.Author: Suilin11
Reviews.Content: Arrived at hotel to be told we had a free upgraded to a room with a split level !! Room was lovely, the beds were incredibly soft and the staff were so kind. I really can't fault anything with the park hotel I highly recommend it !!!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean and stylish”
Reviews.Author: cheshirecat2000
Reviews.Content: The hotel reception area and rooms were as they appeared in the pictures - very clean, modern and stylish. My boyfriend and I have booked an executive double / twin and unfortunately were allocated a twin room. We asked to be moved to a double and were told that we would need to wait until the following day when a room became available (no apology). The reception staff informed us that a porter would move the beds together, however, we returned to our room to find it just as we had left it. We pushed the beds together but one was much higher than the other so it wasn't the most comfortable night's sleep - especially not for nearly Â£200 per night! The following day we moved to a double room which was much better and exactly as we had expected. When checking out the repepctionist advised that we would need to settle the room bill and listed items that we'd not consumed. When we said we'd not had anything she advised that there were no receipts so the items would be removed from our bill - no apology for the error and pretty much making us feel that we were getting off from paying for something we'd not had. All in all the Park is a good hotel and the staff are generally friendly, but an apology here and there for the things that aren't quite right would have made the difference between an okay hotel and a very good one.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty average for a four star - definitely nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Janeyblack
Reviews.Content: All in all a great location and a pleasant stay, but sadly there is nothing that makes this hotel stand out from the crowd. It's modern and quite funky, but it is looking a little worn around the edges in places. Hotel rooms are notoriously small in Amsterdam and this hotel is no exception, so we upgraded to a junior suite, just to get a little more space and a bathroom that you could actually swing a cat in. The upgrade was 80 Euro a night - quite pricey for a couple of square metres of extra floor space, but we felt it was worth it not to feel like we were sleeping in a cupboard for 3 nights! Breakfast is apparently 'the most extravagant in Amsterdam' (or something like that according to the hotel advertising posters) - well it was fine for a buffet, very nice actually, but we've had far better in other 4 star hotels, so we're not really sure why they think their breakfast is so special?! Service was very average all round - not much of a smile from any of the reception staff and pretty poor at breakfast time (apart from the lady who signed us in each morning for breakfast - who was lovely and friendly): we observed other guests (thankfully not us) encountering long waits and considerable difficulties when ordering fried eggs instead of the scrambled eggs already cooked and available on the buffet - at one point one morning it took three waiting staff to work out between them how to fry eggs 'sunny side up' and get them to the correct guest who had ordered them 30 minutes previously!! Understandably this particular guest was not amused. There was no fresh (or even UHT) milk in the room for our tea - we kept having to ask for some to take up to our room. And the maximum number of English breakfast tea bags we were given at any one time was two - annoying if we wanted a cup of tea in the evening and then one in the morning when we woke up. Would it really hurt to give guests an ample supply of tea bags each day??! If you stay at this hotel be prepared for traffic noise - the hotel is in a great location for all the sights but it is on a very busy road and our windows were only single glazed (with rather a draught whistling through them in places - thank goodness it wasn't winter!). It didn't bother us too much, but if you want peace and quiet you should definitely choose another hotel. One thing that particularly bugged us was the 20 Euro daily charge for the use of the internet. Having upgraded to a junior suite, we really weren't prepared to pay another 20 Euros each day to use the internet. Totally and utterly scandalous inour opinion. When my husband expressed his discontent about this to a member of the reception staff, he was told - " All four and five star hotels in Amsterdam charge for use of the internet so we are only doing what everyone else does". What crazy logic! Our advice to The Park Hotel management team is . . . DARE TO BE DIFFERENT! You never know, it might just make you stand out from the crowd, get you a few more customers and increase your positive ratings on TripAdvisor! You could certainly do with them. Upon checking out, we were asked - "Has everything been to your satisfaction during your stay ?" We told the (very miserable) girl that it had all been ok but that there were a few things that we were a little disappointed with (one being that the phone in our room wasn't working - which meant we couldn't contact reception from our room and had to walk downstairs each time we wanted to speak to someone - we told them the phone wasn't working but no one bothered to fix it!). The girl on reception just nodded - she didn't ask us what could've been better about our stay and just gave us our bill. It's such a shame when customer service is poor like this - it really leaves a bitter taste and is so easily remedied and unnecessary. Some people just take no pride in their work. We'll definitely return to Amsterdam (a fabulous, vibrant city full of generally very friendly and really helpful people), but we wont be going back to The Park Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Edge of Darkness”
Reviews.Author: michaelcham1
Reviews.Content: If you don't mind staying in the dark - the lighting in The Park Hotel is truly awful and can stand the noise of revellers outside the hotel until 4am, plus enjoy not having enough space to store your clothes - one hanging closet in a junior suite for 5 nights - and are over 5t 6inches tall (the minimum height by which you can lift coat hangers from said closet) then this hotel is for you. It certainly isn't for us. And as an added incentive ask about their sheet changing policy - every THREE days ! We hoped the saving grace would be the MOMO restaurant which is uber trendy and also uber expensive. Take out a mortgage on the lobster but sadly we found it rubbery. Back to the Marriott !

Reviews.Title: “Form wins over function - unfortunately...”
Reviews.Author: DaisyHastings
Reviews.Content: As anyone reading these comments will have spotted, the reviews differ depending on what kind of package you are on. We had one to include breakfast which was generally brilliant (the scrambled egg could have been hotter) â€“ we ate about four courses each and that filled us up for the rest of the day, but even so we would have baulked at paying 25 euro each for it separately. It appears that the bathroom problems previously reported come from the type of room we were in â€“ a â€œsuperiorâ€� ie the basic room. The trouble is that someone thought how stylish it would be to have freestanding shower and toilet cubicles, without actually considering the practicalities. Cubicles do not protect the other occupants of the room from noises and smells whilst they are in use, and there was no extractor fan to clear any pong lingering afterwards. The toilet cubicle also smelt badly of stale urine and clearly was not cleaned properly, and the overall structure was so small that when standing up from a sitting position one almost inevitably banged one's head on the wall. The shower had two sprayheads, one fixed, and once we worked out how to use it it was not bad, good water pressure and temperature. However, there was nowhere to easily dry towels eg if two of you had a shower in the same morning. The bed was comfortable although the duvet was rather too warm (and this was in March!) but again, the designer had not thought hard enough about the lighting which was appalling. Each side of the bed had its own little bendy LED light which meant that instead of throwing out light, it was directed (eg onto your book) and gave the impression of reading by torchlight. There was a spotlight at the top of the wall to one side of the bed which was angled so as to blind you when you turned it on if you were still in bed, and the lighting for the bathroom mirror was useless (including the illuminated shaving mirror which did not illuminate). We had a room looking out over the main road (the Stadhouderskade) and the tram bells were a bit noisy, plus the people who decided to honk their car horns at 4.30am were annoying, but overall the noise wasn't too bad. The windows were also a bit drafty but again, not really a problem for us. Plus points in the room â€“ a real hairdryer, and the curtains blacked out fully. There were tea/coffee facilities (kettle, cups etc) in the wardrobe but we did not use these, nor the minibar in the fridge. Plenty of wooden coathangers but not a great deal of storage space for clothes if you are staying more than a few days. Like others we only had breakfast in Momo but it did look very busy â€“ there are, however, hundreds of good places to eat near the hotel of an evening. The location is good, far enough away from the city centre for peace and quiet but near to museums, shops, and so on â€“ let's face it, you can walk pretty much anywhere in Amsterdam! We caught the 197 bus from the airport to very near the Rijksmuseum and the Park Hotel is just a short walk. The staff were helpful and the hotel itself is very stylish, with a lovely â€œliving roomâ€� area in the lobby with designer seating, loads of books to read and beautiful art and sculptures to enjoy. I would probably stay at the Park again as long as breakfast was included, but next time I'd go for a room with a properly separate bathroom!

Reviews.Title: “very nice...but”
Reviews.Author: sezgin70
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the park hotel in april 2011 for 3 nights. i asked at the desk if we can have canal-view room, we got one by paying â‚¬20/night. it is a very nice place to stay, it's just next to the rijk and van gogh museom, and the area is just beautiful, the tram is around the corner. with few words : position of the hotel was great. we had no breakfast, so i can't say anything about this, we prefer to sleep bit longer and have breakfast somewhere in a nice bar. the only negative thing was the BED, the matress was tooo soft. i asked at the frontdesk if all beds in the hotel were similar....well, unfortunately yess. anyway , the bed-thing is a personel thing. so, i can truely suggest the hotel to evrybody.

Reviews.Title: “breakfast is extra - but great”
Reviews.Author: TravellingHappily
Reviews.Content: Smart, very clean, a little pricey (although not for Amsterdam). My room was overlooking the canal, on a busy road; the view was ok, but the road noise and noise from the bars on the other side of the canal did disturb my sleep. Buffet style breakfast in the Momo restaurant wasnt included, but was very good, and it is a very pleasant place to eat. The hotel is situated on the edge of the central district, so its just a pleasant stroll into town. Very convenient for the galleries, and Vondel Park; we hired bikes from the hotel for one day, and that was fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: BostonAline
Reviews.Content: My partner and I traveled with my 8 year old daughter. It is normally difficult to find rooms that accommodate 3 in Amsterdam so we were pleased that the Park did. We were offered a nice suite with a king bed and a pull out couch. Bathroom was awesome with shower and tub. Service was great, friendly staff and helpful. We had breakfast included with our stay and it was excellent. The only draw back was the fact that they charged for wii fi. We got a nice rate via Gate 1 travel not through the hotel directly.

Reviews.Title: “Fair”
Reviews.Author: danpb
Reviews.Content: The hotel is kind of outdated: windows in rooms won't work, extremely mini-room, with mini-closet and its mini-bathroom. Very reasonable for what you pay.. *(windows that don't work = no smoking! I wasnÂ´t caught, but Spaniards are often fined at check-out for smoking in the rooms)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Trip to Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: TheSGB
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in February 2011 with my boyfriend, sister and brother-in-law. After booking I was slightly worried as so many of the reviewers seemed to be reporting slight niggles with the room which spoiled their stay and as this trip was to celebrate a milestone birthday I wanted everything to be as perfect as possible. The bathrooms especially sounded less than ideal. I needn't have worried as the executive rooms we had booked had a 'proper' en-suite bathroom as opposed to the leaking walk-in showers in other rooms. The raindance shower was absolutely gorgeous. The rooms were spacious, comfortable and clean. Ours was on the 7th floor with a view down over the canal and the rooftops of Amsterdam. There were no problems with noise. My only criticisms would be that the room was very dark - the lighting seemed inadequate and there were no bedside lights. It was also freezing cold the week we were in Amsterdam and it was difficult to maintain the room temperature - sometimes too cold, sometimes way too hot. The staff we encountered were capable and friendly. However, even though we arrived way after check-in time had started, it did about 15 minutes to assign rooms to us, but I think a full hotel the night before had held things up slightly. The hotel is smart and stylish with a gorgeous lobby area where you can sit and drink cocktails from the bar, sink into comfortable chairs and flick through the endless shelves of coffee table books. A lovely way to end a busy day walking around. The location of the hotel is excellent - close to the museums (my main reason for choosing this hotel). However, nothing is that far away in the centre of Amsterdam. There was even a City boat cruise starting from right outside the hotel which was perfect for our first afternoon. I would recommend this hotel and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Pefect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Gregster71
Reviews.Content: Can't really say much more than has already been said. Comfy beds, great rain shower, modern decor, excellent reception and great value for money. 1st floor room and very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: BERROCA
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 3 Night stay at the Park, perfect, we were upgraded to a Superior Room on arrival , small bathroom and room standard but clean and beds were so comfy Its a perfect location and good value we booked on booking.com, tram 5 min walk around the corner, great bar next door called Mo Mo really trendy food pricey thou I would go back to this hotel staff were very friendly and recommended some great restaurants to us We did not have breakfast in hotel it was too expensive but nice cafe's for good breakfast along the stripe to flower market Be careful if you book the standard room as its open plan - bathroom not private!!!!! Its in a quite area about 20min walk to flower market and great shops along the way

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, not perfect...”
Reviews.Author: TaksaTeckel
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our recent 4 night stay at The Park. This, mostly a clean and comfortable place, is run by a friendly and competent staff. Our room was on the first floor and facing the busy Stadhouderskade, but we did not notice much noise at night at all. We had a disappointing view of The Hard Rock Cafe directly across the canal from the hotel, yet we weren't in Amsterdam to hang out in the hotel room so that did not bother us much. Our room was on the small side, but well laid out and with decent storage areas. The location is nearly perfect, most of the city centre's attractions are within a reasonable walk. We had a few problems with temperature control in the room. Basically, it was either too cold or too warm, no matter how much we fiddled with the heat controls. Also our beds were much too soft and bouncy, with thin, foamy pillow-tops which had the tendency to slide off the beds during the night. We were only given one pillow per bed, but two more pillows were sent when we asked. The breakfast was abundant and good. We wished that they had it going until 11, not 10, but we managed fine. We loved sitting by the street level windows every morning and watching Amsterdamers and tourists whizzing by on their bikes. Momo, the pan-Asian restaurant at the hotel, had lots of delicious choices for a memorable, albeit pricey dinner. Unfortunately, room service seems like an afterthought at The Park. There're only a few, very basic choices like hamburgers, steak and club sandwiches. (Why not offer selections from Momo also?) Our room service dinner was delivered by two people on two hand trays; they did not bring a cart, so it was a little awkward to scramble for some space for them to place the trays. The bottle of white wine we ordered came luke-warm in an un-chilled metal cooler; we couldn't drink it until it was cooled in the mini-bar fridge. The cleaning staff the next day did not know how to handle the glasses and cups left over from the room-service dinner, so they just left them as they were. The mini-bar is decent, but lacked a few basic mixers while offering too much Coke and Sprite. And the mini-bar was not refilled one day, leaving us vodka-less that evening as we were getting ready to go out. Having said all this, I do want to reiterate that overall this was a very nice stay and we would definitely consider The Park on a return trip to beautiful Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Really great service, incredibly comfy beds and great location.”
Reviews.Author: UpNorth2010
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel as it was reccommended to me by my dad who had stayed there 10 years ago and I liked the look of the website. The location was great, right next to the museums and bars and you could walk everywhere. I used the shuttle bus from the airport straight to the hotel and back again at a cost of 25euros. You can do it on public transport and I am sure it would of been cheaper but as I arrived late and I was on my own I played it safe. When I checked in I was told that they had run out of standard rooms and so I had been given a suite (what a shame!). However, I wasn't that impressed with the suite, as all it was was an additional room with a work area in it. I am guessing for business people. But the bed was amazing, really modern bathroom, bottled water, TV with English channels and it was really clean. Unfortunately the room was very noisy (on the street with the trams) and had an external light that shone right into my room (gap between the wall and the curtain). I didn't sleep well at all. But, to the hotel's credit, they moved me straight away to a room further up the hotel and at the back. And they sent me a letter apologising, which I didn't expect. This room was perfect, in the eves, just as beautiful, sofa, TV that moved so you could watch it from the bed or seating area, double sinks in the bathroom. Really lovely. So I was very happy for the remaining 2 nights of my stay. The Living Room area was lovely, with lots of interesting books to read and good wine/coffee/snacks available. Perfect for a few drinks in the evening. I didn't eat in MOMO or have breakfast as the breakfast was 23/25 euros per day. Pretty steep for breakfast. I am curious to hear that other people seem to have had their breakfast included in the price. I looked on lots of websites and couldn't find one that included it. I got a good rate-around 80/90 per night without breakfast on ebookers. I think it was well worth it- especially with the upgrade. On my last morning I was so comfortable in the room I didn't get to have a canal cruise! Never mind! I would definately use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very unfriendly staff and not very helpful and wasn't impressed with the room layout”
Reviews.Author: pma30
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend and a few friends stayed here, and we all found the staff very unapproachable and ignorant. When we checked in first they said they needed 100 euro each for a deposit that we would get back if we don't use anything in minibar etc, so we didnt used anything, they could of told us this before we booked some of us are on a budget as it is. The room we stayed in was the superior double and the shower and toilet are right beside the bed and there is no seperate door into bathroom its very open plan so no privacy at all when using toilet and shower was not very impressed. Also we were woken up every morning with banging and drilling. The decor in the reception area is very modern and funky lots of big sofas and cushions and candles I liked that part only. Its a very expensive city as it is without the hotel charging 5 euro for room service. Then when we where checking out, we were expecting our 100 euros back we all had to pay 10 euro city tax, why couldn't they have told us this when we checked in first. The staff were very rude and I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: Monty2011
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a short valentines get away, after researching four star hotels and found the reviews on tripadvisor promising. On arriving, we found the overall look of the lobby really trendy, modern and there was a buzzing atmosphere with guests checking out and attentive staff. We were two hours early to check in and our room was not available. We were offered an upgrade to a suite for half the price difference at 40 euros but politely declined. This was not a problem as we were able to leave our bags and head out to explore all the sights Amsterdam has to offer. When we returned, we were escorted to our room by a really friendly member of staff who was happy to show us some of the best places to see on a map given to us. We were a little disappointed with the room which was right next to the tram line on the first floor, as when booking we requested to have a quiet room on a high floor. However, it did specify that certain requests may not be available on check in. The room felt a little bit small (but it is Amsterdam) and the open bathroom wasn't to our taste. The wet room floor meant we had to use towels to mop up water, which leaked everywhere after using the shower, a bit of a pain when getting ready for a night out. On a positive note the bed was the one of the comfiest we have ever slept in and the multi colour lights were pretty funky! It was a plus to have a little balcony too. We got a full breakfast included in the room rate which we decided to get sent to the room at 9am at a cost of 3.50 euros. The breakfast was a big let down as it was cold and a few bits were forgotten however, I'm sure this would've been corrected if we had complained. As we wanted to be out and about to make the most of our last few hours in the city, we just made the most of the fruit and pain au chocolat and checked out. Overall, the staff were really helpful, It's a great location for the local attractions such as the Heineken Museum. We thought the price was a little high for a 4 star hotel - for the experience we had.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with helpful and attentive staff.”
Reviews.Author: mjtopping
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 'superior' room for three days and were impressed with the appearance and location of the hotel and the friendliness of the staff. However the room was somewhat disappointing because we expected something special from their website description. The bathroom had a bath but to shower you stand in the bath. We have no idea what they mean about "open with no interior walls". In the restuarant the breakfast choice of hot and cold food was good but there are no warmed plates and the toast and coffee makers were very slow. For other meals we ate out as momo restuarant is very expensive and the nouveau cuisine served did not appeal. The bar only has a few stools around it and you are expected to stand if they are occupied as all the tables are apparently for restuarant users only. Also you cannot choose a size of drink so for a beer you can only get a small one in a flute type glass. Overall, a good hotel for the area but it is very expensive and missing the fine touches expected at the standard it is trying to achieve.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, super nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Nurit1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, nice designed and very comfortable. Service is beyond expectations. The girls at the front desk were always so nice (Cristine and Margaret especially) and willing to help in anything they can! The service at the bar is not very good. Tthe restaurant is delicious, the food is excellent but too expensive for the small dishes. Also the internet is too expensive (19.5 euro x day) We asked for room service and they didn't bring the side dish that was supposed to come, but I am sure that if we would have called them they would have brought it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: traveller2634
Reviews.Content: I booked a weekend away to Amsterdam for my partners 30th birthday in January. We stayed at the Park hotel which was just beautiful. It was the perfect distance away from all the madness Amsterdam has to offer, and it was very close to all the shops which was just what I wanted! The lady at the desk when we checked in was very helpful and friendly. She told us everything we needed to know about the hotel and the area, without us feeling bombarded with info. All in all a wonderful weekend!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - haunted room”
Reviews.Author: ColeenMM
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Park Hotel during a recent conference in Amsterdam. I love the location and the hotel. The room is very modern with the best shower water pressure I've ever encountered in Europe. My room was small yet sufficient for a single occupant who overpacks. I did have two issues with my room that I addressed while there. The hotel did send a nice letter to my room stating they were working on resolving them. They were not resolved during my stay though. The television would turn itself on several times during the night. After several nights of waking up alarmed to someone speaking Dutch at me, I just left the TV on with the volume turned off. MOMO, the hotel restaurant, is excellent. Yes, I will probably stay there again next year. I'll just avoid room 317.

Reviews.Title: “very helpfull”
Reviews.Author: jerseyrock
Reviews.Content: stayed here in november to play in the masters classic of poker at holland casino whitch is only a short stoll away, my room that they gave me was ok but a bit noisey so i asked if the could put me in another whitch they did right away, i cannot fault the service at this hotel, will be back again in november

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and lovely hotel.”
Reviews.Author: alallbutt
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for New Years Eve and the following night. We managed to get checked in early and were delighted with the nice touch of pastries on the check-in desk. All the staff were very helpful and the lady on the front desk rang a number of restaurants to get us a table on New Years Eve. She did this and we had a wonderful meal at The Oyster Bar in Amsterdam a few minutes walk from the hotel. We did not have breakfast at the hotel as it was rather expensive 25 euros each, but there were many little cafes and bars close by which did extremely good breakfasts. New Year in Amsterdam is spectacularly different from anything we have experienced before. Would recommend this hotel to anybody who wants to stay close to the action but not be disturbed by any noise.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: MoniaG
Reviews.Content: We've booked the Park Hotel for a short city break between Xmas and NY. It was a great choice! Fantastic 4 star hotel in a great location. Walking distance to all main attractions and city centre, around 10 -15 mins. We have upgraded our room to the executive one and it was worth it! Comfortable bed, nice bathroom and a fab view of the canal. The hotel's lobby is stunning. Very trendy and cosy. The fireplace is absolutely beautiful and you can relax while enjoying your glass of wine or a snack. Staff were very helpful,polite and friendly. We did not have breakfast or dinner at the hotel so cannot really say anything about food but the Momo restaurant looked very inviting so we might try it one day. I can recommend this hotel to everyone and I will be definitely staying there when I visit Amsterdam again.

Reviews.Title: “Really comfortable hotel...great place for business or leisure”
Reviews.Author: Mike_in_Oxford_UK
Reviews.Content: I cam here for a two day business meeting and was very impressed. The rooms were spacious and the bed was comfortable. The bathrooms were fantastic - in particular the shower - which made for a good start to the day. The location is fantastic for museums, shopping and restaurants - while it is a 10-15 minute walk to Dam square, it is less than 5 minutes to the Leidesplein and the Vondelpark is just across the road. For any Rembrandt or van Gogh fanatics, it is less than 5 minutes walk in the other direction to the Rijksmuseum and the van Gogh museum. The downsides relate to a couple of pet peeves of mine - a substantial fee for use of the internet (why do business hotels do this - just incorporate this into the room rate please!) and the requirement to use an ironing room if in a standard room. Why ironing rooms still exist in a hotel as nicely renovated as the Park Hotel is still a mystery - on a business trip the last thing that you want to do is to trek to a different part of the hotel to iron your shirts. Also, some rooms catch a lot of noise from the trams - but this is the flip side of the great location. Finally, the 3/5 for service is due to the internet fee and the ironing room, not the staff - they were uniformly excellent. All in all, I would definitely stay there again and encourage others to do so as well.

Reviews.Title: “Unreasonable”
Reviews.Author: Netballerannie Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: My stay was cancelled as the snow prevented the flight leaving the Uk. Although the booking was an advance booking there was no flexibility offered by the hotel. They offered an alternative date but I had only a few hours to decide. I couldn't do that as I would have had to book time off work and a flight to coincide. Thought they were very unreasonable in the circumstances and lost my money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice interior but service needs a bit of a revamp.”
Reviews.Author: sarah12091980
Reviews.Content: The hotel is modern in design and it was pleasant to walk into the lobby on our first day. The rooms are nice and very clean. Beds were comfy and decor is fine. We didn't eat in MOMO but it did look appealing. The downside to our stay was the customer service at times, however this did seem to be a theme in Amsterdam, in general. The dutch service culture is rather brusque and unhelpful at times, however there was an older lady on the desk Â who checked us in and out who was excellent and very polite. Â Our annoyance came when we decided to visit the hotel lobby for a drink, which does boast that it could be treated as your own living room during your stay. This was true indeed as nobody served us a drink at all which would be the case in my own living room.Â  After twenty minutes of sitting by the fire and trying to catch someone's attention, my husband had to approach the front desk. This was at 7.20 pm. We did then, thankfully, get a drink each. Â At 8.10 we thought we might have one more, seeing as it said in their menu that the service was available until 8.30. Plenty of time, I thought.Â  We couldn't see anyone so I approached the reception desk and asked and the girl there told me that the service had finished. I did say that I thought this was rather poor when it said otherwise on their menu but she said again that it was closing. Â The girl on the desk did then get on the phone to get someone to come but I was so fed Â up that my husband I decided to call it a night. The girl on reception then looked rather put out.Â  We thought we'd order room service but they even put a 3.5 euro charge on this too! Something which isn't actually stated in their room service info- it is, however, in the Dutch version from what I could make out. Internet use is extremely expensive at 19.50 euro for 24 hours. That's about the most expensive I've seen around the world!!! Â Most good hotels give you so much time for free. Breakfast was a jaw dropping 25 euros and that was not even for a full English. The hotel does give you a gracious 5euro voucher off breaksfast but, my goodness, Â£20 for breakfast!?! No thanks. I know the exhange rate doesn't help but all the same... It is not a bad hotel at all but there are times when you do feel as if it's trying to be something it isn't. For example you're meeting staff pulling cages of towels and washing out of the lifts and, on several floors, cages of towels are left out on the landings.Â  We didn't get hand towels at times and I thought it was appallingly wasteful that we got a new bar of soap every day. If guests are staying a number of nights, why not leave the same bar of soap in the dish and a fresh one in a packet do they can choose? Â  Â  Â  Â  Other than that and the less than average service at reception at times, we did have a nice time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location ideal for exploring”
Reviews.Author: mike_tay
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Hotel on our annual Christmas get together and we were not disappointed . We made the mistake of catching the train from the airport if there are 4 of you you are better off taking a taxi its cheaper and less hassle. Check in at the hotel was smooth, we were travelling with elderly mothers and the room layout was a little bit open plan but we had them moved into the newer part of the hotel a perfect room with lovely views of the canal. we found the lobby to be relaxing the bar menu excellent and the staff friendly , we never ate in MoMo's but it looked and smelt amazing, we had two meals out one at the Seasons (Dutch Food) and the other at Bella Draga a great place to eat were the waiters sing to you for both you need to book. The Hotel was idealy place for the hop on hop off water bus and is within walking distance to the trams that take you to Dame Square. if we return to Amsterdam we would stay at the Park.

Reviews.Title: “Soulless and pointless”
Reviews.Author: moffifox
Reviews.Content: My god, I know the Dutch are easy going and chilled out but the staff at the Park Hotel are like zombies!!! Arrived on business and the old obligatory room deposit is taken off my card. I get it! People leave in the middle of the night and don't pay so this was fine. But not when they take three weeks money out instead of four nights. Idiots. The breakfast is a generic mass made and tasteless, the room was like being flashed back to the 70s with brown carpets and a cream wall. I didn't know hotels still did single beds. I didn't think they still made them. I'm 6 foot and an adult but the zombie at the front desk decided to give me a room with two single beds separated by a a fixes cabinet so I couldn't push them together!!!! I felt like I was seven again. This is a business hotel. The Park Hotel shouldn't still be in business. Horrible soulless place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, friendly staff, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelerTibo
Reviews.Content: Park Hotel has one of the best locations in town, right in between museums, music halls, bars, restaurants, and near the park of course. Amsterdam hotels usually don't have big rooms, and this one is no exception, but our room was big enough for the 2 of us. The decoration is sleek and modern, the beds comfy (once you get used to the memory foam mattress), and all looks clean and very new. My biggest concern with the room was the surrounding noise. The water pipes were making some loud rattling sounds during the night (mind you, it was VERY cold outside!) and the air conditioning system outside was also noisy. On top of that, the nearby elevator and the room next door were not very quiet either. The bathroom door is in tainted glass, which can be surprising at first, but still assured privacy. The rain shower was excellent, but taller people (from about 1.85 m) might have to bend a bit to fit under it! The staff was very friendly and courteous, the lobby is a nice place to hang around by the fireplace or next to the library. The breakfast was excellent, and if it's not included in your room rate, make sure to ask for the 5â‚¬ discount during check-in! If you wish to have dinner at the hotel, their restaurant, Momo, is very popular at weekends so make sure to book in advance... There are several other excellent, well located hotels of the same category in Amsterdam, but I'd definitely recommend to include this one to your shortlist!

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, trendy bar, great location -not stuffy but good standards”
Reviews.Author: thislinda
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay here -we had a superior room and everything was lovely. Tea and coffee in rooms, super layout, lovely bathroom. A very nice bar to have a drink in later in evening and the restaurant looked good although we ate out and about. View of the canal was very pleasant and it is close to the fashion shops, cafes, museums etc. Staff were friendly and helpful. I think it was probably worth the upgrade for the larger bathroom and room space. We would stay again ;)

Reviews.Title: “small and noisy rooms”
Reviews.Author: riva97
Reviews.Content: wW stayed in 2 superior rooms on the third floor. Modern (renovated) but small. Likewise for the bathroom (a novotel type of size). Nothing special here. This renovated hotel is situated on a very central location. The lobby is trendy with design furniture. Most of the staff is not customer focused and unpleasant (at registering I really hit the jack pot). Sleeping was impossible because they put us at the street side and the lack of proper double glass made it look like staying at the centre of the cross road just below our rooms. between (police) cars on their way to an emergency. Lucky for us, as of 4.30 am, the night life started to shift into the day life so we could catch up some lost hours. Breakfast was supposed to be one of the most elaborated ones in Amsterdam. Hard to believe: standard offer, dried out scrambled eggs (you know the ones in those big trays), standard meat you can buy in any discounter, cheap dutch chocolates, nothing special about this at all. Interesting to notice that the trendy restaurant MOMO where breakfast was served, was completely worn out. The chairs were dirty (food stuff from the night before) and what used to be missoni covered kartell chairs were still kartell (since plastic) but the missoni cover was at various seats torn apart (at some leather seats by the way the covers were demoslished and destroyed on the side but nobody noticed or aparently feels the need to renovate).

Reviews.Title: “Dam good service!”
Reviews.Author: Gazmanchester
Reviews.Content: I stayed her with a friend and was really impressed. One of the best check-inâ€™s Iâ€™ve experienced with very helpful staff that are quite rightly proud of their hotel and their city. We had a 6th floor room that overlooked the canal and was very modern with plenty of space for the two of us. There was a locked door that opened onto a small balcony which we were not sure if we were able to have had opened, as fresh air in the room would have been nice. Breakfast was ok. However, we came down about 20 minutes before closing and got the feeling that the staff in the restaurant wished we hadnâ€™t. We were reminded about four times that they would soon be closing and most of the items both hot and cold hadnâ€™t been replenished. That aside, we were really impressed with the overall level of service throughout the hotel along with the location and the general ambience they had achieved. Weâ€™ll certainly return when we visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location, and outstanding service.”
Reviews.Author: jnobleband
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with the Park Hotel in Amsterdam. The bedrooms have AIR CONDITIONING, which is very important in the summer. (Many European hotels do not have A/C, and if you're unlucky enough to arrive during a hot spell you can nearly suffocate). The beds were surprisingly soft and plush, considering that this is a European hotel. The bed was the most comfortable I've slept on in any of the European hotels where I've stayed. I really don't have anything negative to input regarding the hotel. The concierge was so kind. He even brought us up some ice when we asked for it...something that other hotels around Europe would never do. The rooms have a really nice, modern feel, and our room overlooked some beautiful scenery. The location is excellent if you want to be in Amsterdam without being next to any of the louder places. Everything was within walking distance or a short train ride. Finally, the price was great! It was offered at about the same price as 3 star hotels during the time I stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: oldbean98
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near Vondelpark close to the Museum Quarter and is conveniently located a few minutes from the lively Leidesplein which makes travelling around Amsterdam using the city's efficient tram system easy. Also close by are a good range of cafÃ©s, bars and restaurants, they were however far enough away not to be a nuisance when trying to sleep. We had the executive room for our three night stay which overlooked the canal and featured ambient room lighting, a fantastic rain shower and a very comfortable Jensen bed. The room was clean, the hotel staff were pleasant and helpful when called upon.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel........I'll be back soon!”
Reviews.Author: jamieg88
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights with my girlfriend in Spetember, upon our arrival we were checked in to one of the standard double rooms, however the air conditioning was not working and a rather unpleasant smell coming from the drainage system, upon notifiying the staff they instantly upgraded us to a much larger room free of charge! On top of that, the hotel is in a fantastic location and a great slection of bars & restaurants within a few minutes walk. The only downside of my visit to Amsterdam was paying a 150Euro car parking charge in a local car park for a 2day stay, a word of warning.....pre book the hotel car park, much cheaper! I will however be back to this hotel soon!

Reviews.Title: “Mostly good, just a few flaws”
Reviews.Author: somax
Reviews.Content: My husband booked Park on a business trip, and I tagged along with our 15 month old daughter. They gave us a bigger room and supplied a good cot, which was a big plus. Staff were friendly and room service was good. The only things lacking were the drainage in the bathroom, which caused the shower to flood every time we had one (and they were short!), and the fact that we were down a flight of stairs which we had to lug the stroller up and down. We also had to fill in a breakfast card to order breakfast every morning, and we had to ring to request one every day (plus breakfast started at 7am - this is late with an infant!) But overall, it was a comfortable and trendy hotel just around the corner from the Rijksmuseum - made it easy to beat the queues and be one of the first in the door!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and amazing beds!”
Reviews.Author: KareBear26
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 3 night stay at the Park Hotel and wish we could have stayed longer! After a long day of traveling the beds felt like heaven and we slept like babies, it was almost too comfortable, I could have stayed in bed all 3 days. I wish I could have brought the bed home! We got a superior room on the 5th floor, it was quiet and comfortable. We're from the US and saw a lot of reviews complaining about the room size but we didn't think it was bad and found it easy to open up our bags and spread out all our stuff, besides it's a hotel room, it doesn't need to be huge. We went to Paris from here and our room there was much smaller. The hotel is in a great location with tons of restaurants, shops and museums close by, not to mention the beautiful Vondel Park. The Hard Rock across the canal was a let down, there are better Hard Rock's in other locations, don't waste your money. We never ate the breakfast at the hotel it seemed a bit expensive and Momo was always packed so we didn't eat there either but like I said there are a ton of great places near by. I can't remember the names of the streets but across the canal and a block or two down there's a big square and a main road the #5 tram goes down. There you'll find the Hoopman Irish pub - Amazing, Pancake Corner - Amazing, down the main street is Wok to Walk - Amazing, B&B Lunchroom - Amazing (get the waffle with strawberries) and just off the main street is Bagels and Beans - Amazing (I had the best latte there). We only took the tram to get to the hotel from the airport and to get to Central Station, otherwise everything was in walking distance and that or renting a bike is a great way to experience this beautiful city. Ever person we met there was so friendly! I highly recommend the canal cruise thats across the street from the hotel, we did that our first night there. The red light is a must too although it's super touristy, it's almost like visiting Disneyland but for obvious reasons...different. What I found really neat and a bit ironic was there were a ton of swans swimming in the canal in the Red Light. When we checked out we still had a lot of time before our train to Paris so the hotel held our bags for us. What's also nice is you can buy your museum tickets at the hotel so you can bypass some of the long lines! We also read a lot of reviews about the bathroom flooding when you take a shower and I'm so confused, it never flooded once for us, the shower was great and the tub was really deep and so nice after a long day of walking. I guess the only thing I didn't like about this hotel was no free wifi. I think it was something like 20 euros for 24 hours of wifi which I thought was expensive and not worth it. We were able to connect to free wifi at the Hoopman Irish Pub so we checked our email there.

Reviews.Title: “From hell to heaven... what a big difference”
Reviews.Author: kachapka
Reviews.Content: Booked a superior room for 4 nights. Hotel rates were extremely expensive 'cuz it was the IBC week. We checked in a tiny tiny room on the first floor, no room to open a suitcase and we were in a confined space and couldn't relax in the room. Next day, we asked and paid extra Euro 60/day to get an upgrade to their honeymoon suite (located on the 5th floor, the room at the tower). What a big difference!!!! spacious, bright with 5 big windows, great view, free water replenishment and comfy bed! One side note though, the windows could be installed with dual pane insulating glass as it could get quite noisy at nite with all the traffic on the streets. However, we were too tired to even notice the noise much. Regardless, both rooms were very clean. We rented a moped from the hotel. Rate was reasonable. Staff was very helpful telling us where to go would be the best. Breakfast was included in our room rate. A decent breakfast to start the day~ Location is excellent... close to all the attractions yet located in a quiet area. All in all, it could be a reasonable priced hotel if you are not going there when the City holds any conference/events.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: 4mango1980
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a couple of nights during a trip through the Netherlands and Germany. It was a pleasant place, and one of the more affordable hotels in a great location. Our "superior" room was small but clean. The staff was helpful when we wanted to book tickets to museums (the hotel is within walking distance to lots of museums and restaurants) and they let us use their computers for figuring out a few of our plans. The fitness room was nice and had some good equipment, and I appreciated the opportunity to get in a workout. This is not a luxury hotel, but it is a great option because of its location and price. It is possible to get around to and from there on public transportation if you are willing to do a little research, and this will save you some $$ in a rather expensive city. I was glad to have a comfortable but affordable option for this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - nasty staff”
Reviews.Author: BorderlessScott
Reviews.Content: After staying in this hotel for our wedding anniversary in 2008 and having a great time, my wife and I decided to return last October bringing my brother, who had recently lost his wife to cancer to try and cheer him up a bit. We stayed in an Executive Room and my brother a Superior Room. One of the high lights of the previous year was the balcony in our room as my wife and I like plenty of air in the room - however this year we were told at reception that we could not open it for health & safety reasons even though other guests were using there's - so the whole time we had no fresh air in the room which made me and my wife very uncomfortable, when I explained this to reception they told me no guests were allowed on to the balconies, ( which they clearly were ) and never have been, which is strange as we gave photos of us on the balcony the year before. My brothers room was at the corner of the hotel and was the strangest shaped room I have ever seen in a hotel, dark and dull. Also the mood lighting in our room did not work for the second year running and again no help was offered at the desk, just a blank "I hate my job" expression from the front desk staff member. We have booked else where this year as the thought of staying in a room with no fresh air does not appeal to me. Stay at your own risk, great 1st year - awful 2nd stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not for romance”
Reviews.Author: jimedwards1954
Reviews.Content: Extremely modern and well appointed hotel, but romantic week end with my wife was spoiled somewhat by staying in a room with open plan shower cubicle (not a major problem) and w.c. (big problem). When a couple are enjoying each other's company the superfluous sounds and smells coming from the w.c. are embarrassing and not conducive to romance.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ski-fanatic-73
Reviews.Content: Given the competitive rates; this might be the optimal 4 star hotel for a tourist. The location is perfect. The hotel staff is kind and willing to help. Rooms (I had 2) look fine; but be pro active in requesting a rooms with a window. Some small issues were handled with care. I did not take part in the 25 euro per person breakfast; I don't know what they serve; but within 10 minutes of walk you have about 30 places in Amsterdam where you can have a nice breakfast for 10 euro a person (juice, coffee sandwich). The addition of a rainshower in my room (normal Amsterdam water pressure is really low) was great; the bath products are from a nice brand as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed by this hotel - and definitely recommend it”
Reviews.Author: FussyBrighton
Reviews.Content: Although we originally only chose this hotel because of its excellent location (2 minute walk from the Leidseplein one way, 2 minute walk to the Rijksmuseum the other - and easy to walk everywhere else in under 30 minutes) we were VERY impressed indeed. It's been beautifully decorated in a sleek and stylish ultra-modern interior design style - and to a really high standard too. The reception is just fantastic! Our was an executive room on the 6th floor overlooking the canal and was super clean and smart. The staff were great - very helpful, friendly and professional. It's really hard to find anything to criticise! All we can think of is that the charges for wi-fi access are a bit high (and in many hotels of a lot lower grade than this it's free anyway) - but otherwise we thought this was a fantastic hotel, would recommend it highly and definitely stay there again if we're ever back in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed our stay, perfect location in city”
Reviews.Author: gogscrookofdevon
Reviews.Content: We all enjoyed our long weekend break in Amsterdam. Hotel rooms were clean, staff were all friendly and very helpful. The breakfast was excellent, lots of choice at the buffet. Hotel location is excellent, Vondel Park next door, Van Gogh musuem round the corner, we used the number 197 bus into the Leidseplein, only 4 euros each, bus stop is only 200 meters from Hotel. We used Mike`s Bike Tours one afternoon to get shown round Amsterdam, very good guided tour. I would certainly recommend this hotel and will use again when we come back to Amsterdam in the future.

Reviews.Title: “one of the better hotels in this class”
Reviews.Author: jlsblts
Reviews.Content: Am quite often in amsterdam for business and leisure and have to say this hotel offers a good deal. Good location close to the city center, but in a quiet part so that you can sleep without surrounding city noise. Rooms are modern and comfortable. Staff was very friendly and helpfull. My hotel of choice in this class.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: KeldaWelda
Reviews.Content: We have just returned last night from our trip to Amsterdam and our stay in the Park Hotel. The hotel is well designed and modern. We had an executive room which was nicely decorated, again very modern. Although we didn't have many dealings with the staff, when we did they were helpful and very polite. We had a few drinks in the bar, which again is very modern and attracts a relatively young trendy crowd. Although we didn't eat in their adjoining restaurant MOMO, it was packed every night of our 4 night stay. Breakfast wasn't included in our tariff, and at E23 each (although we were given a E5 discount card upon check-in) we opted out from eating in the hotel. Bagels & Beans is a mere 10mins walk from the hotel, so we ended up eating breakfast here several mornings (great bagels and fantastic coffees & juices). Overall both my partner and I really enjoyed our stay in the Park Hotel. The location is great, 5 minute walk to Leidisplein and really near the Van Gogh museum and the Heineken Experience. My only negative experience is that being a light sleeper, I found the street noise from the busy road below a bit of a nuisance. I would recommend that if you are a light sleeper, a room at the front of the hotel would probably not suit (although the view was lovely!).

Reviews.Title: “Best experience ever in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Tommy0
Reviews.Content: In the last 3 years I visit Amsterdam a lot with my co-workers. I usually stayed at the American hotel and NH hotels at the leidsepleen. My Stay at the Park was one of my best experiences ever. It looks like the hotel is recently refurbished, all looked very new and fresh. The beds are great!! Beautiful food in Momo, a signature restaurant with a nice crowd of visitors. Loved the lobby of the hotel with a real guest library. Had a meeting in Rome, one of the board rooms. Staff is really helpful throughout the whole hotel incl. the personal trainer in the hotel Gym / fitness. Tips; rent a bike from the hotel concierge and explore the city. Very cheap and a cool experience!!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Location”
Reviews.Author: veganmax
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Hotel during the Easter holidays and had a fantastic 3 days stay. Upon arrival the staff were most helpful and prefoessional. We had a lovely room which was very clean, and with modern furnishings. We were close to the Museum Quarter, so it was really easy to find things to do. The only downside to this hotel, and a word of caution of you're scared of mice, was that I had been warned by a work colleague that when he and his wife stayed there the previous year they had seen mice. On the second day, as I was waiting to speak to someone at the reception desk I did see a mouse to the right-hand side of the reception area, possibly where the kitchen or laundry areas are located. I did inform a member of staff, but she seemed more scared about it than anything else. This was also seen by other guests. It was the only time it happened during my stay, and it didn't put me off the hotel at all, but they probably need to do more to tackle this issue, even though I'm sure they're not the only hotel with this problem. I would still return to this hotel and I would recommend it, even though it is a bit on the expensive side.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: kim78
Reviews.Content: My partner and I booked a last minute three night stay at The Park Hotel mid July. We arrived at the hotel 4 hours before check in and were very pleasently surprised when the friendly reception said that we could check in straight away as our room was ready. (No extra charge). Our room was a decent size, very modern with a very welcoming looking king size bed. The shower and toilet are in the room but you are separated by black frosted glass so it is still private. This didnt bother us and it looked very modern and the shower is fab! The room had a plazma TV and mood lighting in 6 different colours which is fun! The room was very clean and the towels were changed and the bed was made everyday! The Hotel is situated directky opposite the resturants, bars and shops. It cost between 7 and 10 Euros for a taxi to Dam square, although you can walk it in 30 mins. As it is nice walk past canels etc it doesnt feel as long! You can also get a canel taxi from directly oppsite the hotel which is good fun! I highly reccomend this hotel and would definitly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Flooded rooms! but very responsive service :-)”
Reviews.Author: tansyliverwort
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Park Hotel in Amsterdam over the week-end of the world cup final. My husband was in Amsterdam on business, and I was there for leisure activities. The location of the hotel was perfect, and the staff in the hotel were incredibly responsive to the problem with had in our first room, and to the subsequent changes that took place. That was the good news! The bad news? We arrived and were sent to our room in a portion of the hotel that was not new, and had been refurbished sometime in the recent past. The one elevator to the older portion of the hotel did not work reliably, and the hallway carpeting was tatty and worn - the hallways were dingy and dark. Our room was very small (that was not a problem) and had a shower that flooded the room when I took my first shower. The Hotel staff graciously showed us to another room down the hall, and that too was flooded! Finally they gave us a room on the Executive Floor with a separate bathroom and bathtub and we finally were ok. The hotel was quite gracious about the problems they put us through and gave us one night free for our troubles, and the new room on the executive floor at the same rate as our initial room. I would not say "don't ever stay at this hotel" The staff were so responsive to the problems we were having, but... I would definitely say this... do not accept a room in the older portion of the hotel under any circumstances (our problem rooms were 216 and 219)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - great location - worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: gcol
Reviews.Content: Went here for a long weekend to meet up with some friends who live in Amsterdam We didnt eat in the hotel but everything that we did experience was excellent. The location is great - its just on one of the canals, very close to one of the large parks and within very easy walking distance of the centre (without being too crowed in the centre) Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for Solo Traveller”
Reviews.Author: A 'TA' Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a business trip in early July. As a female travelling alone it was a good choice, not too far from the city centre about a fifteen minute walk, straight across the road from canal boat trips, the casino and the Hard Rock Cafe. I felt very safe at all times, this is a nice part of Amsterdam. The room was small and the double bed made it difficult to move around. I had been offered an upgrade but as I was only spending a few hours in the hotel, I did not see the point in doing this. Were I to return with my partner I would upgrade. Overall it was good, lacked WOW factor but I felt safe and secure at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Just great”
Reviews.Author: WarwickHotels
Reviews.Content: The location is great. The decoration is great The Bar and restaurant are great A nice fitness center JUst love it!!!

Reviews.Title: “a place in your thoughts evermore...”
Reviews.Author: suseas
Reviews.Content: My stay after a few minor room issues was taken to the best possible upgrade with a canal view , wonderful staff, amazing room so charming and perfectl.I was able to canal boat hop, walk to all museums, shopping , cafes in charming neighborhoods.I lived a local life for a week and it calls me daily with the chime of the tram. Amsterdam is living right, and The Park is the place to start

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel near Vondelpark”
Reviews.Author: londonjp101
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel, situated next to Vondelpark and close to Museumplein. Great choice if you don't want to be in the middle of Amsterdam. 5 min walk to the museums and Leidseplein and 20 min walk to Red Light District. Got a great deal on the price for this hotel, but think their standard rates are on the more expensive side. Reception staff very friendly and helpful and there is must-have cycle parking across the road. Try and get a room on a higher floor as great views across the city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PepperpotLancashire
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Park Hotel for 2 nights at the beginning of June. What a great hotel! The staff were very helpful and always had a smile. Although the room was quite small it had everything you needed. This did'nt bother us at all as we were hardly in the room. The bathroom was lovely very clean and had a hairdryer and a brilliant magnified make up mirror. Other reviews have stated that the shower screen leaked, well yes it did a little but hey ho there is a shower mat to soak it up..I don't see a little water leaking as a problem ! The hotel was spotlessly clean and we had plenty of towels!! It was about 2 mins walk to leidseplein which is a busy area with plenty of bars and restraunts. We tended to walk everywhere as you get to see more of the city. All in all I would definately return to the Park Hotel and have no hesitation to recommend it to friends and family. Had a brilliant time!!

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: crdaus
Reviews.Content: This could be a really good hotel if they attended to a few relatively minor things: more wardrobe hanging space, fix leaky shower panel, provide free internet and water, more towels, face washers in the bathroom, be more generous with bathroom toiletries. The hotel has been recently re-furbished and I was in the modern building on the 6th floor. The re-furbishment is not without design flaws, e.g. shower screens that don't stop water flooding the bathroom floor. The hotel is not in a particularly good location unless you are going to spend the whole time at the Rijks Museum next door. It is more than 30 minutes walk to the good shops, restaurants and the main action north of Dam Square. You will need a compass to navigate the confusing streets and canals that can easily send you in a circular direction rather than direct to where you may want to go. And if you are walking, watch out for all the bike riders who seem to obey no rules whatsoever and completely dominate the streets. I don't think the hotel is good value considering the price of 219E per night plus city taxes. No breakfast or free internet included, and outrageous prices for even plain bottled water. However, what redeemed the hotel for me was the free access to the gym which is above average for this type of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terribly disapointed”
Reviews.Author: OnTheRoadAgainOslo
Reviews.Content: I had a short one night stay in this hotel on a business trip to Amsterdam. The booking was done by my assistant who booked a "deluxe" room. This is one of the worse price/quality ratio I experienced in Amsterdam. To start by a few positive points the hotel is ideally located, have a very nice and cosy lobby as well as a very good and trendey restaurant. Beside this, my stay was a nightmare. I had a room on the first floor, directly oversseing a street with passing tram. The windows are so old and and thin that I had the impression of sleeping in the street, with the noises of passing trams and drunk individuals. The room had a very bad smell of sewage and was extremely small, with a sort of wakling closet for shower and toilets. Bed was so soft that it was completely bending on my weight (although normal), I cannot imagine sleeping at two in such a bed. To complete this experience, the cleaning lady came at 9 am, despite the non disturb sign on my door, instantly knocking at the door and disturbing me in a conference call to remind me I had to check out ... Finally internet connection cost 22 EUR per 24h, one of the most expensive around there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Lady-Wales
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned home after a 3 night stay in Park Hotel in Amsterdam. We found no faults with the hotel or staff during our stay. I had written to the hotel before our arrival requesting a bathroom with a bathtub..after a long day walking I like to soak my weary bones.I had a very nice email back almost immediately saying they would do their best. On arrival Tom checked us in and kindly upgraded us.A nicer young man we have yet to meet...in fact all the reception staff were pleasant,helpful and courteous during our stay.Printing out our boarding passes amongst other things. The room was overlooking the Hard Rock Cafe and was more than comfortable.Tea and coffee facilities,an iron/board,mini bar and room safe. The bed must be the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in with lovely feather pillows and duvet. The breakfast was in with our deal and was ok.It helped that I could request an omlette for myself and fried eggs for my husband. This could and should be told to you as you enter the dining room,I did not like their commercial scrambled eggs they tasted horrid.The bacon was all streaky and too fatty for me,but as I say after the first breakfast they cooked freshly what I requested. All in all I would be very happy to return to this wonderful hotel.The location we found to be perfect. Easy to walk or catch a tram (we bought a train/tram pass for 72 hours when we arrived at Schipol at the information office just over 20Euros each which was a bargain for all the travelling we did). I cannot wait to return Thank you Park for our wonderful weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - great location - great comfort”
Reviews.Author: dogologist
Reviews.Content: A very nice, well kept and comfortable hotel. Spotlessly clean. Extremely helpful and cordial staff. Comfortable and CLEAN rooms. Great location for the occasional tourist! Great location for the occasional gambler (across the street from a casino). Downside.. everything is a la carte.. including wi fi and internet access..

Reviews.Title: “Great location nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stratos20
Reviews.Content: We have visited Amsterdam during Easter Holidays with my wife and a couple of friends. Amsterdam is a great city. I have been there twice and I like it very very much. I hope to visit it during Christmas. Going around the channels was a great experience. Don't miss to visit the museums and the souroundings. Park Hotel is located close to the centre, near the museums and buses etc. It is a nice hotel with beautiful reception. Room wasn't big but this is so in the whole Amsterdam. There was not elevator for the third floor in the old part of the building. Altthough our room was at the back side of the hotel the view was nice. I think that thiw Hotel is a good choise. Breakfast was nice and dinner at the hotel's restaurant is a perfect choise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: citynomad
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Park Hotel three times over the last few years and every time I am rewarded with great service and a great base to see the sight of Amsterdam. The hotel is positioned right by the Museum District - for those looking to explore the Van Gogh Museum and Rijkmusuem, and also close to the Heineken Brewery and the famous Albert Cuyp market. The famous Leisplein area is only a short walk away, as is the Hard Rock Cafe and Wagamama's for those looking for somewhere to eat. In the summer, water taxis are available right by the hotel so exploring Amsterdam's canals is easy. The hotel itself has gone though a refurbishment in recently providing first class accomodation, the rooms vary depending on which part of the hotel you stay in,but all are the same quality. The restaurant MOMO which is an additon to the Park Hotel, provides a relaxed atmosphere to either enjoy one of many signature cocktails or the amazing food on offer. MOMO has become one of the top places to dine, and is a favourite with the locals. Prices are a bit expensive but would be ideal if you wanted to arrange a special dinner, or wanted to relax with a drink before exploring Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: amaya0papaya
Reviews.Content: I booked us into the Park on a recommendation from 3 coworkers who'd had fantastic stays here. Frankly, I have no idea how. All I can say is, what a disappointment! The whole time I felt as though we were an "inconvenience" to the staff at the Park. The reservations agent was rude and brusque with me when I inquired about changing our reservations dates due to the volcano travel delays. Thankfully this shortened the time we were due to stay at the Park, because I had no idea what I was getting myself into. We were given an awful, cramped room in the corner of the hotel (AND charged the same rate as any other room - 199 Euro per night - a complete rip off!). We could hardly walk around the bed, and were uncomfortable every moment we were in there. We literally had to move the desk chairs into the bathroom in order to walk around and find places for our luggage. The cleaning service was terrible. The bed sheets had a dark (blood?) stain on them from a previous guest (TOTALLY gross), and we had to call down to the front desk every evening to ask that our coffee maker supplies and bathroom soaps be restocked. The second time we called down, we had to call again an hour later to "remind" the front desk to take care of this issue. You'd think after making this mistake one day, the next day the problem would have been fixed, but no. Each evening the entire 4th floor stinks to high heaven of FISH thanks to the "uber-chic" restaurant MOMO on the first floor. YUCK. Also, you'd think that for the price we were paying for the room, we'd have Internet service or breakfast included - nope! Each was an additional 25 EURO per day, per person. Sorry, allowing me to spend 10 minutes online to double-check my email is not worth 25 EURO. The one nice thing about our stay was that the bicycle rental service was very good - we got bikes in fantastic shape (though the rental prices were double the going rate in Amsterdam). I felt sick to my stomach when I got the bill - I'm willing to pay top dollar for a great-all around experience. This time, I just felt duped. Spend your money elsewhere - the Park isn't worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good, But Strange?”
Reviews.Author: TorontoGuy89
Reviews.Content: It started off with checking in and getting upgraded. We stayed on the 5th floor in one of the suites. The room was beautiful, the bedroom was just amazing.
