The view from our room was overlooking the casino and the river. The washroom area where you shower and wash was breathe taking, but we did have a problem with the " Curtins" and that there were no doors for privacy. Also the Toilet was all out on its own on the other side of the room. We did order pizza as room service and it was good. not bad actually. Over-all the Hotel itself is Beautiful and so are it's room. I just have a little problem with the washroom and toilet area. If i was travelling alone this would be my Ideal hotel, but I was with 5-6 of my friends from work and that just got a little awkward.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel - but better ones avaliable in the area”
Reviews.Author: Banko-DK
Reviews.Content: Recently refurbished this hotel is a very trendy hotel with a great decoration/interiour. Problem is the hotel staff seems very unattentive and not focused on delivering a good experience for the guest. Have stayed here 3 times during 2008 and every time I have left a bit disappointed. Positive: Great location for sightseeing/partying in Amsterdam Great breakfast Can have a very competive rate even though it is newly refurbished Negative: Located at a rather busy street that can get slightly noisy in the mornings (but I am very easily disturbed by noise). Very mediocore and dull (even with the nice interour)

Reviews.Title: “great location and lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: corklady10
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel for a 3 day stay in amsterdam. it is very well located in the beautful museum district and within walking distance of the lively leideseplein where there are plenty of bars and places to eat. we rented bikes from the hotel which was a great way to see the city. the restaurant "momo" in the hotel looked lovely and we regretted not eating there.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you stay in the new building”
Reviews.Author: efsnik
Reviews.Content: The hotel comprises of two buildings. The old (beautiful) building and the new (ugly) one. I stayed at the first floor in the old building. The room was very modern and well designed. Shower and toilet were two glass cabins inside the room, really beautiful design. But when you shower the room gets full of water! Moreover, the old windows were not soundproofed, so the noise from the street and especially the tram was terrible all day and all night long!!! These are details that really ruin all the nice design and atmosphere. People who stayed in the new building in upper floors said they had no such problems. Breakfast was really nice. As a business hotel it is nice, for romance you can find something better for that money.

Reviews.Title: “good location, expensive, cramped, beds too soft”
Reviews.Author: 2intrepid
Reviews.Content: Just got back and glad to be in my own bed. although expensive this hotel was cheaper than many similar in the area. if staying don t pay the 23 euros for breakfast. lots of places to eat much cheaper nearby.

Reviews.Title: “modern,clean,great room,helpful staff and good location”
Reviews.Author: chugger_10
Reviews.Content: lovely hotel,close to the museums and canal tours straight outside.just off the leidesplein for all the restaurants.walking distance from all attractions,quick tram ride from the central station.book anne frank house in advance to avoid the queues and just go in during your chosen time slot.would certainly use this hotel again and would recommend it as an ideal base for exploring this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Place, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Siavashpolo
Reviews.Content: With having no idea about the best location to choose a hotel and only by reviewing the experiences of travelers in Tripadvisor, I have found the best place will be around this area. The agent company which helped me to book the hotel had not contract with all hotels in the nearby area so I decided to choose Park Hotel. The hotel is a combination of a renewed old building with a new one, which at their connecting points there are some steps which makes difficulty to handle luggages. The hotel location is the best since it is very closed to Museums area and also closed to city center (Dam square). During my 3-day stay I never took a bus or tram and I walked to all plaeces. Also the place is closed to canal cruise station, Amsterdam casino, and a round place full of nice bars and restaurants. The standard room I had was ok, only because it was located at the top floor (5th of renewed building) it took a long time to get warm at nights with the heating system. The highlight of the hotel is its bar & restaurant (MOMO), which the breakfast was complete and great and based on my idea was worthful in price. The bar was ful of people at evenings. The entrance lobby and the hal are having a nice design with a nice fireplace and a good library . The hotel price was fair for a 4-star hotel including breakfast. But there is no free internet and the price is high to have the connection.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: davaloo
Reviews.Content: arrived in amsterdam took the train from airport to central station train tickets purchased from a ticket machine.once at central station found a tram outside station tram number 5 takes you all the way to the hotel.The hotel entrance is very nice check in very quick staff very helpfull.The room was small but adequate beds very soft but comfy the toilet and shower cubicle was in the same room with only a glass door to seperate this didnt really bother us much as we have been married 25 years i suppose if you are just friends or newly together it could be uncomfortable.The restaraunt (MOMOS) is very expensive ie breakfast 25 euro per person so we didnt eat there.There are loads of affordable restaraunts nearby.Out and about be aware pedal cycles are all over everywere we walked mainly as everything is basically in walking distance if you get tired the trams are very reliable.We visited the ann frank house (very enjoyable)book tickets online if possible to avoid the queues.The heineken experience was good fun we both came out snuffy we also took a canal cruise from the front of the hotel which is another way of seeing the city the guides are very good and you learn about the history of amsterdam. We experienced the brown coffee shops and took a walk around the red light district which you really have to do on a visit to amsterdam.All in all we had a fantastic time and when we return (which we will) we will definately use the park hotel again its possition and cleanliness are second to none

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous but with many flaws”
Reviews.Author: JK212
Reviews.Content: The beds were way too soft; no mattress, just a 4" thick piece of foam. The shower has half a glass door so the floor gets a big puddle when you shower. Lighting in bathroom is awful so it's a challenge for women who wear makeup. More design flaws abound but those are the worst. Way too expensive for what it is. Yes, a great location and a beautiful lobby but overall, not worth the price. Internet service is a rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect the best, nor the worst”
Reviews.Author: Destichado
Reviews.Content: It is more or less an average hotel with no soul though, good location, good breakfast, I find my room was nothing fancy, however the sticky feeling that price paid versus the "wow" feeling tends to be less towards "recommended". Neverthelss don't get me wrong , the hotel is not bad at all.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic weekend away!!!!”
Reviews.Author: EmzLancaster
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with this hotel,really smart,modern and very clean. We were even lucky enough to get upgraded to an executive room when we checked in. The room was great with a very comfy bed and the bathroom had a fantastic shower!! Our room was on the 7th floor and had alovely view. The restaurant downstairs 'Momo' is very nice and we had a delicous meal washed down with a few cocktails. The location of this hotel was perfect! Would go back and stay there again,could not fault it !!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but expensive”
Reviews.Author: Pixdix09
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in February 2010. The location was good and the hotel was very modern. Staff were very friendly and helpful. On arrival we were given a Superior room, which meant that the bedroom and bathroom were all in the same room, cut a curtain to parition it. The room smelled of 'toilet'. We requested for the room to be changed and opted to be upgraded to an Executive room. The room was very nice, clean and smelt fresh. The only hitch with this room was that the ironing board was broken. Our booking was 'room only', and thank goodness for that. We ate out for breakfast every morning, until the last morining of our stay when we decided to eat in the hotel. Breakfast was not great. The bacon had been cooked for that long that it just crumbled. The selection at breakfast was not vast, and the price of this was 23.50 euros per person, which was a bit steep considering the quality of this. A lovely htel, but breakfast is a NO, NO!

Reviews.Title: “style over substance”
Reviews.Author: Chailey_Paul
Reviews.Content: Looks good but this is superficial. Do not stay in a standard room. There are on the same lines as the much superior Citizen M but lower quality, smaller and a great deal more expensive. The integral shower laeks in to the rooms which are damp and smelly. Complani and you might get an upgrade. Servicing the rooms is hit and miss, irregular and may not happen until 17:00 if at all. If hotel is busy breakfast is utter chaos and the staff just cant cope.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was very impressive and cosy.....”
Reviews.Author: Gav_10
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for 3 nights in February 2010 and we really enjoyed our experience. The hotel is really modern and stylish in its design. When we arrived we where pleasantly surprised we had been upgraded to an executive room where the bathroom was separate. The room was well equipped and we had a beautiful view from our window out over the city. The hotel is in a great location, and the Leidseplein with itâ€™s abundance of bars and restaurants is less than 5 minutes walk. Also you can take the tram to Dam Square...we bought a 3day travel ticket which cost 15euro it did all the tram rides, bus & train. I would definitely recommend visiting the Anne Frank Museum & doing a boat trip which you can take from just outside the hotel front door. One thing is, be prepared to queue for many of the museums, and in February this can be very cold just standing around, you just have to be very patient. There are plenty of places to eat - across the road from hotel was the Irish bar and Hard Rock cafe but to name just a few... One evening we went for cocktails at MOMO, where we found the staff rather rude and the drinks expensive compared to a few other places we were in. Would definitely stay at this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Intermittently rendy, attractive, comfortable - but bad for your back and has some flaws!”
Reviews.Author: Angelica_Demon
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend nd I stayed here for 1 night on 26th February, but we would have happily stayed longer had we not been given free nights elsewhere. The lobby and restaurant (MOMO) are incredibly stylish, surprisingly comfortable and clearly recently refurbished. We loved playing cards by the fire downstairs with the chill out music playing late in the evening after a long day on our feet - and whilst we didn't eat dinner at MOMO, it smelt divine! The service at the desk was slightly brusque but I'm not sure that it wasn't just the one girl as every other member of staff were pleasant and helpful. We were given our room (517) and dutifully went over to the lift where we were directed. Despite there being two perfectly good, recently refurbed lifts, apparently they don't go to our room(?) so we were taking what seemed akin to a service lift. It didn't even have proper doors so you had to stand in the middle away from the passing floors! Anyway when we got to our floor and room we realised that we'd been given a room on a floor that was in the middle of being refurbed (evident from all the building debris around). Happily, the room itself seemed post-refurb but without the much hyped 'customer changed lighting system' from the website. Not even sure what this would be! We also didn't have the toilet and shower inside the bedroom as critiqued in previous posts on this site, I was very happy - the bathroom was stylish, big and very luxurious feeling. I had a really lovely bath on the first evening and an amazing rain shower the next day ;o) My only gripe is that the room was FREEZING when we checked in and took hours whilst we were out to heat up, and the window were incredibly drafty. The mattress was initially comfortable, being a queen size and with lovely sheets but actually it was too soft and both my boyfriend and I came away with sore backs after just one night! We were a bit disappointed with the lack of storage space which would be a problem were we staying longer, the wifi is not free, and the snacks for the mini bar were placed above the safe next to the kettle/teas and coffees in such a way as to appear like complimentary snacks but they were not ! The breakfast is fantastic, served in MOMO, and the hotel itself is in an amazing location, close to Leidesplein and Vondelpark but it seems at the moment to be a work in progress. I'd definitely go back for a special occasion but only if the rooms were on special offer and not for more than a few nights!

Reviews.Title: “THE place to stay! Wonderful stay from beginning to end!”
Reviews.Author: thelocationlocation
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Park Hotel was fantastic from beginning to end! The reception staff made us feel very welcome answering all our questions and giving us a map to help us navigate around the city. We were able to check in early on arrival and store our bags after checking out on our last day. The hotel is very modern but luxurious and in a fabulous location-safe, pretty and close enough to walk to all the action i.e museum square, shopping district, dam square etc but not in the middle of it-we only used the tram 3 times our whole stay and were able to walk to all of the different neighbourhoods/districts very easily! The Park Hotel is an excellent place to retire to after a fun packed day/ evening in Amsterdam with a fireplace lit lobby and plenty of seating-a nice place to sit and relax with a coffee or book. The hotel rooms are lovely (we were given a free upgrade) with TV, tea/coffee making facilities and a super comfy bed! The hotel also has a gorgeous restaurant next door Momo which we ate at-the food was delicious and atmosphere relaxed and plush with gorgeous cocktails and a dj. I'd recommend doing a bike ride with yellow bike company, it was fantastic and allowed us to see places and landmarks we may have missed or not had time to see! Anne Franks house is a must! Drink as many chocomilks (hot chocolate with cream) as you can-they are to die for! And if you fancy something really special pay a visit to Momo's whether its just for drinks or dinner as its a lovely place to spend an evening. We loved our stay at the Park Hotel and not only have I already been recommending it to anyone that will listen, we plan a return visit later on in the year. Thanks Park Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sarah288
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. We jumped on the train at the airport to central station, then on to a tram(no2) witch dropped us off about 3-5 min walk from the hotel. We were able to check in before 12 which is a bonus and then off on our travels we went. The hotel is in the fashion district off Amsterdam about a 30 min walk from central station and from Anne Franks house. From the moment we got to the hotel untill we check out we didnt use any transportation as in my view the hotel was central but not right in the heart. Would defo stay at this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “rooms are pretty tight, but a nice enough place to crash”
Reviews.Author: seabourne11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled to Amsterdam with my sister and brother-in-law for a couple nights, including New Year's eve 2010. We chose Park Hotel primarily for the low price. It's not very centrally located, but it's certainly close enough to the nightlife. The rooms are very small, but trendy, comfortable and clean. My only complaints would be that the showers are a little leaky (water on the floor) and the temperature is a bit difficult to control. Given the tight space and fogged glass shower and toilet walls/doors, I would NOT recommend this hotel to people who are not extremely close or to families. We did not come to Amsterdam to spend time in a hotel, so it was a perfectly adequate place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: chbcov
Reviews.Content: me and my bf stayed here for a long weeknd,we have been to amsterdam before but not stayed here, the hotel was beautiful and clean and the staff were friendly. the rooms were loveley and the BED was to die for aswell as the shower. we will definatley be returning

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing Hotel!! Excellent location!! Highly recommend!!”
Reviews.Author: dubsey
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with fantastic location, spent three nights with my partner and another couple and no complaints whatsoever!! Did'nt use much service from the hotel but staff where very friendly, rooms where modern with great views, can't say enough about this hotel!! If breakfast was included in the price would be outstanding!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not for couples - Above its station”
Reviews.Author: Hamalainen
Reviews.Content: A decent hotel with a few caveats: The shower and toilet in the rooms are actually two separate cubicles. You will NOT want to be sharing with that new partner of yours. Secondly, the arrangement was totally ineffectual as the shower cubicle flooded a large area everytime when used. I managed to get extra towels from housekeeping to mop up the mess but could hardly get the guy out of my room for want of a tip. Not what I expect of a European hotel and certainly not when I've called as a result of their flooding shower. Secondly, this is a Dutch hotel so like many others, they are naturally prone to exceptional exageration. Their breakfast is advertised as something like 'the most comprehensive in Amsterdam'. Well, at twenty odd euro, save your cash and go elsewhere, fast! The variety and quality was ok, but not worth half the price. Most annoyingly, their wifi was exceptionally overpriced at Twenty Euro for Twenty Four hours. I had to make use of the service for work, it operated fine but I though they were seriously mugging me by charging a rate I can only describe as 'thieving'. All in, an ok hotel with prentensions above it's station which may appeal to folk used to that attitude but if you're from a generally honest nation, you'll likely be disappointed. Only stay if you must, there are certainly better, more honest, good value alternatives (at both ends of the scale) around town.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - great location close to Leidseplein”
Reviews.Author: Mike7Riyadh
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. I was only in town for a 4 days business trip, but the Park Hotel met my every need. It is a great location, an easy 5 min stroll from all the excitement of Leidseplein. Colleagues were staying at the Eden American Hotel and were right in the middle of the action. I prefer to be just around the corner from the action and the Park Hotel was perfect for that. The hotel itself is well appointed. My room was very comfortable and would compete easily with most of 20 or so other hotel rooms that I have stayed in over the 12 months. I did originally get a canal view room, however I swapped to the other side of the corridor to an interior facing room. This was because a) there was a bit of noise from the road, and b) the first room had the bed head against the corridor wall and the door to the room opened directly onto the corridor. I find that when you get a room like this you tend to hear everyone walking down the corridor as well as any time someone enters their own room. But it is always a trade off, a view or a quiet room? The room on the interior of the building didn't have a view, however the bed was far from the door and the room was quiet and very cozy. The staff were all very helpful and courteous even when I asked to change rooms. I will definitely stay here again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel”
Reviews.Author: CardiffHappy86
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend for 3 nights and we were both very impressed, it is a very stylish hotel that is within walking distance to all the major attractions. We stayed in a superior room where the toilet and shower are separated by a glass door, in an open plan design. However, we felt that this lacked privacy, and could pose a problem for new couples that are not completely comfortable with each other as you are able to hear everything!! One evening we went for cocktails at MOMO, which was always packed, which was rather expensive, but worth it. I would definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth The Money | Very rude staff”
Reviews.Author: MM007
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed here on a city break. The location is great and that is where the good stuff ends. We started off by booking a standard room at a discounted web offer. What is meant (untold to us) was a room with two glass cubes (one for the toilet and the other for the shower). The room stank of smoke and we asked to have the room changed. We were told to come back in two hours (thanks). The next room was smaller and had white hair all over the carpet. The shower cube (remember no bathroom) was not fitted well and the room would become a small lake each time we showered. A few hours in, one of the staff from the reception decided to let herself in (with out knocking) while we were sleeping...no apology. Few days later, we came back and found some's belongings on our bed. We complained the THIRD time and were upgraded to a much better room....much better. Apart from the male reception manager EVERYONE is very rude and the hotel needs better cleaners...NOT WORTH THE BOTHER!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: LMD1966
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice & staff very helpful. There was only one fault with the hotel and that was the bed, it was very very soft, I have never slept on a water bed but I certainly had a feeling of what it would be like. As for Amsterdam, everything we wanted to do was within easy walking distance, although there were times we used the trams. We only visited for 3 nights, but tried to cram in as much as possible. On the day we arrived there was a light covering of snow, and it was very cold during our visit but not that it bothered us, we were wrapped up and the walking keeps you warm. I would definately recommend visiting the Anne Frank Museum & doing a boat trip. We had wanted to visit the Royal Palace but that was closed due to repair works going on. We did visit the Van Gogh Museum, and although we had heard about all the queues for many of the museums, we were prepared for that, however it was the crowds once you were inside that we were not prepared for, we just found it to be very fustrating and a little disappointing, but it is something you should see, you just have to be very patient. It is'nt cheap in Amsterdam i.e. 2 vodka & diet cokes cost on average 14 - 15 euros, breakfast for two about 25 - 30 euros and an evening meal including drinks approx 50 euros, but it was all part of the experience of visiting a city. Amsterdam is a shoppers heaven, there are fantastic top designer shops, which were just round the corner from our hotel, if you have money you could certainly spend it. On the day we were due to leave we awoke to 3" of snow, wonderful, and unlike here, they clear it to the side and get on with things. I would recommend Amsterdam to all, its a wonderful place and I would highly recommend The Park Hotel as your base.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JDMan1984
Reviews.Content: Great location, within walking distance to all the shops/nightlife etc. Very clean hotel, staff were nice and the rooms were trendy and clean. Had no problems with anything and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.....couple of slight let downs.......”
Reviews.Author: Gavlah
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Park hotel. We last visited 2 years ago. The hotel has a great location in southern central Amsterdam. We caught a taxi from Centraal Station and it cost 13 euros. You could quite easily get a tram but with luggage we couldn't be bothered. The hotel is situated on a main road with a canal bang opposite. It's also within easy walking distance of Liedesplein and also has the Hard Rock Cafe and an Irish pub opposite. It's also in the museum quarter and the opposite end of town from the seedier Amsterdam districts. On arrival we couldn't believe the change. When we visited before the hotel was undergoing a big refurb and you could choose whether you stopped in the old part or the newly refurbished part. We had a superb modern room that was massive on that occasion! The reception area had been totally moved and looked amazing, the check in experience was spoiled slightly by some rude American bloke. We were stood about 6 feet away from the person in front of us (can't stand people who stand over my shoulder in queues!) when this guy just waltzed to the front and started lecturing the reception girl!! Not the hotels fault but it would have been nice if she'd have sent him to the back of the queue rather than serve him and apologise afterwards! Once again we had one of the newly refurbished rooms although this time it was a lot smaller. The shower cubicle and toilet closet were around 4 feet from our bed (seperated by the sink) which is not great if you're in a new relationship at not 100%comfortable with each other!!! The other problem was that although the shower was superb and an experience in itself, it did leak through the seals at the bottom of the door. This happened in our previous room a couple of years ago but as previously mentioned, the room was a lot bigger. The water ran into the toilet cubicle next door meaning we had a pool of water a couple of cm's deep for the rest of our stay! The bed was again, one of the most comfortable I've ever slept on. After an afternoon of trailling round 'Dam in the cold it was nice to have a couple of hours in a lovely warm bed before going out for dinner. One let down was the MOMO restaurant next door. We only popped in for a coffee during the afternoon. It was well designed and reminded of a hotel bar in New York. Most of the tables were taken so we took a seat at the bar. There was no sign of any bar staff during the 15 minutes we waited and we must have been one of 6 other couples waiting at the bar. I did notice a couple of ladies sat tutting and looking at their watches for a while before their drinks arrived.....must have been waiting a while I guess. We enquired about breakfast to be told it was 18 euros......dont bother....go to the Irish pub opposite, full English breakfast for 11 euros. All in all another good stay and I wouldn't hesitate in recommending this hotel to friends. Upon checking out we were asked if we had consumed anything from the mini bar (we hadn't). The guy on reception didn't seem to believe us and he asked again!! I didn't think anything of this until I checked my credit card a couple of days after returning. I found a Â£6 charge on there for the mini bar!!! I know it's not much but it's the principal of the thing. I've emailed but heard nothing yet. Think if they did this to everyone how much they'd make in a year if only 50% bothered to complain!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and modern hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: LauraR4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and were really pleased with the location. I was a bit worried as had read some bad reviews regarding the bathroom being in the room however when we checked in we had been upgraded to an executive room where the bathroom was separate! The room was well equipped and we had a nice view from our window over the canal. The hotel reception is warm and welcoming and is a nice place to sit and relax with a drink. The hotel restaurant also looked very busy however we didn't try it. The hotel is only minutes away from the Leidseplein and Museumplein. We found a great street with lots of nice restaurants just off the Leidseplein....just look out for the Pancake Corner Restaurant and go up go that street. We would recommend the Thai and the Mexican. You can walk to all of the tourist attractions and you can also get a canal cruise right outside the hotel. If you are into cocktails, make sure you visit the House of Bols, we found it really good fun! With regards to getting to and from the airport, we just got the train to Central Station and from there you can get tram lines 1, 2 and 5 to the hotel. You can also get a shuttle bus which services hotels throughout the city however it is much cheaper to get the train.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely modern hotel; excellent, knowlegeable staff; good location”
Reviews.Author: CreepingBeauty
Reviews.Content: Myself and a friend stayed at the Park Hotel in March 2009 and our stay was faultless. The hotel was easy to get to from the train station, with the tram stop being literally just around the corner and it is in a nice location right on the canal. The hotel was modern in its design and clean. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful, spoke perfect English which made things easier and had excellent knowledge of the local area. Breakfast was included in the price and the choice each morning was vast, ranging from hot bacon, sausages and eggs to cakes, breads, cereals and fruits. Breakfast was served in the restaurant/bar which in the evenings became a hive of activity, full of both visitors and locals. We had a junior suite, which was lovely. It had plenty of wardrobe space, tea/coffee making facilities, a flat screen TV, mood lighting, a very comfortable bed and a very impressive bathroom with double sinks, double rainforest showers and luxury toiletries.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jerseyscampi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Park Hotel for three nights in November 2009 and can honestly say that it was superb. The Hotel is spotless and very modern witha huge reception area complete with small library, easy chairs, and working fires. The room I had was a superior double which consisted of separate shower/bath/toilet all kitted out in black marble, a big double bed, widescreen TV with pay for view channels, english channels, in roomsafe and fridge with mini bar. My room overlooked the canal and casino and was suprisingly quiet considering that the main road was outside. The Hotel also has a fully equipped gym in the basement and wireless internet. I stayed room only but breakfast is available at a pricy 15 euros. You get a full english breakfast across the road at the Irish pub for 7 euros. All the staff were extremely helpful and when my bag failed to appear at the airport it was in my room for me a few hours later as arranged by the hotel. The location is perfect, it is right opposite the casino and behind the casino is the trendy liedsplein area with cafes, pubs, etc, then the town is a short walk from here. The Vondel park, and Van Gogh museum are all within walking distance. All in all a great place to stay at very reasonable rates.

Reviews.Title: “Nick`s 40th Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: DawnB10
Reviews.Content: Very expensive for what you get. I booked the executive room when we arrived I was not sure that it was the right room. Had problems with bath , fridge and no flanels, went down to reception explained and they booked us in another room which was more like an executive room. I have been to a hotel in Barcalona before and was not charged for anything from the mini bar ,at this hotel mini bar was very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for what you get”
Reviews.Author: Cazzarama
Reviews.Content: A nice enough hotel, but way too overpriced for what you get. The room service was pretty poor although it did arrive quickly. But you also get charged for even calling for room service! Staff were friendly and attentive, but I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Modern, Straight to the Point”
Reviews.Author: dubaijetsetter
Reviews.Content: I am frequent visitor to Amsterdam and have stayed in numerous hotels in my past. The Park Hotel is by far one of the best hotels i've stayed in. Amsterdam is notorious for tiny old and tired hotels, yet this hotel has just been refurbished with a modern sleek touch to it - though yes the room size is still not comparable to what you would get in the middle east or us, yet still a decent size. Make sure to check out MOMO's restaurant on the ground floor. I highly recomend this hotel if you want a clean, comfortable and modern stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely modern hotel - be weary of executive rooms!”
Reviews.Author: maver1ck
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from 3 nights stay at the Park Hotel. The hotel is very modern with beautiful features in an excellent location. The staff were very friendly when we checked in and had loads of local knowledge of where to go and see if we needed it. We had booked the executive room which oh dear is absolutely lovely to look at with its LCD tv, mood lighting, underfloor heating area & modern look BUT the designers had one major flaw! The shower and toilet are incorporated into the room. There is no seperate room for toilet & shower and this was very off putting. You had a sheer curtain that pulled across from the bed to seperate the room and you walked into a cubicle no bigger than a standard public toilet cubicle as your toilet. TV volume was raised when bathroom was used and its a shame as everything else about this hotel was excellent. The hotel is located in a lovely area of amsterdam about 15 mins walk to Dam Square, beside Van Gogh museum. You can take the 1,2,5 tram from across the road to the centre of the city in less than 10 minutes. Word of warning, you have to pay 20 euro a day to use the wi-fi in your room which is ridiculous. For a 4 star hotel this facility should be provided free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a nice area”
Reviews.Author: Mickcol
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Park Hotel for 3 nights for a short break to see Amsterdam for the first time & to see ZZ Top at the Heineken Music Hall. The hotel is located in a trendy part of Amsterdam a couple of blocks away from the fashion district & near 2 large parks, the Museumplein and the Vondelpark. Also within easy walking distance of the Van Gogh Museum, the Rijksmuseum. Just across from road the hotel is a canal with trip barges around the city. Very wothwhile. The transport system, trains, trams & metro all intergrate well. Its well worth buying a daily travel ticket from the hotel that gives you access the city. Its easy to walk around too but watch out for the speeding bicyles, scooters & motor bikes that all use the citys bike lanes "on the pavement". Breakfast in the hotel is very expensive- 25 Euros per person but we were offered a deal for 18 Euros each per day. The breakfast is fantastic. I `ve never seen such a choice of food that sets you up for the day. We didnt eat again until dinner. We had to change our hotel room after the 1st night as there was a bad smell of sewage. We were upgraded to a better room immediately. The staff we encountered were very professional and generally friendly. The main areas of the hotel are modern & contemparary & very busy in the evenings but there are some areas of the hotel that need updating.

Reviews.Title: “nice business hotel”
Reviews.Author: ioanap
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for one night. It is a nice business hotel with friendly staff, willing to help you with everything you may need. The location is quite central, with easy access to everything. The room is modern, quiet, quite comfortable, with coffee/tea machine you may use. However, don't expect to find any slippers or bathrobe, which was quite a surprise to me for the price you pay. And finally, the price for the breakfast was so high that I refused to pay 25 euros for it, even though my company would pay for it. I just find it ridiculous. Would recommend it for business trips, even though if I went back to amsterdam for holidays would stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Pro55
Reviews.Content: I spent five nights at the Park Hotel in October and found many things to recommend about the hotel. The Park is sleek and modern. The lobby, called the â€œLiving Roomâ€�, includes a gas fireplace next to comfy chairs and couches where one can sit, sip a glass of wine, and have a pleasant conversation. Through the Living Room are the Concierge and the reception desks. Everyone was most helpful and made me feel welcome. Upon check-in, guests are given a coupon for a complimentary drink at Momo, the on-site bar and restaurant. Guest rooms are larger than one might expect for Europe, and feature a contemporary design theme that struck me as almost stark. Not my personal taste, but well done nonetheless. The rooms are equipped with mini-bars, coffee and tea, an in-room safe, and iron and ironing board. The bathroom has a drench showerhead, typically deep European tub, a hair dryer, and high-end amenities. I received a pre-paid rate of â‚¬119 per night, which I found fairly reasonable. Wireless Internet access is available in the rooms for about â‚¬20 per day. The Park has shared computers near the reception desk where one can also get Internet access for â‚¬5 for 15 minutes. Within a few blocks, however, there are several Internet access points where the rates are quite a bit lower if youâ€™re willing to put up with the inconvenience. On the lower level, the Park has the best-equipped hotel fitness center Iâ€™ve ever seen. Guests can use treadmills, an elliptical trainer, free weights, and weight machines, all while watching one of two big-screen TVs. On the ground floor, Momo offers a variety of sushi and Asian-themed dishes that are well prepared and nicely presented, though a bit on the expensive side. Drinks at the bar seemed pretty reasonable at around â‚¬5 each. Among the Parkâ€™s positives is its location. Situated on a main canal between the Fashion and Museum District and the entertainment area known as the Leidseplein, it has easy access to a wide range of attractions, restaurants, and transportation options without being in the middle of the action as soon as you step out the front door. Amsterdamâ€™s famous Museum District, about two blocks southeast of the Park, boasts the Van Gogh Museum, the Rijksmuseum, the House of Bols (reputedly the worldâ€™s oldest spirits manufacturer) and its Cocktail & Genever Experience, and the Diamant Museum. Two large parks, the Museumplein and the Vondelpark, are also within easy walking distance. Across the canal to the northwest is the Leidseplein with a wide variety of restaurants. My personal favorite, simply because it is distinctly Dutch, is a snack shop called Febo where one buys traditional Dutch â€œkroketsâ€� (deep-fried, roll-formed snacks containing various types of meat) from dispensers that resemble an updated version of the Horn & Hardart Automat. The locals call that eating â€œuit de muurâ€� or â€œfrom the wallâ€�. At the other end of the spectrum, the area also has outlets from international chains including the Hard Rock CafÃ©. The Holland Casino is also in the area. More interesting, however, are the locally run restaurants, bars, and old pubs that line the side streets. Many of the cityâ€™s older drinking establishments are known locally as â€œbrown cafÃ©sâ€�, so called because years of cigarette smoke (banned in most Amsterdam establishments since July 2008) turned the walls brown. Many offer bar food, including simple toasted sandwiched; some do not. Near the Park are stops where one can catch the Canalbus for a waterborne tour of Amsterdam, hop on the tram, or catch a bus. The Park also rents mopeds (which share the cityâ€™s bicycle paths) for about â‚¬49 a day, and rents bicycles as well. Guests at the Park can buy tickets to many of the cityâ€™s museums and attractions at the hotelâ€™s front desk at the same price youâ€™d pay at the attraction. Buying the tickets at the hotel can save you a lengthy wait in the ticket line at your destination. The front desk also sells tickets to the cityâ€™s tram and bus system.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good value, good location near tram, some small issues”
Reviews.Author: dieselbp67
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Hotel after looking around a bit on trip advisor, and found a good price (I think around 130Euros). The website also is very nicely done and made the hotel really stand out from others. The service was good on arrival and throughout the stay, so no real comments there. I was on the fifth floor in the older section of the hotel, so I actually had to take the elevator to the fourth floor and walk up a flight to the fifth floor. A lil different than what I am used to, but no problems with that. I just wanted to mention it so if any readers of this review would prefer to not have to do that, they will know ahead of time. When I got to the fifth floor there was a little bit of an odd smell, I wasnt sure what it was. I think it may have been from the housekeeping/laundry area. It wasn't a big problem, just something I noticed. The room was nice, safe, minibar, cool decorations. The bed is def on the soft side, but I still had no problem sleeping in it. The bathroom though is weird. Actually there is no real bathroom, its just right there in your room. There is a sink area, a toilet and a shower. First, it's def a lil uncomfortable for those of us who would like a little privacy when using a bathroom. Second, the shower door and floor set up probably wasn't designed correctly because when you shower the tile floor and the carpet of the room gets soaking wet. Housekeeping takes care of it, but there is a slight musty smell in the general area. The actual shower when you are in it is fantastic, great pressure from the rainfall head. So overall the room is comfortable and clean and does the job. TV is nice also. They also have this whole "living room" concept in the lobby where you can relax and read and stuff. That was pretty interesting and I spent some time there. Room service - only ordered late night dining once and it was fantastic. It was some kind of pie and wow. Totally would recommend that. The location of the hotel is really good. It's near the museums, and right by bus and tram stops to take you anywhere else you want to go. In the vicinity there are also cafes, coffeeshops, bars, and a casino. So thats pretty much the summary of the hotel, and I would recommend it for the right price. I saw the average price year round is very high, so I would look elsewhere if the price creeps up too high. But overall I had an amazing experience in Amsterdam and was very satisfied with my hotel choice.

Reviews.Title: “Blah”
Reviews.Author: NYCNYers
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed in this hotel. First off, it's not remotely modern or glamorous or funky, so if that was holding you back from staying here, don't be deterred. The furnishings are sort of modern and contemporary, but the overall vibe is very late '90s and stale. What should deter you from staying here are the following: (1) expensive internet connections at an outrageous 20 euros a day, (2) too-soft, uncomfortable beds, (3) dank bathrooms that are clean enough but incredibly musty-smelling, and (4) a a lot of loud, obnoxious people taking over the hotel restaurant on weekends. During the week, the vibe is mostly businesspeople and quiet. The location is decent if your main priority is the Van Gogh and Rijk museums, but the most lovely parts of town with the classic canal houses and interesting boutiques/galleries/restaurants are a good 20-minute walk away. The concierge service was mediocre. Our first request was for a place to have breakfast. The concierge mentioned a place. We asked, half-kiddingly, whether she was sending us to a good place or a touristy place. She said, "Oh, you want a place that's actually good?" When we said yes, she directed us someplace else. It's disappointing that the concierge assumes all her guests are ignorant tourists with no taste, but that's apparently what she did. Maid service was decent, the room was tidied up fine, and everything seemed to work (TV, lights, etc.), but overall, this hotel is just average.

Reviews.Title: “over priced the rooms were not like the website pictures”
Reviews.Author: irockYorkshire
Reviews.Content: the rooms were adaquate, the windows did not shut properly & had paper wedged in them to TRY & stop the draft, which did not work. the shower leaked there was no complimentry things like it says in the brochure. we got put in the old part of the hotel & i think the staff treat us like we shouldn t have been staying there. we were not dressed right or posh enough for them. The rooms were not how the wbsite portrayed them at all, overall it was a very disappointing stay

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tdrshrese
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in walking distance to museums and red light district.

Reviews.Title: “mid-level hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Tarff
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Park hotel in early Sept 09 and we both agreed it was a really nice and friendly hotel in a top location. The rooms and hallways are clean, the lobby and bar area looks very new and the staff were very welcoming. Our only complaint/dissappointment was the open plan bathroom in the room. the washbasin is near the side of the bed, albeit hidden by a kind of curtain. The shower and toilet cubicles do have doors but these do not lock, nor do they reach the top or bottom of the cubicle. I've been with my girlfriend now for a number of years but there are still some things you want to keep, ahem, private! Also the shower has two heads, one for a regular shower and one for a 'rainfall' shower. Our rainfall shower wasnt working, and the regular one came on with such power that it nearly flooded the bedroom. But anyway, that is really a minor complaint and didnt detract from our stay at the hotel. The main reason we chose the Park was its location - 2 minutes away from the Rijksmuseum and Leidseplein, 1 minute from the Vondelpark and little more than 10 minutes walk from the busy Dam Square which in turn is 5 minutes from the red light district and coffee shop area. Really you're right in the heart of everything but are removed enough to avoid the 24-hour tourist noise and bustle We didnt eat at the hotel as breakfast was 25 euro a head so can't vouch for the food, but it LOOKED nice

Reviews.Title: “Style over substance”
Reviews.Author: Wotski
Reviews.Content: The hotel website claims that the rooms are "Designed without interior walls, the open bathroom is truly unique and groundbreaking." In reality the "Superior" rooms are tiny, your bed is within reach of the toilet and the overspill from the shower partially floods the room. If you can ignore the shortcomings of the room (or upgrade), the location is superb, within walking distance of the nicer bits of Amsterdam and well outside of the overly touristy centre of town. Also the gym and breakfast areas are very pleasant and the entrance to the hotel has clearly had a bit of money spent on promoting a hip & contemporary image.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Excellent Front Desk, Great Breakfast Odd Rooms”
Reviews.Author: AwardproTravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Hotel and we loved the location. I was pick pocketed on the train/bus. My fault I let my guard down in a crowd. But anyway Willem Jan at the front desk of the Park Hotel called for me my CC companies and helped me get new cards. He was wonderful. OK, Now the hotel. When you get a room with two beds the view is an ugly building and roof. The rooms are small and when you walk in they have the same feel as a cruise ship, the low ceilings make it feel small. The halls smelled like chicken from the Amazing Resturant next door. The bathrooms are big with good towels. So Yeah I say stay here and when you walk out the front door, BE CAREFUL, the city is for biking. Don't forget to take the canal tour it is nice. The red light district is bazaar and the coffee shops that you can smoke pot in is even more bazaar. Keep your purse in the front not on your back like mine was. Stay at this hotel they are right next door to the famous Rijks museum. Bring an umbrella. You never ever want to have to stop your adventures because of rain. But if you forget. The hotel will loan you one. The Anne Frank house was interesting. Enjoy the city

Reviews.Title: “Cannot beat the location, Great stay”
Reviews.Author: empty002
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel cannot be beat. It is in a great area. We walked to just about everything and took the tram a couple of times, when we were tired. There are lots of cafes and bars within a short distance. You are right near Vondelpark, Hard Rock, Casino, Rijksmuseum, and the Heineken experience. We asked the front desk a few questions and they were very helpful. Our room had an enclosed bathroom, so I can't speak to the other versions. Our room had a great view of the canal. I got a pretty good deal on easytobook, so it was excellent. I wouldn't eat in the hotel much because it is quite expensive, but there are lots of other places around. If you don't stay here, try to stay somewhere near by because this is a really wonderful area.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, even better location”
Reviews.Author: lotte032
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this hotel. On arrival we were upgraded free of charge to a split level suite. The room was lovely for the price and I would definitely recommend to a friend. The location could not be beaten. I have stayed at other hotels in Amsterdam before but this is definitely my favourite and I will stay here again when I return. The attached restaurant was also one of the best in the area and I would also recommend. The only disappointing thing was the room service.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing experience”
Reviews.Author: jccCalifornia
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent three nights at this hotel this month and it was overall a disappointing experience. While its location is convenient, there were just too many other inconveniences from the very beginning to warrant recommending it to anyone. First of all, as we always do when making hotel reservations, we had requested non-feather pillows before our arrival because I have asthma and am extremely allergic to down. There were feather pillows on our bed when we arrived, and when we requested different ones, not only did we wait a long time (and we were anxious to get out in the city) before anyone showed up at our door, the housekeeping person finally came and told us that he had been looking everywhere for non-down pillows and insisted that the ones he was holding were the only ones he could find. They turned out to be feather ones again. We wound up having to go downstairs ourselves to complain to the desk manager, who finally was able to find the appropriate pillows. The inconveniences continued....although there was a note saying that the bottles of water provided for us were free, there were no bottles of water provided other than the ones in the mini-bar. There was no ironing board, nor iron, and when we inquired because we had wanted to use one, we were told that they were all "out" and that if we wanted to iron anything we would have to go iron in a different room in the hotel. There were lights missing in the bathroom, and the only lights in the actual hotel room were one small and dimly-lit floor lamp, and dim colored lights (for which one could change the colors) behind the bed. There were reading lights coming out of the wall, but they were miniscule and malfunctioning. There were not enough towels and the shower flooded the bathroom because of the design of the shower door. In addition, the hallways of the hotel were poorly vacuumed, and when the housekeeping cart was in the hallway, it took up the entire space, making it almost impossible for even a normal-sized person to pass. All in all, considering the price of a room at this hotel, these inconveniences were unacceptable... there were lots of superficial minimalist design aspects to the hotel and room interiors, which they use to promote their hotel, however this is an example of form over function and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place, Perfect Location.”
Reviews.Author: LindseySheffield
Reviews.Content: Myself, my Husband & our friends stayed for one night & it was brilliant. The staff were very helpful & courteous. Our room wasn't ready when we arrived but the Duty Manager sent us to the bar for complimentary drinks. The rooms were spacious & very well decorated. Breakfast was in the restaurant next door - Momo I think it was called, and it was without doubt the best breakfast we'd had in a european hotel. We are definately going back next year ! The location was perfect, and value for money without doubt. Right in the heart of the city & was a great base to get everywhere we wanted to go. I'd definately recomend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Has everything u could want”
Reviews.Author: RoscommonKaitland
Reviews.Content: Fab hotel -- We had taken this hotel from previous trip advisor's visits and was well worth it. The hotel is so central and nothing is a problem. Check in was quick and no problem . we were asked if our first visit and were given maps local activities, discount vouchers along with the were and were not to go. The hotel is very up to date and like the sign says the living room and dining room are like home we even saw a visitor with their feet on the sofas. The room was maybe a bit smaller than Ireland but quite sufficient when you are only using to shower and sleep. We had a room at the front overlooking the canal and was beautiful--can be a bit noisy with the street traffic but a great room for sure. The brilliant idea of the switch at the door means you re not disturbed but can request the room to be made up which is done daily with replenishing the towels, soap etc. we did not have the breakfast but would recommend the aran Irish pub which is directly facing the hotel and does a breakfast that would last you the day for â‚¬10.00. It is very central to all museums with one of the furthest away Madam Tuseaud but again all in walking distance. The canal boats and cruises can be booked directly in front of the hotel. The van gogh and the diamond museum are behind the hotel and again in walking distance. There are so many bakeries and cake shops you can build up the sugars while you walk. The real thing to be careful of is the bikes you are walking in their path and they do not stop so its a must to be careful of. We had 4 great days from the hotel to the places to visit to the weather and a definite must to go back to see what we missed. Upon checking out we had our shuttle bus booked back to the airport and also our luggage was kept for us till late in the day as we had an evening flight. The airport shuttle to the hotel is a great idea and not very expensive and saves you trying to get a taxi to and fro.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel, Ideal location and a great restaurant”
Reviews.Author: tr40
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Park Hotel for 2 nights and loved it. We had the superior room. Great bed and very contemporary interior. Very friendly staff. The location is ideal and the restaurant is very good. It will be the hotel weâ€™re staying at, next time in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great location, great location!”
Reviews.Author: ditya6um
Reviews.Content: Excellent location! Walking distance from Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh museum and Von del park. Hotel is modern and it has nice lounge chairs. Our room was spacious, had a nice shower and a bath tub. The view of the hotel from outside is magnificent during the night. Canal cruises take off from right in front of the hotel, which is very convenient. My only compaint would be that I did not find the service that exciting; kind of luke warm welcome that I received.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, bad rooms”
Reviews.Author: JLK1
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel probably can't be bettered. The staff are OK, the food is OK, the facilities are OK. The rooms are clean, the bed is probably the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever occupied. HOWEVER, the room was tiny, irritatingly so. I would estimate the room to be about 2.5m x 5.5m and that includes the glass cubicles for the toilet and shower, which are actually in the bedroom, as is the washbasin. There was a gap of about 0.3m between the end of the bed and the wall and there is virtually no cupboard space. I think this hotel would be good for an overnight stay on business but not for a holiday with luggage. It's a shame because when it was redesigned, it could easily have been so much better. I should think there is better for the price in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel with a good location”
Reviews.Author: Pearl021
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with a very good standard, nice room, good location, nice view. Good service. But it is a shame that we have to pay for the internet access.

Reviews.Title: “The best location, friendly staff, the best service!!!”
Reviews.Author: lidbel
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at Park Hotel Amsterdam from July 13 till July 20 and then after 2-weeks cruise for one more night on August 1. I must say that it's the best hotel for this class I've ever stayed at. Even being Americans and getting used for everything big we were surprised by the size of the room. We had 4 huge pieces of luggage, 2 pretty big carry-on bags and still had enough room to move around. The room and the bathroom were very clean and the bed was very comfortable. The room had an electric tea-kettle and it was very convenient to have a cup of tea or coffee in the morning with a croissant from the local grocery store! The location is the best in the city: all major museums are just a few steps away (Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh Museum), Rembrandt House and Anne Frank House are 20 -25 minutes of walking. The Canal Tour is right across the street. Leidseplein square is right behind the corner. It's an ideal location! The staff was extremely friendly: check in and check out were fast. Initially we had a room with a Canal view, but the noise from the street really bothered me during the night. After I mentioned it we were immediately given a new room facing the back yard (nice and quiet). And when we returned after our cruise to stay one more night - they already had a note and gave us a quiet room even without us mentioning it! Great service! If I had to go to Amsterdam again I would stay at Park Hotel without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Small and over priced”
Reviews.Author: exDevonchap
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Park Hotel with my wife and two friends in two executive rooms. We were very disappointed, the rooms are very small. The ensuite is two smoked glass cubicles in the bed room which give very little privacy as everything can been see and heard. They are very hygienic as when you have a shower it floods the toilet so you then need to mop it up with towel. The access to these rooms is past the main lifts and reception desks and up the service elevator - nice. The view from the room of air vents and ducts on the roof is a delight if you are a heating and ventilation geek. The inter- connecting door in the room allowed us to listen to rythmic bed activities in the next room. Breakfast in the hotal is approx Â£25 per person. Avoid

Reviews.Title: “Good 4*, excellent location, small standard room”
Reviews.Author: TylerW78
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in a standard room. The room was really very small with hardly any place to store your luggage. Can't imagine staying with two people in this room (unless if one doesn't have luggage...). For the rest it's a cool, trendy place. After renovations well decorated. A nightmare to find my room, but cleaning staff was friendly so helped me out. The bar has a nice crowd evenings, breakfast was good. Location is excellent, right in the center of Amsterdam. Beware if you come by car... parking is almost is much as you room rate!

Reviews.Title: “Its ok”
Reviews.Author: will_0007
Reviews.Content: Honestly, I was disapointed because I had high expectations, especially because of the website of the hotel. If you expect a normal hotel, averagely trendy, with standard size rooms (although I had an executive room), then this place is ok. However if you want the trendy modern place, luxury and the works... then this place will disapoint you. Also what really did not help is how I was treated at checkin. I was expecting an executive room with a canal view, and I asked the staff on purpose if I had a choice of rooms, and they rudely told me they are all nice bla bla. Then they showed me to my room, I go through an old ugly elevator... and I enter a room that is big but not nice at all, and the view was the roof of apartments. I directly call and complain, to then be sent someone to take me to a new room. Guess what, after chatting up with the guy, he told me that there is a new section in the hotel, and the room that I had was in the old one. He transfered me to the new section which has the canal view, and the room was much newer! Now, why did I have to go through this to get what I paid for, again an attempt to take advantage of tourists! Also considering the number of nice hotels in Amsterdam within the same price range, my experience here is so not memorable that I would not recommend it...

Reviews.Title: “Chic and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Il_Dolce_Vita
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous hotel! I stayed in a junior suite - room 537. The decor can best be described as the best of modern Asian and European design. The bed and bedding were so comfortable that I didn't feel the slightest bit guilty taking catnaps in the middle of the day during my stay. The suite and hotel are really as pictured on their site. There is also an elegant-trendy restaurant lounge connected to the hotel called Momo. The hotel is a stone's throw from the Vondel park, Leidsplein and Museumplein. The only negative was that wireless internet was not included but this is typical for European hotels. However, there is a nearby cafe called De Ballie where there is free wireless internet access - less than a 4 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: HereWhereEverythere
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few days while in Amsterdam for a conference. I was blown away by the design, cleanliness and comfort. Friendly staff who were very useful when we needed to get stuff delivered. Good location too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Park”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravelBermuda
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Park Hotel, Amsterdam overnight before our Scandinavia/Russia cruise. I had received a good overview of the hotel from a friend of mine who had stayed there a couple of months ago. My friend did not mislead me. The hotel was fabulous. The decor is very art deco and funky and the rooms and public areas very very clean. We had no problems with the showers as has been suggested in previous reviews and the beds were very comfortable and accomodating after our 10 hour journey. Our room overlooked the canal and there was vitually no street noise. On arrival the front desk staff were extremely courteous and were very helpful in giving us directions. It was my first trip to Amsterdam and my friends 2nd after many years and the hotel is so convenient with the park right next door and within walking distance to EVERYTHING. Try the Park!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: turner2nyc
Reviews.Content: This is a charming hotel in a wonderful location off of Leidseplein. Next to the Van Gough and Rijksmueum (make sure you get your tickets online for those museums before you go). It is across the street from the ticket booth to the canal tours. Staff was helpful, rooms were perfect size (nothing too large) and you cannot beat the location. The tram station is right around the corner. We were glad we stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but 50Euros lighter!”
Reviews.Author: EricC01
Reviews.Content: I booked a two night stay at the Park Hotel through Last Minute.Com. I booked a Twin room but on arrival i was allocated a double. When i asked for a room change to a twin the reception staff advised me that they didn't have any Twins, unless i paid 50Euros (25 per night) to upgrade to a superior room, more annoying was the receptionist said this was a common problem! This is a nice hotel, location, cleanliness and security could not be faulted, but 50Euros for a room that i thought i'd booked was a little steep. Let yourselves down there! Will be booking/staying elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Very Nice Room, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: w0rldtraveler07
Reviews.Content: Great hotel centrally located across from the Leidseplein. Next door to Van Gogh museum and Museum of Modern Art, as well as many dining options, shopping, casino (across the street), Red Light district, Central park, and night clubs. Excellent location! Room was very nice, small but this is typical for Europe, in fact I would say its on larger side in comparison to many other European hotels. Large bed (no two twins moved together!) with some interesting lighting in headboard- Red Light District in your room??? :) Conemporary decor and furniture. Desk and loveseat in room. Bathroom is notable for a nice, large soaking tub, separate glass shower. All done with stone, contemporary and clean. By US standards the room and the bathroom would be considered very small and I definitely would not recommend more then 2 people staying in the room. If you have kids traveling with you, you may want to look for some sort of suite. In summary- clean, comfortable, updated room, charming and friendly hotel, excellent location!

Reviews.Title: “Good place”
Reviews.Author: bwgs888
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for work and was not disappointed. It feels like a W hotel - quite trendy and comfortable. Friendly front desk staff packed us a breakfast box in the morning because we had a very early flight. The rooms had a kettle and coffee service and the beds were comfortable. The only fault was no face towels in the bathrooms and no lotion in the cosmetics/amenity kits.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...loved it”
Reviews.Author: frequentescaper
Reviews.Content: After reading so many reviews of how small and uncomfortable European hotels can be, I was overwhelmed with the rooms at the Park Hotel. The entire hotel is very stylish and I felt as if I were in a movie! The location could not be better, with all of the restaraunts and "tourist" places so nearby. We walked to every where and never felt unsafe for one second. When I go back, and I hope it's soon, I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DeniseDownUnder
Reviews.Content: This was our first vist to Amsterdam, and after searching trip advisor for Hotels, we chose Park Hotel. This was an excellent choice as it was close to everything. We arrived at the Hotel at 6.30am and were given our room. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I would highly recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “spacious and well located.”
Reviews.Author: LondonMadmax
Reviews.Content: choosing a hotel in AMsterdam is always a gamble but this one was certainly among the better mid range that I have stayed in. The reception is modern and spacious, and the reception staff helful. The rooms, we had the standard room, are well proportioned and ours had a view over the canal, so was light an airy. Very comfortable bed, modern bathroom and the usual range of TV channels. feature lighting was also a fun addition. Location between the vondal park, rijksmuseim and leidesplein is ideal. Breakfast, at â‚¬23 per head is probably too expensive, the nearby bars and restaurants will get you better value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: gutwrench
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Park Hotel for 4 nights in April. The hotel is very modern and clean and the location is great. We were offered an upgrade of room at a cost, but choose not to take it as we had a superior room anyway. The rooms are very clean, but also quite small. Only a curtain seperates the toilet and shower doors so not alot of privacy really. Pillows are like sleeping on wafers which was not good!! Staff were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and gnerally modern, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Legalyblond901
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Park Hotel i Amsterdam for the weekend during the Holland v Scotlan football match. Overall my i enjoyed my stay at the hotel. The hotel was in an axcellet location, right in the heart of Amsterdam. Museums, pubs, cafes and shops all on the hotel doorstep. The hotel is made up of 3 different building blocks. The front of the hotel, with the nice glass balcony windows are one block. And our hotel was in the back block. Our block, had a bit of a funny smell and the carridors were very dark and a bit spooky. However our room was black and white and very modern. The room was clean, and had a really cool open-plan bathroom/shower. We had a good sized plasma TV and heated tiles in the bathroom. I would stay here again and overal enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Maevey
Reviews.Content: I had read reviews on The Park Hotel before we went were a little worried that we had picked the wrong hotel. We we very pleasantly surprised when we pulled up outside in a taxi to find out how central the hotel was. Beside Vondelspark and opposite the Leidesplein, which is full of restaurants and bars which cater for every taste. The room was well furnished and very comfortable, the powershower was excellent, and despite the reviews on the bathrooms, it was quirky, modern and worked very well and particularly loved the shower gels etc. The lobby was very comfortable, modern and welcoming and the staff were the friendlies staff I have ever come accross in a City hotel. One word of advice is if you want to book the restaurant for your evening meal, make sure you book it at the time you book your room. Momo Restaurant is some of the best asian food we have ever tried and it was so popular that the hotel manager had dificulty in fitting us in. In the middle of March it was fully booked every night. Breakfast was wonderful and catered for everyones taste. Location was just fantastic, beside the Rijks Museum and the Van Gogh Museum, and up the road for the Hop on Hop Off Canal bus. (don't do the tour opposite the hotel, bad value) Walking distance of Dam Square and the blooming market, easily accessed even with walking difficulties. Watch out for the bikes as they are everywhere and they do not stop!! Great hotel and will definitely book to return again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location for exploring a beautiful city.”
Reviews.Author: hulahula17
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Park Hotel during my Easter break to Amsterdam and I cannot speak more highly of it. The location is fabulous making it the ideal base to explore the city by foot or by tram. It is literally a five minute stroll from the Van Gogh, Bols and the Rijiksmuseums and there are ample restaurants, bars and shops on your door step to cater for all budgets. Our deal did not include breakfast but there is the option to book this for an extra 25 euros per night, which I felt was a bit pricey as it was only continental so we opted to eat out which can be done at one of the many Pancake houses locally. The hotel was easy to find and I would recommend getting the hotel shuttle bus service as taxis are notoriously over priced. We arranged for the shuttle bus to pick us up to go back to the airport too, it cost around 22 euros for a return ticket. The staff were very polite and helpful and the room was clean and spacious. I am very keen to have a quiet and good nights sleep on holidays and that was certainly had. The bed was really comfortable, perhaps too comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “The Park Hotel Totally Rules!”
Reviews.Author: LasVegasTravelingMan
Reviews.Content: The Park Hotel in Amsterdam is located in the city centre within walking distance or a short cab ride to numerous restaurants and attractions. The lobby is spacious and contemporary and has access to the new hot gathering spot and Japanese themed restaurant, Momo's. The rooms are lartge and well appointed. Some face the Hard Rock and shopping center across the street. Check out the LEDs across the tops of the floor-to-ceiling windows. You can select any one of seven colors (we liked them so much that we are having them installed in our home in Las Vegas next week). The staff is friendly and helpful. The room rates are reasonable. We visit Amsterdam often and the Park Hotel will be our destination from now on. Nancy and I give the hotel the top rating!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant... if you can get it discount rate”
Reviews.Author: Ivor_Chelmsford
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very good and well appointed. We got it in a combined 3 nights' B&B hotel+Eurostar travel deal for Â£250 each which represents good value for this hotel. We booked a Superior Room but on arrival were upgraded to an Executive Room. The room was clean and comfortable with tea-making facilities - a must for us English but not always found in hotels abroad. Breakfast was good and plentiful with the usual choice between continental and cooked (or both), but a word of advice: to avoid the rush, don't get to the dining room after 9.15am. Location is good. All the city centre's attractions are within less than half hour's walk; even Amsterdam Central station. Alternatively, tram numbers 1, 2 or 5 (â‚¬1.60) take you right from the station to within a couple of hundred yards of the hotel. There was a lovely lounge with comfortable chairs by the fire and lots of books to browse in the hotel's library. Overall, a delightful 8.5 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Debi W
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a weekend break in February for myself and my partner. The hotel is very clean and modern and is in an excellent location for shopping, sightseeing and nightlife. On the down side the rooms are very small, even for just the two of us, we struggled for room when both getting washed/dressed. Also with trams and a main road outside, don't expect a lie in, the noise will wake you early!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect weekend away...”
Reviews.Author: strawberryearth
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam is well worn with travellers and party goers alike. Its laid back attitude and fun nature make it the perfect place to visit, explore or drink your way across. The Park Hotel was under going some renovation when we were there. My partner and I were not aware of this at the time of booking, only when we were showed to our room...not as we saw it on the website! The room was a dingy white, woodchip hole with old "dormitory" style curtains and bathroom. I wanted to cry. For weeks before the visit I had been on their website to get a feel for the hotel and the area, it looked like they had taken pictures of somewhere else! It was late and we were tired, so we just went to bed with a view to seeing how we felt in the morning. We were woken early by drilling and banging only to realise that our window lead out to the forecourt of the building works, and the builders could see straight into our room (our curtains were closed but the night before we couldnt see out there!). We went straight to the reception where we told them our issues with the room and said how unhappy we were there, they told us to put our bags on the beds in the room and they would move our stuff for when we got back from our morning coffee. I know this all sounds like the start of a horrid time, but that really was the only problem, they sorted out the problem as soon as we told them and were very apologetic. I got a letter of apology from the hotel manager later that day, which I thought was a nice thought. If you have a problem with your room, rather than silently seething, go and speak to someone. They dont know anything is wrong unless you tell them. Our second room was perfect. It was as the internet had shown and I can only assume the hotel was upgrading all of the rooms like this and we were in one of the few remaining old, nasty rooms. Why they put us in that one to begin with I have no idea, but I was very happy once we were moved. The hotel is in a fabulous location, its much quieter than Dam Square end, but its not far to get to. I like walking around new places, and a 20min walk is nothing to me. If, however, you dont like walking such distances, the tram is very well located all over the city and very easy to use. Locals are all very friendly and will speak to you (with no hidden agenda) while waiting for the bus/tram. Ask you how your stay is and where you are from. I could live in Amsterdam very happily. The shopping is fab, the people are wonderful and friendly and the bars are electric with atmosphere. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: sh29
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel directly, and was a little concerned when i read up some of the reviews. I can honestly say there was snothing to worry about. from the moment we arrived, which was quite early, 9.30, everything was perfect, we had only gone to the hotel to drop off our bags as I knew check in was not until 2pm. to our suprise the receptionist said our room was available and we where also upgraded to an executive room, with complimentary drinks in Momo's. The room was really nice and clean, a very comfortable size. shower does leak slightly but this is only because the shower is qiote powerful and the water does not run away quickly enough, but nothing to spoil the stay as some people where stating. The hotel staff where very friendly and helpful. Momo's is a great place to drink, a really buzzing atmosphere. All in all, I would defo reccomend this hotel, clean, modern, great location and a realxing place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Sherlocko
Reviews.Content: Group of us travelled over to amsterdam and stayed in the Park Hotel... We got an exceptional deal of â‚¬95 per nite for the standard rooms.. When we arrived to the hotel all our rooms were upgraded to the executive rooms (bathroom seperate).. The rooms were perfect, clean and extremely quiet... The location was excellent and the bar in the hotel very chic and classy, drinks were fairly expensive but worth calling in..Would definitely recommend this hotel,,,

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Food & Great Service!!”
Reviews.Author: Mabloo
