Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Park Hotel with my girlfriend for 3 nights. Had heard a great deal about Amsterdam so was keen to explore for myself! We could not have picked a better base than the Park. Based in the trendy shopping and museum district of Amsterdam it has great connections to the whole city and friendly effecient staff. We made our way there easily from Schipol airport with some help from the tourist info desk. We bought a travel pass which is a must as it lets you use all the local transport around amsterdam. The hotle itself was immaculate inside. We'd noticed that the restaurant 'momo' attached was heaving of an evening with young city workers all eating and drinking. We soon found out why when we went to breakfast in the morning, normally 25 Euro, so definately worth going B&B. Amazing selection of food and all hot and fresh. The reception team were really great aswell, they gave us a map of the city and pointed out a few places of interest. They also booked Taxi's for us and booked restaurants. Walked to your cab by the porters was a great touch, felt really safe in their hands. The shower does leak into the bedroom but a towel on the floor solves that problem, certainly wasn't going to hold that against them. Possibly the softest beds in the world aswell, really comfy if you like a soft bed. One thing I would say is that it's best to get an Executive Room as the Superior rooms do not have the best view, the Executive Rooms look out over the canal, whereas our room looked out onto a roof top. When you think about it though, your there to explore the city, not your Hotel Room!! In conclusion...Not a bad word to say about this hotel. Walking distance from everything, very clean, warm, very friendly helpful staff....excellent!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, Nice Hotel, uncomfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: Candy.BridgeUK
Reviews.Content: I picked the hotel as I wanted to be near the venue for a show I was attending and liked the look of the rooms from the photo's, especially as they appeared to have a small "step out" balcony. I chose the Executive Room as I believed these were the ones to have this. I arrived at the property and was welcomed at the front desk and everything was handled fine and the staff were friendly. I was given a room on the 6th floor. The room was nicely furnished, clean and perfectly big enough for my needs, though it could have done with a small coffee table. But I was very disappointed to discover the door to the "step out" balcony had been locked and the facility to open it removed. I dont understand why they did that as some people like to get a little fresh air sometimes. A kettle was missing from my room but a call to the front desk sorted this out. The bed though was so uncomfortable. It's foam on top of a base and one end of it was so worn down my legs ended up higher than my head. The pillows are also a bit soft. I ended up moving to the other end and sleeping the other way round. It was much better. Others have commented on how comfy they found the bed, but in my case I've never slept in such an uncomfortable bed so I guess it varies. The general feeling is the hotel is nice and the staff friendly and courteous, room nice with great view, nice general areas and in a great location, but bed was uncomfortable and disappointing no "step out" balcony. I'd be happy to recommend it to a friend but I'd definitely mention the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't quite live up to the image”
Reviews.Author: JMBe
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, bang next-door to the museums, and so convenient for transport into the rest of the city. It's a design place, with a lot of thought and money going into the experience, creating a fantastic impression on arrival. But it doesn't last. Our room, #161, was very noisy and we had to ask to be moved. Our friends' room didn't have a kettle, and despite our requests for one, none ever arrived. The room was cleaned, but the bins and empty minibar bottles weren't removed. Breakfast was very nice, but with no hot plates, the cooked food quickly became cold. Worst of all, the hotel bar is inaccessible to guests in the evening because it is taken over by crowds of trendy locals - so suffering from its own success. I love Amsterdam, but my next stay won't be at the Park. Oh, and charging â‚¬20 for one day's wi-fi is a shocker!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: sheiln3
Reviews.Content: If your looking for a clean comfy modern hotel with a fantastic location look no further. This hotel was spotless and was cleaned every morning while we were staying there. The rooms are a good size with a balcony. The bathrooms are different and there is some leakage from the shower but nothing a towel cant dry up. We paid less than 350euro for 4 nights here and I feel it was excellent value for money, a fantastic hotel with great service and friendly staff. I would stay in this hotel again no problem.

Reviews.Title: “You have many excellent choices, make an informed one.”
Reviews.Author: phazwrp
Reviews.Content: This review is for all types of traveler. Like most, I am a traveler who expects to get what is advertised and what is paid for. As far as reviews go, I could be considered a â€œfair-weatherâ€� reviewer. I love to make a recommendation and/or review only when I am extremely satisfied or extremely dissatisfied. This is my 3rd trip in 2009 and my first review. What has prompted this review is how horrible this hotel was on so many levels. I have been to Amsterdam 5 times over the past 2 years; staying from hostel to hotel, no star rating to 4 stars and with exception to this trip feel I received everything I paid for. United should be ashamed for recommending this hotel with a 4 star rating. Hotel is situated in a good location, and walking into the hotel was quite impressive. I believed that the rude and condescending hotel staff just was a part of staying at a nice hotel, and by the looks of the lobby this was going to be a great hotel. Well designed and comfortable, the lobby is exactly as photographed and described. In an almost empty hotel, I still had to wait until the 2PM check-in time, which I do understand is usual and should be expected. But it is the unexpected that makes a 4+ star hotel, especially in these hard times. And especially since the room was available to me. Still the lobby was so nice, so I was patient. It was so nice in fact> I inquired at the desk if they could accommodate me for 3 more nights- Sunday, Monday and Tuesday. Knowing the online rate, I was further curious regarding what the quote was going to be. On the (weeknights remember) that I requested, the quote was 40% more that advertised online (in an almost empty hotel.) I still seriously considered it. Fortunately, I decided to wait until 2PM check-in so I would have the privacy to check prices again online and to call United to reschedule my flight. Room is grossly exaggerated. GROSSLY! The bed was comfortable, though. It was like the rooms were an afterthought. Furthermore, no aromatherapy as described, just some low budget toiletries. Similar to Best Western, Vegas. The tragic continental breakfast opens at 7AM, and donâ€™t think if you get down there at 6:45 you can get a cup of coffee from one of the 2 coffee machines the hotel has. Because all you will get is a â€œthe restaurant opens at 7, sorry.â€� Again, the little extra it would of taken to say yes would have been the difference between expected and unexpectedâ€¦ especially since the door man that told me this was drinking a coffee from the machine. On the last hours of my trip (Sunday morning,) as I sat in the restaurant, my opinion of this hotel was sealed. Up till now, I chalked off the rude and condescending staff as just a language barrier, I am a very reasonable person. Figure I must be because to chalk it off as a barrier would ignore the fact that most of them spoke some English, and ignore the fact that my other 4 stays in Amsterdam have been fabulous. Anyway, I met the one person, who to confirm all things, one of two nice employees at the hotel. (There was one pleasant woman at the front desk.) Anyway, I was sitting there almost ready to choke down one more horrible free breakfast, when I saw a mouse running along side of the breakfast bar. Mind you, I have lived in cities with rats the size of small cats, so I am not grossed out or scared. The lady setting up the buffet walked by so I mentioned it to her. I said, â€œYou have a little helper there.â€� Suddenly the sour-puss face that seemed to be a hotel policy dropped off her face and she became the 2nd nice person I met employed by the hotel. No more language barrier, or attitude ((and she spoke the least English of everyone>>â€¦ but made her way through how they have tried traps and poisons and still cant get rid of him. And with an// If You Canâ€™t Beat Em, Join Em attitude, said, â€œso we named him Chip!â€� And in ending, I am home reviewing my statement and the Park Hotel has 2 unauthorized pending transactions on my credit card, One for $+450 USD and one for $+580 USD. Disputing once posts, but worries me now. Last thing you want to deal with 5000 Miles away on Jet Lag. To the future traveler, I hope that this review is considered very seriously in deciding your stay. I was extremely dissatisfied, good luck on your decision. And to the hotel, Hire an exterminator only after you hire some sort of Customer Relations Supervisor. It is sad that a rodent infestation is second to your miserable staff. There is no reason that any guest should leave your 4 star hotel feeling mistreated, robbed and lied to. I did the research and paid the price because I wanted this trip to Amsterdam to be more relaxing than my normal Amsterdam party. I will only be satisfied if United credits me on the hotel portion of my vacation, since your hotel and your staff could only smirk and say â€œIâ€™m sorry.â€�

Reviews.Title: “not the place we thought it would be”
Reviews.Author: ulsterelks
Reviews.Content: After reading a lot of reviews we thought this must be the hotel to stay and i know people like different thing but this hotel was not for us.We were able to check in as soon as we arrived wich was about 11am which was good but as we booked the rooms (2) together we thought we would be beside each other but we got 1 on floor 1 and 1 on floor 2 .After looking on the webside we thought the rooms were a good size but how wrong we were ,after having a shower we were able to have a bath on the floor after as half the room flooded ,the bed were very uncomfortable to sleep on and the pillows are very soft so i asked for 2 more but the never arrived, the breakfast is ok but not worth 23 euro, our room overlooked the back covered in portacabins but is was quite ,my wife sister and husband were in a room at the side of the hotel and didnt got much sleep with the noise of the trams and the nightclub down below.The location is not to bad but there are a lot of hotels more central and at a better price.I know some people do and some dont but when checking out make sure to check your bill as we got charged for an extra breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly acceptable”
Reviews.Author: beccy12001
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a short break in Amsterdam in August 2008. I thought this hotel was good for the money we paid. Its a good base to explore, right by the Vondelpark, and you can walk to most central places at a push. Most tram lines stop near to the hotel. Its very clean, and the bed is super comfy! The bathroom arrangement in many rooms is a bit odd. The sink is right next to the bed, and there is a separate toilet and shower cubicles that open right out onto a tiled area in the room, with frosted glass doors. There isn't a huge amount of privacy, and sometimes water from the shower can leak under the door onto the tiled area as there isn't a watertight seal, but this wasn't a big issue. Rooms are cleaned every day. Other negative points are that if the people next door are being quite loud, you can hear them as the walls are quite thin but most of the time it was fine. Also, the restaurant in the hotel is very expensive. Following the recent renovation, the hotel does look very nice, with lovely touches everywhere. But I think that all the renovations are superficial and I might be disappointed if I had paid a lot of money to stay here. Overall, despite minor negative points, these didn't really affect our stay and overall I enjoyed it and thought this was a great place to stay in Amesterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Feng Shui”
Reviews.Author: Malenkij
Reviews.Content: Confortable Hotel in Museum District of Amsterdam, close to a channel Lobby with a New Age Atmosphere Good Service

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel with a cheap face lift”
Reviews.Author: BoutiqueDesignFan
Reviews.Content: Some years ago I stayed at the Park on business. It was formal and high quality, great for a business trip. I recently noticed the hotel had been updated and thought great, another chance to go back while passing through Amsterdam on a European tour. We booked three nights at 200 euros plus tax a night. I am not sure were to start on this review, it was that bad. Firstly check under the bed and sofa or chairs, especially if you have young children. We found sweets, rubbish, money and pills. I could not believe it - the cleaners are awful - the rooms are filthy. Then the smell of drains in the lobby - oh it looks sexy, but you can't stand the smell so can't use the area. They are apparently aware of this issue, but come on it's a 4 start hotel?! What else, the service. I was asked to pay a 40 euros charge for our pre-paid breakfast. Then after informing them we were asked to stand in front of everyone eating while they checked - nice. The noise. If it's windy and you are on the fifth floor take ear plugs. The wind noise off the roof, will keep you up, or the noise from one of the service rooms were cleaners enter and exit at all hours. They seam to also have washing machines going in them and that's not a nice noise while staying away from home. I could go on and on there was a lot of shabby service and details here, doors chipped and stained carpets are the start of it. Don't been sucked in my the fancy art directed images of the lobby, with copy design classic furniture or the key new rooms, this is a very old lady with a cheap black market face-lift that has gone very wrong!

Reviews.Title: “favourite hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: sameplacefan
Reviews.Content: I've been visiting Amsterdam for many years,usually 2 or 3 times a year.Over the years I've stayed at many different hotels with generally good experiences.The one hotel I keep returning to is the Park Hotel (in fact I haven't stayed at any other hotel in Amsterdam for quite a number of years) for the following reasons 1) location 2)comfort 3)pleasant and helpful staff 4)value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good staff great location”
Reviews.Author: cokeandblow
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at this hotels just couple hours before arriving and when I got there they had everything ready and no confusion about my reservation, as in some other hotels when you do same day booking. The whole staff I met spoke great english and was very friendly and helpfull without being too pushy about their restaurant etc. The room was rather small, but had everything I needed.. bed, table for laptop and decent sized bathroom. Location of the hotel is simply amazing, right next door to some cool museums, casino accross the streets and shopping and bars/restaurants just couple minutes walk away. My only complains are about the ridiclously expensive internet (18â‚¬ per 24hours I think) and rather bad room service menu, orded a pizza from there and it seemed like a frozen pizza that they had to put in a new package. Overall for the price of 90â‚¬ per night I think this hotel is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Park Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: nlflux
Reviews.Content: Me and my now Fiance went to the park hotel end of november, we got a great bargain by booking it on expedia. Everything went smooth & excellent front reception staff. Everything looked like it was just renovated and has a very great atmospere. We had the Executive Room which was very spacious and the best shower I have had in ages! I would defiantly go back again, esp as this is the best position to stay within Amsterdam. The only let down was the pricey internet charges, either for in your room or the wifi at the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Dutch Christmas”
Reviews.Author: KenyaOxford
Reviews.Content: Friendly, perfect location, great decor, great restaurant. Atmosphere in the hotel was good everyone seemed happy it is also a perfect location next to the canal and the art galleries. This was important for us as husband not able to walk far so being near the main art galleries was great. The hotel is modern but managed to also have a very homely atmosphere particularly in the trendy restaurant where the food is of a high standard. We love orchids and these were everywhere. What more can we say it all added to a very enjoyable dutch christmas booked through airmiles and we hope to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Park Hotel has style but watch out in the loo!”
Reviews.Author: carlitas
Reviews.Content: The Park Hotel has bags of style and great common areas to lounge and Momo bar/restaurant attached. We stayed there over Christmas and got a bargain on Expedia but without breakfast which is around Â£25 for continental offering which we did not sample. The Superior room is small, too small for me and has nice extras, like rain shower, we got upgraded to an Executive room which was more the size of a standard double room, very nice indeed. We requested a balcony and got a room around the side road of the hotel which was very nice, our friends stayed in a room overlooking the canal and their balcony did not open. One very important point though if you're travelling with a new partner, the toilet (as is the shower) is a freestanding unit in your bedroom and not a separate room so your partner hears EVERYTHING in stereo that you're up to in there! This should be highlighted on Expedia. This would not deter me from choosing the Park Hotel to stay again with my sister but not with my boyfriend. The staff are on the whole were very friendly and helpful apart from the grump who checked us in at 4am, questioning our arrival time despite numerous emails. Such a pity about the loo in the room, this hotel is stylish and the bed was extremely comfortable....

Reviews.Title: “My 28th Bday in Dam”
Reviews.Author: mestiza2nv
Reviews.Content: Ok I would just like to start off by saying that where we stayed has got to be the most expensive city I've ever been in. Although, I have been advised that where the hotel is situated and the surrounding area is well known for its ridiculously high prices. So please make sure that you bring enough money esp if you plan to eat in this area and not travel for your meals as 3 nights here cost us Â£450. For me, this is a lot of money for two people and all we did was eat out two or three times a day (not in exceptionally great restaurants just little cafe places) - thats it - didnt go to museums, there was no night life while we were there (Tues to fri) and we dont drink anyway! So Anyway, the hotel - really nice for a european hotel. We got an excellent deal with expedia and the flights were cheap so I was really impressed. The superior rooms are quite small but I have stayed in smaller, its a bit strange how the sink is near the bed and the shower and toilet are in your bedroom with a bit of a glass divider and curtain. The bed is soooo comfortable but if you have a bad back then its not good idea as my boyfriend has a really bad back and he couldnt get up in the morning!!!! The TV is nice, the room is modern and and well decorated. Movies are expensive (13 euros) Momo the bar/restaurant in the hotel is a great place to sit for a drink and dinner although I didnt try any food in there, the kitchen is open and I saw them preparing and cooking food it looked very appetizing. One of the managers gave us a free drink each in Momo because it was my birthday. The staff are really attentive and polite. The weather was absolutely freezing and for some reason the streets were very quiet. We spoke to an owner of a bar in Leidsplein and she said that they were losing a lot of money, people were not out or if they do come out it would be between midnight and 3am. Restaurants were also empty it was very strange. I'm glad I didnt come here with a group of friends for a few nights out as we would have been very disappointed. I know this isnt the norm as friends that had gone previously a few months ago were out every night and it was very busy. The redlight district was very entertaining! We enjoyed walking past the windows, very interesting! If we go again, we would choose a cheaper area, and try and get a deal that includes a few meals at the hotel because it was food that cost us so much money. Other then the money I had a fantastic time and would love to visit in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great City Break Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SABWork
Reviews.Content: Neat and clean room, but it was very small! Breakfast was not particularly good, but better than nothing. Really quite expensive, but in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: reefo1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Park Hotel december 2007 - only writing review now as i have just returned from amsterdam again after a dreadful stay at a different hotel and am sorry i didnt book the Park Hotel again! This hotel was fab, great location, helpful friendly staff, gorgeous rooms which all seemed to be newly decorated, great service from staff, excellent facilities in hotel. The only thing i would complain about would be that the rooms were very small and very pricey however we got a great deal last year in a package including flights but that was not available this year hence the reason for going to a different hotel this time! Overall though fantastic hotel and i would certainly return again and again if the price was right!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Aspen17
Reviews.Content: Just returned from this hotel. A really lovely stay. Great location, Close to Vondelpark & ideal for the Museums. We normally stay near Central station but this is a far better location. The staff were professional & friendly. I would stay here again when i return to the Dam.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: samson95
Reviews.Content: Really worth visiting since they did their renovation. Rooms are well appointed and not bad size for european city. surrounding area is great with excellent shopping and restaurants nearby. the bar downstairs momoÂ´s is a real scene so you donÂ´t need to go very far to find a good crowd. definitely recommended for business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Best address in town!”
Reviews.Author: dutchguy
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel with perfect location and low prices when booked through some booking sites like hotels.com or booking.com The Park Hotel has finished it's renovation and the result is quite stunning. Very modern lobby with big library (mainly art books), friendly people at the reception, rooms (I had a Superior double which is a standard room) are a bit on the small side but have all the space one needs. I was first given room 121, on the noisy street side (where the tram goes) but could easily change to one on the opposite side of the corridor, room 214, which are totally quiet, also no noise from neighbouring rooms. Very modern style, which I normally don't like but this was quite wonderful. The shower room and toilet are in what looks like a cupboard, but narrow. Taking a shower by the big rainfall shower floods the toilet floor and the entry hall floor and I had to put a towel over it. Big flat TV (32 inch) on a wall right in front of the bed (at least in room 214 , in 121 it is a bit next to the bed). Very romantic is the ambient light behind the bed, which has 7 colours to choose from, creating a very romantic atmosphere when being in bed together (but I was alone). Bed was the nicest I have ever slept in, quite soft. Nice toiletries of the Dutch brand Rituals. Minibar has reasonable prices, no space for own drinks but enough space to move the water bottles out and then put own drinks there. Small desk, 2 chairs. Double glazing, double curtains that quite block out daylight Breakfast (till 10.30 AM) is pricey (23, 50 Euro) but abundant, "the most elaborate international breakfast in town" as the hotel says. I doubt that, but it surely is impressive, Eggs any style made to order. There were only young people eating when I took breakfast on a Sunday, in the modern, stylish restaurant MOMO. I think this is THE hotel to stay in Amsterdam. To reach it easily, take tram 2 or 5 from Central Station, get off opposite Rijksmuseum (one stop after Leidseplein) and walk back a little. If you also need quietness and booked the cheapest rooms (Superior Double) then ask for a room with numbers 109 to 115 , 209 to 215, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Ultra trendy city centre haven, thanks to a recent refurbishment!”
Reviews.Author: SophieCalifornia
Reviews.Content: I had originally booked two nights on Expedia, at the nearby American Hotel in the Leidseplein area of the city centre, but I arrived at The American only to discover that they had an error with their reservation system and I had to stay in The Park for the first night instead. It was well worth the reservation mess-up, because The Park had recently undergone a total makeover and the lobby area and all rooms have been refurbished to a whole new level of modern design. I had last been in The Park back in 2003 and it has been totally transformed. The lobby now looks like you're walking into an art museum! There is a hotel library and relaxing reading area near the bar and a new lounge area. Rooms are all extremely chic, but very cosy. I had a standard twin bed room and the bed I slept in was very comfortable indeed. The room was immaculately clean and toiletries are great quality. The hotel is just across from Vondelpark and the Leidseplein and within walking distance from all the major Amsterdam city centre attractions, top cafes and restaurants. The staff at the hotel were very welcoming towards me and helped me out as much as they could, especially as I had originally been booked in via their rival hotel due to their mistake! The only downside about The Park is that there are no leisure facilities at all, not even a gym.

Reviews.Title: “Great, comfortable, perfectly situated hotel”
Reviews.Author: bobdibest
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated near the Leidseplein Square, fashion district, tramlinks etc The hotel has recently been completely gutted and refitted with new high fashion style minimalist rooms, each with nice bathrooms, flat screen tvs, aircon etc. Beds are comfortable and the shower is great too The hotel has a great restaurant but its only downside is a hugely over expensive breakfast, even if it is great - recommend getting it included in the package because to buy on top of room price its â‚¬23 a day!! The hotel is a great stay over all

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: Holando-Argentino
Reviews.Content: We knew the Park Hotel from the outside last year and just used the lobby at that time. This year we booked the hotel for our 5-day trip to Amsterdam and found the entire hotel had been refurbished. The lobby was not recognizable: it was vastly bigger and very stylish. The frontdesk people were not only very friendly but extremely knowledgeable and helpful. The room was nice and clean but we did not like the beds: they were too soft and used eiderdown comforters instead of regular blankets (which we obtained after requesting them anyway). We used the restaurant sparingly for breakfast because we are not great eaters and the only choice was a buffet, which was very complete indeed but rather pricey. In conclusion, we were happy with the hotel, can recommend it to others and we plan to return to it when we are back in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “The Park Hotel - Well, We Got to Laugh A Lot!”
Reviews.Author: RogueFour
Reviews.Content: Oh, the Park Hotel, what memories you have given us. This was not our first, second, third, fourth, fifth, etc. choice. But we chose to go to Amsterdam during the International Broadcast Conference, and really, it was nearly impossible to find a room. Because of the conference, the prices were ludicrous. The first night was about $500, with each successive night a little less expensive. The art deco lobby was cool, and you think, wow, this might be neat. Then you hear the directions to your room. You literally turn the corner and leave the art deco behind and arrive in a dinghy, scary hallway. Then the elevator is pretty much an old freight elevator converted for guests. Then it's another flight of stairs up to the fifth floor where our room was. Upon entering the hallway, the first thing I noticed was the smell. To me, it was like stale trash lingering in the hallway. It never went away. The room was ... interesting. The bed was amazingly comfortable, and it had funky lighting so you could sleep in your own private red light district, or blue light, or yellow, or green, or white. You get the idea. The bathroom area was cramped, and the shower -- yes, it's exactly as everyone says ... flood, flood, flood. We tried everything, but the most we got was ... less flooding. We had a room overlooking the road, so it was very noisy. And, it just didn't feel clean, I wanted to walk through the room with an antibacterial wipe, and believe it or not, I am decidedly not a germaphobe. The location was extraordinary ... you can't fault that, and if you don't mind the smell, the shower, etc. this is a good place. It is kind of funky. But weirdly, this was our last stop on our European honeymoon, and this was the only place we met rude staff. But we laughed it off, things like, you can only get the full breakfast buffet in MOMO, you can't get just a coffee, well, you can, but they'll only serve it to you in the lobby. But did I mention the bed was super comfy? I can't say this place was horrible, only that we would never stay here again. But it was kind of funny.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: LONDONMANIA
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Park Hotel when we eventually found it! Walked from Central Station which is not a good idea... We paid Â£130 p/n - the special weekend package from their website (was a better offer than any of the other hotel / travel websites). We were disappointed to be shown to a dark room at the back of the hotel overlooking containers, the room just about big enough to accomodate the bed - felt like we were in a broom cupboard! We upgraded (additional Â£50 p/n) to a studio room which was alot nicer on a split level overlooking the canal. The bed was one of those electric ones with remotes which was very amusing! The room itself was nice and airy, although it did have a distinct smell of a dead rat! I am not joking! The hotel is not as contemporary as you expect it to be - they haven't quite got it right. On the other hand the staff were extremely pleasant and helpful. The hotel is in a good location to explore nearby attractions and coffee shops! Try to master the tram system sooner than later - it's well worth it and easy when you know how! A MUST to get around Amsterdam! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “mediocre - not at all what I expected”
Reviews.Author: omarlyn
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from the hotel, my overall impression of the hotel is average. From the outside of the hotel, it looks like a mix between old & new as all the other reviews have mentioned the hotel is currently being renovated. My husband & I arrived an hour before check-in, are room we ready when we arrived. Checking in was swift, finding the room at first was fairly confusing we had to use two lifts, when we finally got to the rooms the first thing I noticed was this bad smell. Kind of like uncleaned toilets, this smell stayed with me throughout my whole stay. The restaurant was expensive, the staff were pleasant. But for what was advertised to me as a 4* hotel it was more like a 3* & for that reason alone not worth the money I know some people have paid for it. I paid â‚¤320 for a 2 night stay including flights from London (lastminute.com), reasonable price I know however I would not stay the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good...but”
Reviews.Author: pderrick
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel on easy book to 175.00 CAD per night. A good price for this hotel. It's extremely clean, the staff are friendly, the rooms are very very nice, and the beds are super comfy. But...everything you have read on here before about the showers backing up is 100% true. Ours backed up and we had water all over the bathroom floor that made it's out the front doorway and into the hall. We let the front desk know and they sent up the mais who just gave us some extra towels???? Whatever. Anyway we aren't the kind of people who make a big stink about things, so we forgot about it. We only stayed one night anyway. Had we stayed another night, we would have requested another room. Aside from the shower, everything else was top notch. Would stay again, but would make sure the shower worked first.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JollyJR
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel as it gave us a good laugh! I have to agree with most of the recent reviews , it's location is it's biggest selling point. You could easily walk to anywhere within the central area. Beware if you are under 5 foot tall you will have problems reaching the check in desk , wardrobe and breakfast items ! The new restaurant MOMO is suffering from style overload , watch out for low swinging lights over tables! Breakfast was excellent if not a bit pricey . The evening menu was totally weird and overpriced - still there are a huge number of excellent eateries within 5 minutes walk so we didn't use it !. The room was a little small for a superior room and beware the shower does flood the room ! Again style over practicality is the word here. The bed was rather soft with it's three ( yes three) mattresses! The coffee / tea making facility was a bonus. Nice toiletries and towels ( which you need for mopping up the floor). The refurbishment is still ongoing which led to an interesting route to our room on the 4th Floor- but we soon got used to it ! Beware if you have kiddies our windows opened to a shear 4 floor drop which was a bit scary ! Overall a good hotel , in a great location . We would stay here again - just for the laughs!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but didn't like the lifts”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireSkippy
Reviews.Content: We have just spent a weekend at this hotel and we were on the 3rd floor. We thought the hotel overall was very good but a big criticism were the lifts which we disliked immensely. Having to change lifts just to reach the 3rd floor /go downstairs several times a day was a real hassle - we weren't too bothered about the refurbishment though - I know it had been a lot worse prior to our visit. Our room was really lovely and even though it had quite a bit of street noise going on outside well into each night we didn't find it too much of an inconvenience - you are in the City after all! We didn't like the shower and toilet cubicles. You could regularly end up with your feet and clothing drenched each time the loo was used which was a real nuisance. Overall, a well positioned hotel with nice canal views but it was the Staff and the food which made it extra special. Would stay there again without hesitation and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Park Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cgkr
Reviews.Content: Terrific location- quiet, safe and easy to get around on foot or with tram. Helpful staff. Beautiful rooms. Loved the bar/resto next door (Momo).

Reviews.Title: “Not to good”
Reviews.Author: tinkzz
Reviews.Content: we booked this short break to amsterdam for 2 couples, having being to amsterdam before we decided that if we wanted a good hotel we would need to book at least a 4* we paid Â£600 per couple for 3 nights. when we arrived the reception was lovely, but when checking in we were told we have 2 pay 15% city tax as well as 100 euro per couple as a deposit for the mini bar...with hesitation we paid it but were unhappy about this... when giving our room number we were told to follow a man made hallway which was a health hazard,being on the 3rd floor we had to use the lift with our luggage the life was the most scariest thing ive ever cin in a hotel... the rooms wer weird with ur bathroom in ur bed room and just a frosted door which flodded everytime u used it to cover ur modesty... there was a lot of refurbishment going on.........beware....... the only goog thing i can sayabout this hotel is that the best id so0o0o comfy.... i would not reccomend this hotel !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - will use this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: widgey77
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend in the Dam. My hubby has stayed at the Park previously and was very impressed with the refurb. We had room 416 on the fourth floor (obviously) which was a very modern double room with LCD tv, ultra modern black tiled bathroom with chrome fittings, very comfortable double bed, air-con (thank goodness, it was very hot that weekend), mini bar, hairdryer etc etc. Check-in was quick and easy, and a porter took our luggage to the room. I had requested a quiet room and this is exactly what we got - the view was over the roof tops rather than the canal/road which meant that there was no traffic noise at all. We stayed on room only basis. As the hotel is finishing off the renovations there was a little bit of work going on but nothing to disrupt our stay apart from the lift breaking down on the morning we were leaving, so had to carry out luggage down the stairs. Could not be helped. The location of the hotel is great - just over the road Vondel Park, and some good bars and restaurants. Leidsplein is a 5 mins walk away and there are many shops, restaurants and bars there to try. We had a special price for this hotel which was why we chose it, but will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Free upgrade... I think it was a downgrade!!!”
Reviews.Author: LeedsUK1
Reviews.Content: We only booked this hotel because it said on the website that it had been re-modernised, we stayed here 2 years ago and the room was terrible so this time we were hoping for better. We booked a superior room which was advertised as all brand new with plasma tv open plan bathroom new beds etc but when we checked in the receptionist said she had upgraded us to an executive room which was good until we got to the room to find it was an old style room that had not been modernised, i rang recpetion to ask for our original room and was told that they had already filled it, what between us checking in and going up 3 floors to the room they had let it out i dont think so. The hotel was still undergoing major works when we stayed we had not been informed of this and to get to our room we had to walk up a dust filled corridor with workmen everywhere. The room was dirty, the maid service was terrible one day we didnt leave the room till 11am an eventhough the maids were still doing our floor they did not attempt to clean our room, on the days they did clean all they did was make the bed and supply new towels, they never topped the coffee/tea up we had to ring reception for some more and it never turned up along with the non slip bath mat we rung them for twice which never turned up. They have no ice machines and charged 3 euros 50 for ice to be brought to the room i wouldnt of bothered if they had told me the charge before i rang up to find out where the ice machine was. And to top it all off upon checking out even though we had paid in full on arrival for the room they decided to put the price of the room up and wanted an extra 100 euros a night plus charges for pay tv which we had not had, it took nearly an hour to check out and get sorted i had paperwork to prove all the costs but they would not accept it at first. The location of the hotel is good but thats about it the service and staff attitude is extremely poor abd the quality of the hotel itself should be downgraded to 3 star. Would we stay here again.....NO DEFINATELY NOT.

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: JaneyRhos_on_Sea
Reviews.Content: It was 18 years since our last stay at The Park and we were definitely not disappointed with our recent vist. The hotel has just been renovated to the highest standard. The rooms are spacious and the bed has to be the most comfortable we have ever slept in abroad. The standard of cleanliness was excellent too.The fixtures and fittings are very good. From the moment we arrived the staff were so very helpful. There was a problem with the electricity in our room but within 10 minutes of reporting it the electrician had rectified the problem. Added to all this the location is brilliant. We look forward to a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, however...”
Reviews.Author: Tranimal
Reviews.Content: ...all in all above average experience with a few downsides. Firstly, the room we stayed in was really stuffy and we weren't able to open the windows and the air con added to the stuffiness. Secondly, we had a bit of trouble in getting a room that we had booked (admittedly through lastminute.com) with a double bed instead of two twin. The receptionist assumed that we, as a young couple, would be ok with separate beds without confirming this first when there was no preference stated on our booking form. She also seemed a bit annoyed when we tried to change this.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: BorrowedHeaven
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at The Park Hotel, the staff could not have been more helpful, friendly and approachable. The hotel itself is in a prime location for the canals, museums, and some great bars and restaurants. The decor was fantastic, and our room was very well presented. Very clean, very modern and very comfortable...the bed was the most comfortable I've ever slept in! We found that our basin did not have running water, and so contacted reception...the general manager came to deal with this problem within 5 minutes, it had simply been switched off from beneath the basin...a simple problem. Yet that evening we returned back to the room to find a letter of apology for the inconvenience....this was a very nice touch considering what little inconvenience it had actually been! I would highly recommend this hotel to anybody. My one gripe was that there was a slight sewage smell in our room, but we thought this was simply a smell in the air rather than a problem with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Class Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: Dermondo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on the weekend of the 10th of May my partner & I. Firstly the location regarding public transport is excellent via train & tram, once I stepped inside it didn't disapoint nice appearance & decor, we arrived approx. about 10.30am so we though we would have to wait a while to get our room but alas no & another bonus was our room was upgraded from a superior to an executive room with an excellent view across the canal. The staff were excellent a provided us with maps etc., on searching for our room we did notice there is some building work going on it did not make our stay any better or worse. Facilities in the room were good, quality was also good. All in all I would have no hesitation to stay again & would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good Position, but Undergoing Renovation”
Reviews.Author: LeaHJ
Reviews.Content: I have recently returned from a 2 day stay at the Park Hotel, Amsterdam. The hotel is situated near the museums of Rembrandt and Van Gogh. It is also adjacent to one of the many Canals, providing Lunch and Dinner Cruises which is very handy! The Hotel is a 5 minute walk from the main Rembrandt Museum and 10 minutes walk to the centre of the Amsterdam shopping district. It has many restaurants surrounding it, a sample of those are: Indian, Thai, Steak Houses, Chinese as well as fast food like MacDonalds and Hard Rock CafÃ©. The rooms are very compact and bijous â€“ providing a double bed, toilet, shower, dressing table and Flat Screen TV. All you could need really for a short stay. The only down side to the Hotel when we visited, was that there was quite a bit of refurbishment going on. The hotelâ€™s main Restaurant is closed and buffet breakfast is being held in one of the conference rooms. There is no on-site dining, other than snacks and room service. Apart from this, the hotel was just what we were looking for. I would recommend this hotel if you wish to be near the Museums and some nice restaurants and donâ€™t mind the â€œsmallerâ€� style room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Heavenly Beds”
Reviews.Author: Sorrentotraveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated in an older building, and the lobby and hallway areas seem to reflect this. Dated, but clean, no obvious problems. The rooms themselves are very modern and the beds are incredible, big, fluffy pillows that you sink into. After a week on a river cruise with beds as hard as wood, the beds at the Park Hotel were a real treat. Location is overlooking a canal, across from the Hard Rock Hotel. There is a beautiful park just across the street and off the main streets, a very nice neighborhood. Convenient to trains. Next time we go to Amsterdam, this is where we will be staying.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms & location”
Reviews.Author: WickedTime
Reviews.Content: The check in was extremely fast and friendly and we were even given a room upgrade which was a lovely surprise. There was some building work going on to the outside but other than a bit of dust there were no issues with this The room itself was immaculately clean and had a very contemporary and well thought out feel. The rain shower was lovely and the bed was extremely comfortable The location was great, with easy walking access to all the major parts of the city. Would definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Chapelizod
Reviews.Content: We have just spent a weeknd at the Park Hotel - and could not fault it. The renovation work is almost complete (very impressive), and it did not affect our stay in any way. The hotel staff were all very friendly and helpfull. We had booked a superior room but were upgraded to an excecutive room on arrival without asking and at no extra charge. The room was excellent, clean, quiet, comfortable and a good view from the 6th floor. The hotel has a left luggage facility, which is ideal if you have a late flight after checking out at midday. Easy to find, if you get the train from the airport to Zeud station and then tram 5 (8 stops from Zeud). Literally 100m along the tram track. It's only 20mins in a taxi, however the taxi will cost you at least 20euro more each way. We hope to return later in the year.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: theboyracer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights last weekend. We stayed in the new part of the hotel which has recently opened. To get to our rooms we had to walk through a building site to get to the lifts as work was still on-going and I had a feeling of dread - until I walked into my room. It was a lovely size, nice decor and a very very comfortable king size bed. Flat screen TV, fab bathroom - very clean and comfortable. Staff were very friendly - always seem to be in Amsterdam. Breakfast was very good but would not recommend unless your hungry as was quite expensive especially if like me you just have coffee, toast and a bit of fruit. My companion got his money worth though! All in all if you want a tasteful, comfortable and quiet hotel I would recommend the Park.

Reviews.Title: “THe people are so welcoming!”
Reviews.Author: TVGTexas
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Park Hotel this spring. From the moment we walked into the hotel the clerks and bell staff were excellent. They made us feel so welcome and comfortable. The amenities were perfect. We had a Jr. Suite. The room was clean and spacious. The room features a full size bathroom, studio sitting area and very comfortable king size bed. We had room service a few times and the food was excellent as was the delivery. We could not have found a better place to stay. I highly recommend this as a central location to the shops and the museums. The staff will assist you in finding anything you need.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable accommodations, great location”
Reviews.Author: Electra5789
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was courteous and friendly. Accommodated our every wish. The location is great...close to shopping and dining. A great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Quite good”
Reviews.Author: Bob_xTraveller
Reviews.Content: Excellent location but very limited parking and unless you can get something at the hotel it will cost you about Â£40 per day to park in the public one. (Attendants may be prepared to do a deal on cost!!!) We stayed there whilst it was under major refurbishment, but this didn't adversely affect out stay. Room was good with all amenities (except tea/coffee making). Breakfast was fine but b/fast room had no windows.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: jaguerrero
Reviews.Content: While the rooms are remodeled, and beautiful, the construction continues. Loud hammers and construction noise was heard throughout the day. Our check-in was very complicated and the front desk staff was, at times, very unfriendly. We actually had to call our credit card concierge for dining and shopping suggestions because the front desk staff seemed unapproachable, bothered, and short with their responses. An unwelcoming experience...but the rooms were nice.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: DEB2001
Reviews.Content: The Park Hotel was in a good location, convenient to all the activities. The room was very comfortable, modern and clean. The bar had a nice atmosphere and the drinks were very reasonably priced. All in all an excellent hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay... Tourist-Trap Pricing”
Reviews.Author: Schipholio
Reviews.Content: Great location and helpful staff that provided tram schedule and directions. Wonderful location right by Museumplein and swanky retailers... Leidseplein is just a short walk away. You'll pay for the location, especially if it's summertime, but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Not what others say in the good reviews”
Reviews.Author: Frequent_visits
Reviews.Content: 1. The toilet gets flooded when you use the shower. 2. If you book online, and even if you have paid you city tax online, they would still claim that you haven't paid. 3. The air conditioning is not working and the room gets too hot! Even after your told the staff, they do nothing about it. 4. No hair dryer available when you ask the reception after 10pm. 5. Also, coffee and tea were not refilled. 6. The some of the staff are rude also. 7. So far the worst 4 four stars hotel I have ever stayed with in Europe. Some 3 stars hotels are even better than Park Hotel. Among the 4/3 stars hotel I have stayed with are Amethyst Hotel in Prague, Apex International Hotel in Edinburgh, Birmingham City Centre Ramada Hotel, Suitehotel near Potsdamer Plats in Berlin, Trinity Capital Hotel in Dublin, Best Western Hotel Spring House in Rome, Laietana Palace in Barcelona and Grand Hotel in Copenhagen. These hotels outperform Park Hotel in many ways (especially the service).

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice”
Reviews.Author: Noctia
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed views of Park Hotel, we decided to book it straight away anyway as we hadn't much time left to do it. We went for a superior room and it was amazing. The view was very good, and our stay was just perfect. I can't really understand why breakfast is so expensive (â‚¬25), and even the rates in general are a bit pricey, but all was top quality - great comfy bed, excellent bathroom, very clean and very quiet, despite being localed on a very busy area (very central and walking distance from every site). There is a cruise canal, which I recommend highly at night, right opposite the hotel. The staff were very friendly and always very eager to help. I have nothing bad to report about the hotel, except perhaps the fact that it can be difficult to find one's way round, as there are lots of stairs and different levels that make it seem like a bit of a maze, but this is due to current renovation works. This didn't disturbed our stay in any way, because as I said before the room and the corridors were very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: LynEdmonton
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam, The Netherlands: the Park Hotel: Perfect location Date: January 2008 Reveiwer: a Canadian from Edmonton, Alberta, Canada The location was perfect, within walking distance of museums and restaurants and other top sight seeing destinations within Amsterdam. It was also on a major tram route that was easy to use. The hotel rooms were small but very efficient. Every bit of space was used effectively. They were very modern and very clean. Our experience with the staff was wonderful. The maitre d' made our breakfast experience very pleasurable. A great little hotel for a homebase at a great price!

Reviews.Title: “I Frigin Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: theAristacrats
Reviews.Content: The Park Hotel was Perfect for my wife and I in many ways. Perfect Location: Tons of stuff close by, Tons of trains, museums and ferries, "Coffeeshops" ( "Rookies" was a nice chill place close by) and eaterys just a hop skip and a jump from the hotel. Not to mention the Hard Rock and a Casino across the street. Perfect Room: We were on our honeymoon and were upgraded to a jr. suite when they found out we were newly weds. We wanted MAX privacy and we never heard a Peep. The Windows opened wide so you could "vent" the room well....... The view was Europe enough for us at that point. The Bed was Awesome. The Shower was Super Awesome..SO SO Nice...So MOD.....So Futuristic Euro MOD 3 Star....Pimpin Aint' Easy and you remember that... Perfect Price: If you have mad money to spend! lol...Expensive but worth every euro-penny.....Bling Bling (Remember, This city may be "the Bangkok of Europe". But we are'nt in Thailand any more TOTO) So Stoked!!! on The Park Hotel......We desperatly hope to stay there again... Adam & Jackie MidWest USA

Reviews.Title: “Park Hotel was Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: LMR88
Reviews.Content: My stay at the park was absoloutely brilliant. As we walked up to it I was slightly worried as there was a lot of building work going on around it, but when we entered the reception was lovely and the staff very helpful. Our luggage was transported to our room on a trolly by the porter and when we entered it was beautiful.The room was rather small but as there was only two of us the room was a good size, the decor was beautiful, the room was clean and all our needs were catered for. The only problem we had was that our shower leaked and we had to use a towel to stop the floor flooding, there was also a strange smell in the shower when we went to use it in the morning, but other than that our stay was wonderful. The location of the hotel is perfect, a 5 minute walk from the Leidseplein, (definately go to boomchiago, a comedy club on the leidseplein) surrounded by hundreds of places to eat, and there is a canal ride point straight across the street. Also only a 2 minute walk to the nearest mac bike outlet where you can rent bikes. Mac Bike were also very helpful and i would reccommend them.

Reviews.Title: “I will be back...”
Reviews.Author: MasZan
Reviews.Content: We just stayed there for lang weekend. I will absolutely recommend this hotel for everybody considering a vacation in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful Stay”
Reviews.Author: declan017
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Hotel, Amsterdam from 12th - 15th January 2008 and, even though the hotel was being remodernised, we found all the staff to be extremely pleasant and most helpful which made our stay all the better. A delightful few days spent in a lovely city. David & Pat Bishop - Stockport, Cheshire, UK

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Winter Break”
Reviews.Author: Markel_8
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have recently returned from The Park Hotel Amsterdam. It was a fab trip that we both really enjoyed. We stayed in a room which was not one of the newly renovated ones, that you see advertised on the website but we were both plesently surprised to see how nice it was. (Slightly worried after reading a couple of the others reviews before we went) The bed was huge and very comfy, the room was cleaned every day and it was an impressive size with lots of storage and a flat screen TV. We did not eat in the hotels restaurant but did order room service that was lovely and moderately priced. Alcohol was not expensive, compared to other bars outside the hotel. Although breakfast seemed very expensive at approx 25Euro, needless to say we didnâ€™t order it. Overall it was a fantastic trip in a great hotel, the staff were very friendly and I couldnâ€™t say a bad word about our stay at The Park Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Be careful”
Reviews.Author: kiwimango
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in Oct 07. While i was there, they were in the middle of renovation, therefore some rooms were renovated while others were not. When booking, I made sure to select a renovated room. Upon arrival, check in was fine... things started going wrong when the man who helped us with our bags took us to a crate elevator to get to our room.... already there, I was thinking that we made a bad decision with this hotel. To get to our renovated room, we had to go through the old hall (which was very old and ugly). When we got to our room, i was in shock. Imagine this... a bed, a night table on one side, a sink on the other side... a toilet and shower next to the sink, only being seperated by glass partitions that don't even reach the ceiling.... no walls. Not a very comfortable situation. I had gone with one of my friends and i was really not comfortable staying in this room with her, but i don't think i would be comfortable staying in that room with anyone at all. We immediately went back to the front desk to speak with the hotel manager. We explained to her exactly why we were unhappy and she kindly upgraded us to a suite that was a lot more spacious with a closed bathroom.... the best part is that we were able to take the regular elevator to that room. Other then that the hotel was fine... the location was excellent. we were able to walk everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not very impressed”
Reviews.Author: aypr22
Reviews.Content: I organised a trip to Amsterdam for a hen weekend and there were 10 of us ranging from mid 20's to my mum who was just hitting her 60th birthday. We were upgraded to this hotel shortly before our holiday was due and were happy as it was a higher star than we had originally booked. Unfortunately upon arrival the receptionist informed us that we had to put a deposit down of about 50 euros each - can't remember what this was for, something silly like the mini bar or something but even so it was extortionate so I flatly refused, as it would have been a total of about 500 euros and they wanted it from one credit/debit card !!!!!!! In the end they agreed to let us off but baring in mind we landed fairly late it wasn't really a warm welcome. We then went to our allocated rooms and there was a mix up with the smoking and no smoking rooms so we ended up moving rooms before we finally settled down for the night. The upshot of this was that half ended up on one floor and the other half on another floor. We were booked for bed and breakfast and the food was nice but the hotel had a rather stuffy feel about it, the staff seemed to look down their nose at you - not sure if it was because we were a hen party and 1 of the nights we did the hen thing with t shirts etc but we weren't offensive or loud as we knew we weren't in magaluf !!!!!! The hotel is in a good spot, short walk to bars and restaurants and a short tram ride if you want to see the sights associated with Amsterdam, brilliant street entertainers, red light district (which isn't for the faint hearted !!!) Overall we had a brilliant weekend when we were out of the hotel but probably wouldn't book to the park hotel again - oh and we had a view at the back of the hotel looking onto a disused warehouse or something - not pretty at all and lots of pigeons !

Reviews.Title: “Romantic”
Reviews.Author: kanata11
Reviews.Content: We did not expect it to be so private. We had all the hand service that we could ever ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced older hotel”
Reviews.Author: lllClifflll
Reviews.Content: At the time when I booked it was the only place open. Right across from the Hardrock cafe, at the ferry dock, the hotel has a reasonable location for both business and pleasure. Internet was expensive and the bar was not very nice. My room was a bit dark and there was a large window which opened onto the street below. Noise would be a problem on lower floors. I came to the hotel by a short tram ride from the central station. Hertz is just down the road and I collected a rental on my departure. Restaurants are all around the hotel and transport is no issue. My room was Smokey and a bit dingy. In need of a refresh. The bed was of an acceptable standard and the pillows were somewhat stiff. I did not dine in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “friendly and helpfull staff”
Reviews.Author: retiredStockholm
Reviews.Content: On arrival we found a friendly and helpfull staff, a nice and clean room with coffee and tea for the exhausted travellers who didn't want to go out immediately, an excellent restaurant in the house. Next morning we woke up in the very center of the town, near Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh museum, Leidse plein, PC Hooftstraat and Spiegelstraat, but before visiting all this we had a nice breakfast in the restaurant. It is a very good idea of Coop Forum, Sweden, to cooperate with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Bursledon
Reviews.Content: I would say that the big plus for this hotel is its location. It is close to the Museum Plein with the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh Museum, and boat trips around the city start just across the road. There are plenty of restaurants nearby including the Hard Rock Cafe just across the canal. The city centre is a short walk away along a pedestrianised street or you can take a tram. The hotel has been partly refurbished and the rooms we staying in were very modern but on the small side. The rooms didn't have a separate bathroom; instead there was a partition with the wash basin, toilet cubicle and shower cubicle. The staff were friendly and helpful, and the bar service was good. It's not the best hotel in Amsterdam but overall it's good value, and I'd probably go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: patchWales
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by very smart and friendly staff at reception. The room was very clean and the facilities spot on. We had a double bed in one of the new superior rooms with ensuite facilities. The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly throughout our 4 day stay. We dined twice in the restaurant and were very impressed with the food and service. The location of the hotel was perfect, walking distance of all of Amsterdams attractions which we took full advantage of. Although the hotel is close to a busy road and the famous Holland Casino, we were not disturbed at all during the night and slept well. We had breakfast included and there was plenty of choice and it saved rushing around for something to eat early in the day. We plan to go back to Amsterdam soon and would most definitely stay in the Park Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Old run down hotel. Not value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Charmainee
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the park hotel for four nights. Booked a "run of the house" type of room. The room i stayed in was not the modern lovely looking room featured at the website. My room was rather old and badly needs a revamp. The room definitely does not feel 4stars at all. Location was not as fanastic as i expected from the other reviews i read before my trip. To get to Leidseplein, its a good 10mins walk. Form Leidseplein if you want to go to the dam, its another 20mins walk. Tram stop (no 1,2,5) also does not stop very near the hotel. The tram stop is about 3blocks away. But if you are intending to buy luxury goods, the hotel is very near to the PC Hooftstraat. However, i have to compliment the friendly and polite staff who were always ready to help with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “It does not look like the web site!”
Reviews.Author: SusanMcLeanVa
Reviews.Content: The room was a nice size however very "tired". The walls were dirty and had gouges in them. The comforter, drapes and furniture were in need of replacement. The first room we got overlooked the backside of other buildings. We then moved to a room facing the canal which was a nice view. The bathroom was updated, clean and other than the tub that was difficult to get in and out of was fine. The breakfast was an average buffet - not worth the steep price. After one breakfast ,we went to pancake houses for a more reasonable and better breakfast. The bar and lounge had been updated and was very attractive. I was told the rooms were scheduled for renovation in December of 2007 - not a minute too soon. The lobby could use a little work as well. For the price and rating as a 4 star hotel it was definitely lacking. With renovation it may improve because of the location but our stay left something to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: marbella08
Reviews.Content: I was staying here on a business trip and booked it based on the website photos, which all show lovely renovated rooms. When I checked in I was given probably the one of the worst rooms in the hotel. A single bedded room in the un renovated part of the hotel. The bed was sagging in the middle and my bed cover had a cigarette burn. I could not change the rooms and was told I could not cancel them either. I eventually ...after lots of discussions.....got moved to the renovated part of the hotel but on a smoking floor so had to keep the window open to eliminate the smell and it was cold outside! Also the restaraunt is dark and dingy and the breakfast cost a whopping 22 euros each. The head waiter scolded one of the waitresses in full view of the customers. The staff on reception were not helpful and did not seem to realise the customer came first. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Badly designed!”
Reviews.Author: marionedin
Reviews.Content: The good points of this hotel are the staff (particularly Dennis and Kris in the bar) and the location. The bad points are the badly designed, newly renovated rooms which look great but are not useable or practical. The shower has a huge head, but floods the entire tiled area of the room (there is no bathroom) after 2 mins. The air conditioning didn't work making it cold all the time. The bed is like sleeping on a marshmallow and the duvet is too hot. All the lighting is downward and not powerful so you can't put your make up on properly. You need to ask for a hairdryer, but when you get one, there are no power sockets anywhere near a mirror. You can't switch the lights off from the bed, you need to get out again. It is noisy as the traffic is right outside the window. There is no plug in the basin to keep water in. There is only 1 bedside table, no clock visible during the night and no soap dish. These last 3 things may sound trivial but they caused damage to my new Cartier watch which I am very annoyed about and just emphasises why attention to detail is very important.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JanWestMidlands
Reviews.Content: This is a comfortable hotel with good amenities and friendly, responsive staff. We especially liked the bar for a quiet pre-dinner or after-shopping drink. The location is great, with easy access to main shopping areas, museums and the Vondelpark on the doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but the rest was pretty bad...”
Reviews.Author: TB_London
Reviews.Content: We spent our first anniversary in the Park Hotel in Amsterdam. The location is very good, right in the museum district with easy access to the centre by tram or river boat. But this is were it ends for us. The hotel is obviously under refurbishment with some rooms being ultra modern and others looking like they have not been touched for 20 years! The hotel pictures on this website are very misleading, so you have been warned! They are all from the refurbished part of the hotel and are all from rooms that are bigger then the 'average' superior room. We arrived Thursday evening, was given one of the old rooms (which was ok but very worn), however we were given a smoking room (had requested non smoking) and with people smoking joints next ddor out the window it was not ideal. We asked to change but were told they were full (which was ok), and they told us to ask again the next morning. The next day we were eventually given a new room (one of the refurbished ones) and they moved our suitcases over to the next room which was nice. The new room was nicely decorated but so small you could not swing a cat! There is no bathroom, only a white see through curtain seperates the bed from the sink. There are stained glassdoors to a seperate shower and toilet, but unless you like being in full view whilst going to the toilet this is not great. The water from the shower leaks out on all sides when using it so make sure you go to the toilet before you have a shower (unless you want wet feet!). On the second day our room was not cleaned until 16:30, even though we had left the room at 11:00 and putting the 'please make up my room' sign up. When we returned they were still cleaning all rooms in the hallway on two floors so we had to sit outside and wait. The next morning (on our checkout day) the maid entered our room at 08:30 to clean!! We were still asleep and were shocked when someone came in that early. We could hear them going down the hallway immediately after knocking on all the doors. So if you like your sleep, make sure you use the 'do not disturb sign'!They obviously need to communicate better and get their cleaning staff sorted out!! All in all, we were dissapointed after the stay, it was not worth the money and we were not impressed by their service either. We loved Amsterdam, but will definately not be returning to this hotel if we ever go back!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy at the end of the day”
Reviews.Author: UtahGodutch
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with my choice of the Park Hotel, especially after finding that the centrum of Amsterdam had more construction than it had in 2005. This location is close to so much,the museums, the park, Leidseplein and Albert Cuypt Market and it has easy access to the rest of the city, the trams and the canal boats are right there. I also felt more relaxed in this area than in the centrum of the city, good for a woman traveling alone. The staff was kind and fun, and the evenings i had having dinners and drinks at the hotel were like being home after the long days being a tourist

Reviews.Title: “Dark and shabby”
Reviews.Author: montjo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really not welcoming, except for the helpful staff. My room was dark, old and without character. It is well situated, though.

Reviews.Title: “Not a happy customer”
Reviews.Author: richardviner
Reviews.Content: The executive room we booked was simply like stepping into a MFI show room. poorly put together, bits coming off, bed board was well worn. Noisy next to the room. We duly complained and were upgraded to a suite. The suite was a little bigger, but I would have not been happy to have paid full price for the room. Glasses/tea cups were not cleaned out on a daily basis. When we complained the head housekeeper said that some guests prefer us not to clear. Ordered something of the night menu and only one item of two arrived. In summary, go there, complain, get upgraded,complain,get a few quid knocked off the bill and you will be a happy guest with value for money..

Reviews.Title: “Very poor response to a theft”
Reviews.Author: Travelbaggage
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel on a business trip. Was very pleased with the quality of the rooms - in the upgraded section. Stay was spoiled by the theft of my laptop. I stupidly left it behind when I checked out and went direct to a meeting. Three hours later I realised I had left it behind, phoned the hotel, fully expecting them to tell me they had it at reception. They handled the whole thing very badly. Didn't believe me when I said I had left it behind. Made a great show of bringing me back to the room to point out 'Look, no laptop'. Told me they'd take a step right back if I phoned the police. Subsequenly a senior manager phoned and apologised and explained that they can't outright accuse hotel staff..which I understand. But the whole experience was made so much worse by their initial handling of it. The impression given to me was almost like I was attempting some kind of scam. There's clearly a problem there. So I would never stay there again. The laptop was close to worthless, very old model, but I had years of personal stuff on it. I was foolish to leave it behind but I was extremely shocked that it wasn't handed into reception by one of the two staff who had been in my room after I checked out.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but real nice!”
Reviews.Author: SuViseu
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was a bit expensive. I bought a package from the hotel's website, that offered a bottle of wine, free entrances to the casino and to a diamond factory. When I was there I realized that it is easy to get free entrances to the casino and to the diamond factory! (If you take a cruise trip, you will get free entrances to the casino, for example). Apart from that, the hotel has a very nice location, you can catch a cruise right in front of the hotel, it is in front of the Hard Rock CafÃ© and a few minutes from the Leindsplein. Also nearby you can hire bikes at MacBikes- it is a real fun experience to see Amsterdam by bike! The breakfast was very good, it was included in the package. The room wasnÂ´t big, but it was very modern, I thought the bed and pillows were very confortable! I had a view to the canal, so it was very nice! It is a hotel located near the museums. And if you need to pick anything up from the supermarket there is also one nearby (a short walk), behind the Van Gogh museum.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. My favorite while in Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: jaypeaohh
Reviews.Content: I stayed in 3 hotels in 3 days while in Amsterdam from Sept. 3-5 and The Park Hotel was my favorite. I booked a Run-of-House room which means I had no idea where they'd put me. I was pleasently surprised to find my room was overlooking the canal and was one of the larger rooms I stayed in while in Amsterdam. I got a great deal on the hotel website, so I didn't pay full boat. About 89 Euro. Great location for seeing the museums. Friendly staff. Really cool bar attached. Overall I loved the place.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel from Hell . . .”
Reviews.Author: Susan41
Reviews.Content: We had booked a 'split-level suite' at an exorbitant, non-refundable rate. A steep staircase connected the upper and lower tiny rooms. There were no reading lights, a non-working TV, no door to the toilet, no carpets, etc. We complained and were switched to a smelly smaller room (same price). As we went to bed later that evening, we discovered that our feet were now wet from vomit next to the bed, vomit which had not been cleaned up by housekeeping. We were switched to a third (clean) room the next morning and given a 25% discount and free breakfast. The breakfast room was dreary and reminiscent of Soviet-era style service and food. To add insult to injury, when we came home we realized that we had been double-billed on our credit card. Our advice: stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Well situated but we felt unconfortable”
Reviews.Author: GuillemTM
Reviews.Content: The hotel is correct, has a very situation near the city center and in a zone full of restaurants and services for the tourists (bike-hiring, boat tours...). We didn't like at all the way the receptionists treated us. It seemed they were judging people by their look. They asked us for a deposit when they weren't asking other "better looking" customers for it. Why? If our room didn't even have a minibar! They didn't help much when we asked anything and seemed more interested in other people who should leave tips. However, the staff in the breakfast room were very nice and helpful. The hotel is also divided in two parts, the older one and a reformed part. But the older one seemed to be of high standing, and we felt unconfortable with the differences. The room was correct and there wasn't parking available (at least for us) and we had to park 2 streets far from there for 36 euro a day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Park Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kella76
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a two night stay at this hotel. We had one of the new refurbished executive double rooms on the 5th floor. While I was a little disappointed with the size of the room (quite small) and the view was to the back, the room itself was extremely clean and contemporary with a very comfortable king size bed. The bathroom was gorgeous with a rain shower (brill). The location was also excellent just five minutes to the Liedlesplain and right beside VondelPark. We didn't eat at the hotel as it was quite expensive relative to what was closeby. The staff were very efficient and couldn't have done enough for us. I would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Strange experience”
Reviews.Author: mbiz
Reviews.Content: The location in the very center is nice, but the hotel has been around for a long time and it shows. Finding ones room is not easy, since the place has sprawled out over time and with construction going on, getting the right room may not be easy. We - I travelled with a partner - both ended up in handicapped rooms, without being told, which had interesting plusses and minuses - the shower was big enough for an entire soccer team, with 2 giant shower heads, but little water pressure. Shaving was a problem, with the mirror at waist hight. The room smelled a bit (maybe a dead mouse?) and the bed was awful - very 'springy'. Service throughout was pretty rustic, if not just plain bad. There are much better choices in this area, although as said, the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cornishmother
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be wonderful! I couldn't say anything bad about this hotel, they were very accomodating and helpful! We had a slight problem with our internet connection in the room and they practically bent over backwards trying to make it up to us - even though we protested it wasn't neccesary!
