Lovely, lovely hotel! Beautiful views, easy to find, the staff were so friendly, very clean room and huge bed!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay at the Park”
Reviews.Author: vegasdragon
Reviews.Content: Great hotel took shuttle to and from hotel and airport it was handled well on both ends. Executive room, double shower with large rain fall shower heads. Very nice! Excellent bed newly remodeled room with artwork, safe, mini bar. Room looked like pictures on Website. Had to walk up one flight of stairs but it was worth it pretty view even though not toward Leidseplein. Excellent location bought tram tickets and Van Gough tickets from desk clerk very convenient. Breakfast buffet was of good to great quality although expensive. Nice staff, who are very helpful. Would definitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “good location, we stayed in an executive room on the 6th floor, ( great veiws )”
Reviews.Author: travelingpenguin8156
Reviews.Content: I booked the park hotel for my husbands 50th birthday, the pictures on the web looked great, the location was good, we stayed on the 6th floor in an executive room !! there was nothing executive about it, the king size bed was comfy, but the rest of the room ( it was very clean ) was in great need of an update, the bathroom (lovely thick white towels ) would have been excellent if the mildew had been cleaned from the tiles and a fresh shower curtain had been hung, we had a great weekend all the same,

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely cracking hotel”
Reviews.Author: MichaelGreen
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a couple of nights in mid August, arrived expecting a standard double room as booked on line and were provided without asking a free upgrade with a suite on the third floor overlooking the canal, Irish Bar and Hard Rock cafe - this was a recently refurbished room, it would be difficult to imagine a nicer room with a better view , absolutely outstanding. Superb location - within walking distance of Vondel Park, the Museums, Leidseplein, and try the PC Hoofstraat about 100 away for the designer shops. The large room was superb - huge, comfortable queen bed with flat screen TV at your feet. Good mini bar, although I am always a little scared to sample the treats so could not comment on the cost. A superb bathroom of black ganite with fantastic shower, bath, excellent array of soaps, shampoo etc. The room was very stylish, with pretty fresh flowers. Would I recommend - certainly

Reviews.Title: “excellent room”
Reviews.Author: monkfishmatt
Reviews.Content: we stayed in a new refurbished superior room on the 5th floor which was excellent . Very quiet,very clean nice and modern. We checked in and got our room key and went up to our room, only to open the door and find a couple asleep in bed. !!!!!!! Not what I wanted. so back downstairs we go. receptionist could not believe it and it turns out she had sent us to the wrong room oooops.( Glad it was not me in bed). On returning to the room the next evening a letter had been slipped under our door apologizing for the wrong room incident from the duty manager, which was nice. After walking around amsterdam we realised that thisHotel is in an excellent location and were very glad that we had picked it. Only a thirty minute walk to dam square and five minutes from liedseplein (busy nightlife and loads of places to eat). We would definetely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: ttreacle
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 3 nights in a superior room and it was lovely. Room was clean and modern. The open modern bathroom idea was ok, noone can see you in the shower or toilet as the doors are frosted black and a curtain can be pulled across. It has a flat screen TV and mood lighting, which was very funky. You also get plenty of cupboard space and the bed is very comfortable. Some floors in this hotel were still be renovated but this never interfered with our stay. Our room never had a hairdryer but if you asked at reception they provided you with one. We were first sent to a room that had people sleeping in it so we had to get another sorted, this was done straight away and later in our stay we got a letter apologising for this error which I thought was a nice touch. We never ate breakfast in there, as it was little pricey at 23.50 euros each for a continental breakfast. You only had to walk down the road to find somewhere. We are glad we stayed in the museum quarter as some of the other areas where definitely not as nice. Hard rock cafÃ© was just across the road from us, which was handy, and Vondel Park was adjacent to the hotel. We walked everywhere we went but beware of the trams and the bikes, they are everywhere. It took us only 20 minutes to walk to the Anne frank house. The Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh museum was just around the corner, about 5 minutes walking distance. Dam square took us bout 30 minutes and the Heinkinen Brewery was about a 15-minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Everything”
Reviews.Author: Harwich6
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel from a website agency, because we liked a review that we read about it, which called it their 'favourite hotel in Amsterdam'. Well, as it's the only hotel we have stayed at in Amsterdam, we cannot compare it, but can only say that we thanked our lucky stars that we chose to go there. The situation was PERFECT. A few minutes from trams going to everywhere, a few minutes walk to the museums and the famous park, overlooking a canal, where the passenger boats stopped and a few minutes walk to restaurants and the shopping centre. The hotel itself was spacious and comfortable and offered a 'banquet' for breakfast every morning. The staff were very friendly, kind and most helpful about anything that we asked for or about.. We recommend this hotel most strongly, for anyone who wants a happy comfortable visit to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: Chester24
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights with my boyfriend, Had an unrefurbished room on the top floor, (seventh), amazing view, definately the best thing about the hotel,nice bar and excellent location for bars, restaurants and coffee shops, most staff friendly and helpful. Would definately recommend.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: sarahSouthOrange
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with the spacious of the room. The bed was very large and very comfortable. I also loved the modern shower. I was very surprised of the value of this hotel. I am planning on staying there again in Oct and would recommend it all

Reviews.Title: “Avoid it”
Reviews.Author: prosecut
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night. It was terrible, i never thought that 4star could provide such service. The room was too small and tiny, it was very very cold. Only one good thing that we didnt spend much time in the room. The room price was 70 euro per night, but when we were leaving they blocked at my credit card 200 euro plus that sum i payed cash. The staff was unfriendly, so we never come back to this hotel. I think its star rating must be as a 2* hotel

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay at The Park”
Reviews.Author: JMF70
Reviews.Content: We booked a 'Run of the House' Double room via reserveahotelonline.com and managed to get a very good deal including breakfast. On arrival, we were informed that they had a shortage of twin rooms (which we had been allocated) and were offered a newly refurbished Superior Room instead, which was very nice. The only downside was that the room wasn't ready and, despite being told at 12 noon that it would be ready by 3pm, it was in fact not available till 4.30pm, which was a little irritating as we had wanted to change before heading off to explore Amsterdam. However, the hotel provided some free drinks in the bar by way of compensation. The Park provides a good location from which to explore the city, convenient for the trams, canal bus etc and is within easy walking distance (5 mins) of many of the main museums and galleries. Overall, a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Average and overpised.”
Reviews.Author: Trip_Datum
Reviews.Content: Very average hotel in a good location. I didn't stay in a renovated room and the room quality was vary basic. The breakfast was ok but not something special. The loby bar is a positive point for the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “City Gem”
Reviews.Author: APEM
Reviews.Content: After reading other comments at the travel agents we decided to book the Park Hotel in Amsterdam. Not having stayed in Amsterdam before we did not know what standard to expect. All I can say is the Park Hotel was excellent with friendly staff, spotless accomodation and beautiful food. The staff were happy to book tickets for us for any excursions we wanted and provided us with any directions when asked in a extremely helpful manner. I would recommend the Park Hotel to anyone. Excellent overall and in a great location. We hope to return ourselves next spring. A & E M

Reviews.Title: “Not that impressed”
Reviews.Author: SqueezeBristol
Reviews.Content: After having read through various reviews I decided that The Park Hotel looked a fairly decent option for the two nights that I was to be in Amsterdam. Having booked through Expedia, when a fourth member was to join our party I phoned them to upgrade one of the rooms from a single to a double. They told me there would be a charge of Â£111.00 to which I was shocked and phoned the Hotel directly who said that there would be no problem sorting out an upgrade once we arrive. When we arrived at the Hotel ( there are now 4 adults in our group ) I mentioned that I had spoken earlier to someone about the upgrade which they confirmed. Two of our party were going to share a room ( the double ) whilst myself and another colleague decided that we would spend a little extra and upgrade to a Superior room. This however seemed a little to much for the receptionist to cope with and after calling her manager for help they both struggled with the computer screen in front of them and finally turned round and said that we would all be upgraded to a double room! Not what we requested. ( and we were to be charged...no free upgrade here, not that we were looking for it ) Rather than confuse them any more I just agreed and said that I would pay the upgrade fee for all the rooms on departing. As most people feel after arriving by plane and then travelling by Taxi all you want to do is retire to the room, drop off the bags and venture out! Well the first night was hell, the double room that I had been given ( no. 153 ) was the noisiest Hotel room that I have ever stayed in. The heating pipes clattered and banged all night, there was one thick pipe that must have been supplying the whole hotel through my room, there was no heating control for the room and with the window open the noise was a little too much to sleep. In addition to this I think I was located next to the service elevator as ever few minutes there was a loud electrical hum that vibrated through the pillow. Well after no sleep and seeing that the clock said 6:30am I decided to have another go at upgrading to a Superior room. Got dressed and ventured downstairs, this time there was a different face at the reception and this face was able to give me what I had originally asked for. zzz... Better room, newly decorated and had a minibar ( ah, cold water! ) after getting up and out for a lovely walk around the Leidseplein Square area I started to itch....yes I had been bitten three times on the left shoulder and upper arm by flees. I cant say whether it was room 153 where I had initially been put or the new one ( 440 ) but it did annoy me as for the rest of the day all I was doing was itching. When it came to checking out we were all charged for the upgrades and myself I was charged twice also charged â‚¬44 for a breakfast I hadn't had and â‚¬16.50 for three bottles of water and a tube of Pringles. There was no deductions offered from the bill not that I was asking and I was just glad to get out of the place to be honest, I'm sure if it had been a different trip on a different day in a different room things would have been completely normal...

Reviews.Title: “great value, great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: nyjazzfan
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Amsterdam many times and this is now my new favorite. The price via [--] was excellent. Staff was particularly friendly and helpful. They even happily directed me to a laundromat when I said I didn't want to pay hotel laundry prices! Location excellent: a quick walk to Leidse Square, Vondel Park and the Museum area. It's not too near the station or red light district or Dam Square- but frankly that's a plus. That area is overcrowded and overrun with drunks and thugs. Ask for a high room with canal view (5th or 6th floor) nice view of canal, HardRock Cafe, neon signs, rooftops- including the art deco American Hotel tower and beautiful sunsets (albeit at 10pm in summer) Breakfast is overpriced- skip it if it's not included, and go across the canal to the Irish pub- good omlettes.

Reviews.Title: “Well Recommended - Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: bazo911
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Park Hotel, Amsterdam for 2 nights and cannot fault either the hotel or the staff in the slightest. Slightly outside the busy centre of Amsterdam but for us the location was superb being close to the Museumplein and also the canal boat terminus so it was extremely easy to get about. Facilities were well up to standard, the rooms and public areas were very clean, the breakfast choice and food quality were excellent and every member of staff was extremely friendly and helpful - nothing was too much trouble. This is one hotel I would recommend without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, Clean, & Comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: godsgirl86
Reviews.Content: The Park Hotel is beautiful and elegant, yet clean and cozy. The staff were always pleasant and helpful. My family would definitely stay there again and highly recommend to others. You will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Generally good (but not in a Junior Suite)”
Reviews.Author: GR_Edinburgh
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Park a number of times and it has improved greatly over the years and is certainly one of my favourite mid-budget hotels in the city. Its location near the Leidseplein makes it a great location for the museums and pubs, jazz bars and restaurants (so you can walk back to the hotel at night) and close to the tram network for quick and cheap journeys to the rest of the city. The hotel is generally good, everything works well and it is clean and well maintained. BUT... due to having to make a late booking I ordered a â€˜Junior Suiteâ€™ which was disappointing. The room was large but due to having one tiny window in the corner it was dark and the layout made it look half built. The bathroom was a good size but VERY dark (making shaving a very difficult matter). There were three small chairs where there should have been a settee, a good bed but in a really strange place, a lack of sockets meaning you have to put the kettle on a little bed-side shelf, a TV which you have to turn around without knocking over and an overall lack of space. In fact they have somehow managed to take a decent size room and made it feel very cramped. The problem is that when the hotel was being renovated they expanded into other buildings. This room was not designed, it just happened to be the best they could do with the available space and they made a very bad job of it. Rather than classing it as a double (which would have been fine) they tried to do some clever marketing and make out this was a superior room. I feel a little ripped-off.

Reviews.Title: “overall, a very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: duka24
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Park Hotel was quite enjoyable. Our baggage was unfortunately lost by the airline, but the hotel staff was so accommodating and eager to help us in any way. The staff at this hotel was so incredibly friendly and helpful. I went to the desk to purchase some internet time, and they gave it to me free of charge "for our trouble" (and it wasn't even their fault!). The hotel has a fabulous large breakfast buffet...not simply the traditional continental style. The lounge is very cozy and modern with a simple but tasty menu, and the restaurant has fabulous gourmet food. The hotel couldn't be in a better location...right on the canal, a 5 minute walk from streets and streets of amazing restaurants. On one side of the street is Vondel Park, on the other side the Hard Rock Cafe. You are so close to all of the famous museums, great shopping, and restaurants. Our room was just okay (kind of like a run-down Sheraton), but I understand the hotel is undergoing rennovations. Although a bit older, the room was very clean and the bathroom was newer. We would definitely be willing to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: coldyork
Reviews.Content: I received a letter asking for a read and write reviews on the above hotel. I always stay at the Hotel when in Amsterdam. It is located in the center of town and easy to get around to see different things. It has excellent meals and a generious breakfast. I recommend it to all my friend (both of them). Adam

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: Sitara1
Reviews.Content: This was a fab hotel in a great location. Staff were very friendly and helpful on the whole. The rooms were clean and comfortable. We were in the heart of great places to eat and drink. If you like clubbing forget Jimmy Woo's- door staff had the biggest attitude ever - head straight to La Rumba a few min away. The music is great and the atmosphere v chilled. Best thing is we stayed til 5am and strolled over to our hotel in a matter of mins. The Hard Rock Cafe near the hotel is nice but watch out for the mice! The tram to Centraal Stn and the like is minutes away too. A great weekend and a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Unusual Room Design”
Reviews.Author: iph_ireland
Reviews.Content: The hotel is going through renovation but I stayed in one of their new "open plan" rooms. What this means is that the toilet and shower are in the same room as the bed, separated by a curtin. This was one of the smallest rooms I've ever stayed in but it was clean and modern, with an LCD TV and had broadband available. The bed was essentially a fold-out sofa with a piece of foam on top. It was reasonably comfortable but not to my taste. One other downside was that there was no iron in the room but an ironing room was available. This however was in a different part of the hotel and you had to get a key from reception to use it. This room was also not particularly clean. On the positive side, the staff were very friendly and helpful. I would stay here again at a push but would not be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite up to scratch”
Reviews.Author: HamsterUK
Reviews.Content: I booked a triple room at the Park Hotel in Amsterdam, for myself, my husband and our 7-year-old son. On arrival we were shown a smallish double/twin room with an extra put-you-up squeezed in. There was no alternative room to be had, so furniture was removed to enable us to move around the room, and we were given free drinks. Some of the staff were delightful, very friendly (in particular the maitre d' in the restaurant. Others, however, were unhelpful (bar staff very snappy, even when not busy) and on one morning all of our breakfast things were cleared away after we had had some cereal, while we were at the buffet choosing eggs & bacon - cutlery, half-drunk juice, full coffee pots - the lot, even though we clearly hadn't finished eating! Two days into our 4-day stay, we returned to our room after breakfast to find that Housekeeping were removing one of our beds 'to make the twin beds the same size'! We hadn't requested this, and were rather put out to find three people moving all of our things in order to get the bed out. Over all the hotel appears tired, ceiling tiles are stained and broken, the room was very dusty and the bath seal was black with mould. We had a great stay - lovely weather in Amsterdam and enjoyed ourselves, but we would not recommend this hotel... a 3-star, definitely not a 4-star place.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: obriensinc
Reviews.Content: Overall, a pleasant experience. The hotel is in a great location, and the personnel was very helpful. We did have a bit of a problem as an American learning the phone system, though. The restaurant within was excellent, and again, in a very good location to shopping, eating, etc. I would definitely stay there again. Ray O'Brien

Reviews.Title: “An excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MagicCarpetLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at the Park Hotel and found it to be really good. The staff were friendly, efficient, knowledgeable and helpful. The room was generally clean and comfortable. We asked for extra toiletries which they swiftly provided without fuss. We were very pleased with the location (next to Vondelpark), away from the touristy part but within walking distance of key attractions. It is also serviced by a number of tram routes. Our room was on the first floor (non-smoking) facing the street but we didn't really hear the traffic. We didn't eat at the hotel restaurant ourselves but met people who had and they very much recommended it, commenting particularly upon the friendly staff. I would only have two small points of quibble. The first was the slight whiff of cigarette smoke that we detected when settling down for the night. However, it was very slight and given some of the harsher smells coming from the Smartshops of Amsterdam, we can hardly complain! The second would be that the tea cups in our room were stained on the outside and had not been given a good wash. We could have asked for replacement cups but didn't really need them so didn't ask. All in all, a really good hotel that I would definitely stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Perrone
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights - superior suite, standard size room, fantastic bed, amazing shower (couldn't figure how to work mood lightening). Location is very good near a lot of restaurants, shops, museum and park. Paid 215 euro approx per night - Amsterdam is expensive found it difficult to get a better deal on websites for this kind of standard hotel. Also found it very easy to arrive from airport to hotel - probably much quicker than taxi/shuttle bus. Check hotel website for direction.

Reviews.Title: “Got Euros Read On”
Reviews.Author: ynot
Reviews.Content: In planning a 5 day trip to Amsterdam, our main hotel could only accomdate us for 4 nights, so out of last minute planning we could find a room at the Park Hotel. Well got a nice room: very modern, sleek, and comfortable. And then the troubles began: 1). Temperature: the room became very cold and there was no way to turn up the heat. So, an hour later, the staff provided us with a space heater that warmed the room. 2). Leaky shower: the shower had a glass partition from the toilet that let water leak onto the floor. We had to use 5-6 towels to mop up the mess. 3). Sewer Stench: for some reason, we notice a foul stench in the bathroom that began in the morning. Did not dare determine if it was coming from the toilet or shower. In summary, this was not what we expected for the $300 price.

Reviews.Title: “I agree with other reviews but I thought it to be rather "Pricey"”
Reviews.Author: LarryN1
Reviews.Content: I agree with other reviews that the Staff and service was quite accommodating, and the location really is second to none for an Amsterdam visit. And yes they are in the process of renovating, however my room was really quite "Threadbare and worn" with a view of the back alley...all for $275.00 per night for 2 nights.... Not quite value for money, it is not so much the amount but what you receive in return...And one would expect more than a stiff single bed, one pillow and 2 towelsâ€¦ But then location, location, location!!

Reviews.Title: “Well Located and Priced”
Reviews.Author: Marais1969
Reviews.Content: At the outset, please note that I stayed in a "basic" room. Please keep that in mind when evaluating my description of my guest room. The staff at this hotel was friendly, which always sets a good initial tone. It is located close to Vondelpark, the Rijkmuseum and the Van Gogh museum. For some reason, I was surprised to smell pot walking to my guest room but, hey, its Amsterdam. The ominous warning on my door to double lock and check staff credentials through the peep-hole made me a little nervous. However, I encountered no trouble while at the hotel. My room was small. Not the smallest of European rooms, but pretty close. It was fitted with a single bed that was pretty comfortable. The bathroom was adequate; not luxurious but clean. The room had a safe and, all in all, met all basic needs. If you are looking for a cheap and clean place to stay, a basic room at the Park will fit the bill. You will not be spending too much time in it anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Park Hotel, a good experience”
Reviews.Author: RetiredMaidstone
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was well serviced, the breakfast excellent and the staff all friendly and willing to help. I would recommend the hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: ihearthomer
Reviews.Content: the accomodations themselves were not fabulous, or even great, but i gave the hotel an above average because of the location. housekeeping is horrible! they would leave our dirty glasses, and not give us new ones. our sheets were not changed until we specifically asked and then they were dirty (we stayed 5 days). the hotel is quite shabby and dated in it's appearance. the shower has a curtain that flies onto you as you shower (great pressure though). when we first arrived it was very warm as the sun came directly into the room, but there was no air conditioning to cool it off. once the sun went down, and we kept the shades drawn while out of the room, it stayed cool. but...it is right near the museums, parks, a canal, and leidseplein. the location really is perfect. we walked to heineken, rijks, van gogh, vondel park and shopping. the staff was nice and sent letters after each call to them. they did arrange for us to go to keukenhof gardens with a local tour bus. i would stay here again for the location, but i wish they would consider updating the bedding, curtains, funriture, and shower curtain.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: RobManCorbin
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay! Extremely helpful and professional Hotel Staff, and the executive room overlooking the Canal was very beautiful and spacious. Very clean bathroom with great rice milk shampoo. Very close walk to all major museums and restaurants. I highly recommend the Arans Irish Pub conveniently situated across the street, for their delicious bar-b-cue ribs, and the Pancake House for the tasty Canadian ham pancake for breakfast. If you love cats, a visit to the Kat Kabinet Museum is a once in a lifetime experience, with six resident cats!

Reviews.Title: “Great location at the Park Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrsgreedy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well appointed and just a short tram ride from the centre of Amsterdam. We stayed for 2 nights in a superior room , which was very comfortable. Our room overlooked the canal. The staff were very friendly and helpful and spoke many languages. Apart from a slight problem booking the airport transfer because the receptionist was new, they were usually very efficient. The hotel is situated near the Van Gogh museum and the Heineken experience. It is next to Vondelpark( which was closed at the time of our visit). The only meal we had was breakfast and it was excellent; catering for most tastes. I cannot comment as to value for money because I won this short break in a competition, so for us it was excellent value!

Reviews.Title: “very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: AriNic
Reviews.Content: We took our canadian friends to Amsterdam for a short 2 days stay. Frankly, I was a bit worried given the previous reviews, but we got an unbeatable rate on internet, breakfast included and we decided to try it, since the location is great. Problem at check-in : no parking was available but we were directed to a nearby public park. Expensive but secured. Clean rooms, fair size with a nice view on the canal. A bit noisy since there was no double glazed windows. Nice and clean bathroom. Rich breakfast. Overall, we had a very nice stay. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Going Dutch.”
Reviews.Author: polybius
Reviews.Content: This is a well managed and stylish hotel very close to the three cultural landmarks of the Van Goch Museum, Rijksmuseum and the world famous Concertgebouw. Canal tours start just over the road and there are plenty of restaurants and bars nearby. We were particularly impressed by the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff, not only as to the proactive provision of "what's on" information but providing and telephoning to reserve tickets etc. Outside France we tend to be dismissive of hotel food and look for the delightful little restaurant nearby. But fortunately on ourlast night we dined in the hotel and had a reasonably priced and exquisite meal served by friendly and humorous staff. I assumed the chef was French but was told he was a Dutchman -another example of this nation's astounding talents. Around the corner in the Concert Hall direction is a street of luxury shops, to be enjoyed or avoided according to your perspective. The main centre is about a half hour walk away though for the less active there is a tram route nearby- I seem to remember it was no 5- but don't worry, the staff will advise and sort things out for you. We very much enjoyed our stay at the hub of this most vibrant city.

Reviews.Title: “No Faults, but average in most cases”
Reviews.Author: DawsonUK
Reviews.Content: On arriving at the hotel, to which the directions provided by Hotels R us were exact, we were immediately upgraded to an executive room. This was a pleasant speedy check in and the foyer was clean and bright, although maybe a litle lacking in ambience. The first room we checked into had 2 single beds, not an ideal start to the romantic weekend break. The hotel quickly sent up a Bell Boy with a key to a suitable room. The rooms were fairly modern although a little tired in places. Our rate included breakfast which was a nice touch, especially for Amsterdam, where it is not the norm. The location of the hotel is about 300 yards from the Leidsplein, which is full of over priced bars and restaurants. I find 26 Euros for 2 large vodkas a bit on the steep side (no wonder they have legalised "Whacky Baccy"). Would I stay at the Park again, probably yes, if it was a competitve deal. Would I visit Amsterdam again, probably not. It was a nice break, but not overly memorable, except on the costs, which for an Aberdonian, were hard to stomach. BTW....all the rooms are executive....but I did feel special, if only for a few minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Our Amsterdam mini break 14/03/07”
Reviews.Author: joemotorbike
Reviews.Content: The Park Hotel Amsterdam is an excellent place to stay only 10 minutes from central station by tram. The building is clean rooms are spacious with unsuite ,Televison, phone also tea and coffee making facilites. It is situated along the cannal with tour boats directly facing the hotel. You can travel to the city center by canal or tram. The hotel staff are excellent , it's freindly quiet and the staff will help in any way so your stay will be an enjoyable one. I would highly recommend this hotel and I will deffinetly stay at this hotel again. The location is right for walking to the town centre 15-20 minutes away. We have stayed in many hotels throughout europe but this hotel is up there with the best of them. Joe and Eileen Belfast, Northern Ireland.

Reviews.Title: “warm,welcoming & great location”
Reviews.Author: kpkNottmUk
Reviews.Content: I booked the long weekend via a shortbreak website and had no contact with the hotel until our arrival,but our check-in was no problem and welcoming.It was snowing outside and very cold but the hotel and room were always beautifully warm.Our room,which faced the canal and an inner ring road,was clean comfortable and well appointed.There was no problem with traffic noise,though after a full day walking the stunning city we were always ready for bed.Breakfast was a buffet with vast choice of both hot and cold food. Situated in the museum district the whole of the city is within walking distence and the particually lively area around the holland casino is great in the evening. We never used the hotel restaurant due to the huge choice in the city. Things we enjoyed -The atmospheric bars and restaurants,The Boom Chicargo Comedy Club(all in English),Anne Franks House,The canal boat ride and don't miss the wild Ring Necked parakeets in the park adjacent to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, friendly all round”
Reviews.Author: McCloskeyIrish
Reviews.Content: We loved our 3 days away in amsterdam. My boyfriend (33) and I (26) arrived at the hotel at 10am where they were extremely helpful and allowed us into our room 4hours early. This was great after such an early start. However we found ourselfs in a lovely, clean newly furnished bathroom TWIN ROOM!! A romantic break in separate beds was not what we had planned. We went down to reception to discuss this but they explained we only ask but they can not guarantee??!! I will be complaining to our travel company. They did however send a member of housekeeping up to our room to place the beds together and have double sheets placed on the bed. The breakfast was lovely!!! Complete choice, you couldn't ask for anything more. Cereal, cooked breakfast (eggs cooked to your liking, fried, boiled, poached), fresh fruit, croissants, bread and jam, tea coffee - all varieties. The waiting staff couldn't be more helpful. Location was fantastic. We walked everywhere. Around the cornor from Leider Square which is busy, loads of different restaurants, bars, coffee shops etc. We walked to the dam square, red light district which were all easily accessible, van gogh museums. The canal boat trip was beautiful just like to city its self. From the airport it only costs Â£1.50 for the 20mins journey by intercity double decker train, fantastic!! We will definitely go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Emsy3
Reviews.Content: Me and 7 friends stayed at this hotel over New Year. I had some reservations about the hotel but was pleasantly surprised. The hotel is in an excellent location for exploring Amsterdam. The tram line goes right outside but most of the sights are within walking distance. We stayed in 4 of the hotels standard rooms, although they could do with some modernisation they were clean and comfortable if not a little small. The hotel has a nice bar for pre dinner drinks and i would recommend the Irish Bar over the road for breakfast! All in all a great city to visit especially for New Year

Reviews.Title: “excellent service”
Reviews.Author: annb1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Hotel over the new Year . We had mixed reservations as we had read different reviews on this website. We were very pleasantly surprised. The room was excelent and very clean. We also felt that the staff throughout the hotel were more than helpful. We asked for additional pillows and they appeared like magic. Also on New Years evening we popped into the hotel bar for a quick drink and was then offered complimentary champagne and canapes.I have stayed at the Renaissance and the Radisson in Amsterdam and the Park Hotel was far superior.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: Mystery_Klient
Reviews.Content: Apart from the general quality of the hotel, responsiveness of management has been excellent: after the first night I complained about the noise, and I was immediately upgraded to a suite on the last floor, with apologies. It is rare to find a hotel that really cares about customers. You really feel supported in this hotel: they call for your taxi; they inform you of the status of your bill; in general, there's a good feeling about the place.

Reviews.Title: “New rooms are great for late 20's / early 30's couples”
Reviews.Author: david&Lisa
Reviews.Content: I decided to take my girlffriend away for a short break, and was pleasantly suprised by the efficency, polietness and general cleanliness of the hotel - after reading some other reviews I was expecting the worse. We were given one of the new rooms to try out - and I must say it was very stylishly laid out with a modern walk in bathroom (although privacy in the toilet was debatable between those sharing the room - but as it was my girlfriend it was fine), and comfy double bed. The noise of the trams outside can be heard early in the morning, but it wasnt bad enough to ruin our lay ins at all. also the plasma screen was nice with a good choice of channels to view (watch out if your taking kids as some of the channels show free uncensored harcore porn 24/7). The location is superb - and from Amsterdam central station its about 17 euros in a cab, but the hotel is right by the best of three squares with loads to see and do - the canel trip is directly opposite. Overall I really cannot fault this hotel from my short stay and would recommend anyone looking to treat that someone special to something a bit classier than a night in a travel lodge to definetly give this hotel and Amsterdam (its alot more than pot heads and porn) a go.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Gallery”
Reviews.Author: jerry.gomez
Reviews.Content: I spent some time with my family at the park hotel. The hotel is beautiful and the service is very good. The location is perfect to discover Amsterdam. The breakfast is continental and very tasty. My little daughter was playing with the staff the whole day. They really took the time to care about children. Great. The rooms are very elegant. The charming atmosphere of the historic building makes a stay very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Always excellent”
Reviews.Author: Janetmaureen
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here numerous times over the past ten years, and it is always excellent. The staff personnel are friendly, and the location couldn't be better. The classic and executive rooms are great, and the included breakfast buffet is always good with a nice variety of food. It couldn't be a better location as it is between the Rijkmuseum and the Van Gogh and only a few minutes' walk from the heart of the city, tourist attractions, cafes and restaurants, and shopping. We look forward to returning in January.

Reviews.Title: “Fascinating hotel”
Reviews.Author: Derren_Joseph
Reviews.Content: We saw all the negative reviews but we were staying there for a conference so had no choice. The key points are as follows - - Pros - Fantastic service from the front desk, restaurant staff, the doorman and even the cleaners. Everyone amazingly friendly and willing to help Restaurant was great. Breakfast (included in rate) was extremely generous. We had a problem with our tv, and the speed of service from the front desk and engineer was commendable The bathrooms seemed recently refurbished (over last couple years) so were quite comfortable. Location was unbeatable. Close to up-market shops, park, trams, cool restaurants (especially the Indonesian one at street level) and night-life. - Cons - All rooms were 'tired'. From the lobby, to the restaurant, bar and actual bedroom. Carpets ripped and stained. Furniture very shabby. There is no way this could be considered a 4 star on this planet. And this was after we were upgraded (another trick?) to their Executive suite/floor. Weak back office systems. Like many other reviewers, we had our reservation confused. While we were (trying to?) check in, next to us, a US hip-hop group (Dilated Peoples?) was struggling to get their reservation sorted. Even the final bill had a couple errors plus a surprise tax. Look over your paperwork carefully. --- Overall, this was a decent hotel in a fantastic location. The pros definitely outweigh the cons. These guys are trying hard. But the hotel owners are obviously reluctant to invest in some refurbishment. Hopefully if they understand the impact that poor reviews have on their bottom-line, commonsense will prevail.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful”
Reviews.Author: richfitz
Reviews.Content: This is probably the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. It was drab, dreary and depressing. The bedroom was a disgrace. It looked as if it had been furnished from a clearance sale, right down to the old wooden wardrobe with a massive total of six hangers for two people. Even the pot plant had lost the will to live. The bathroom fittings were old and did not match, and the bath was marked with cigarette stains. Lovely! The room was accessed by what appeared to be an old service elevator which, when it was working, went as high as the fourth floor. We were on the fifth. On the one occasion we tried to eat in the hotel, we gave up after being ignored by the serving staff, even though there were almost as many of them as there were customers. A truly miserable experience altogether.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Essaouira
Reviews.Content: I have just got back from my first visit to Amsterdam. What a great city! The Park Hotel is within walking distance of all of the major attractions (as long as you are reasonably fit). We had a few nights out on the town and walked back to the hotel in about 20 - 30 minutes. We got lost a few times but everyone seemed very friendly and keen to help the lost tourist! I had read some of the other reviews about this hotel before I booked it. Some were quite negative but as far as hotels in European cities go I think this one is great. The staff were very polite and friendly. Our room was clean and had a great bathroom with a power shower. The bed did have a bit of a dip in the middle but after a few nights on the town can't say I noticed anymore.....! You wouldn't get anything this good in London at this price. There are lots of restaurants and bars close to the Hotel and there are trams nearby. We really enjoyed our stay. Soon after we arrived in Amsterdam we saw a walking tour of the red light district mentioned in a free magazine. It told us to meet the guide outside the Victoria Hotel across from Central Station at 8pm. We went along last Friday and it was great. The guide was excellent and gave some history of the area. We went down narrow alleys that we wouldn't have dared to without a guide! I would highly recommend the tour for anyone, particularly women who might otherwise feel uncomfortable going in to the red light district.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeckyPhillips05
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night on 30th September 2006. Hotel staff were very friendly and although rooms were quite small they were clean and had everything you need. Bathrooms are gorgeous with fab power shower. Trams run until about 12.30 so you may experience a little noise outside but apart from that everything was great. If you are taking kids please hide the remote control.....i know its amsterdam but the 'adult movies' are the norm over there. Location was fantastic - walking distance to all atttractions.

Reviews.Title: “Where did they get their 4 stars?”
Reviews.Author: Devonfan
Reviews.Content: Arrived in morning having left home at 3.00 a.m. to find room not ready for us. Receptionist utterly unhelpful. Kicked our heels for about an hour, wasting time that should have been spent at the RAI, before chambermaids finished "cleaning" the room. Tiny room and not clean. Three sachets of decaffeinated coffee, one proper stuff! Not good after a 3.00 a.m. start. Food good although breakfast very expensive. How can a hotel with such small rooms and surly reception staff possibly be 4 star?

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: JD1999
Reviews.Content: We had one night here in March 2005. We paid about Â£55 each at the time of booking and on arrival, we upgraded to a Club room at half the normal upgrade price. The room was small, but couldn't be faulted. The facilities were great. Because of a fire at the nearby Rijksmuseum, we were advised to stay inside the room with the windows closed as they thought the smoke might have been toxic. Because of this, we decided to order room service, which was a little pricey, but very good. The following morning, we went down to breakfast, which was included in the price of the room. We took our time over breakfast, which was very good and included a large selection of cereals, breads, fruit etc. As the time approached for the staff to stop serving breakfast, one of the staff came round to everyone in the restaurant and told us that they were about to clear the food away. They said that if we wanted any more breakfast, we should take it then. That's never happened in any of the other hotels I've stayed in, the staff have just cleared the food away. Park Hotel is in a great location. Just across the road is one of the canal boat tours, the tram stop to Centraal Station isn't too far away, Vondelpark is just at the side of the hotel. After the canal cruise, we walked towards Dam Square and Centraal Station, had lunch and then took the tram back to the other side of the park and walked through the park and back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The internet 'good value' rooms are lousy”
Reviews.Author: petestars
Reviews.Content: I had a bad experience cause our room had a communication door with the room nextdoor and our neighbours spent their time doin strange noises, banging the door and smoking dope which almos intoxicated us,,,Awful. The hotel is well placed, but the rooms and the beds need an updating. The staff was correct but I didn't like being secured 115 euros from my credit card for 'possible' expenses. It's a mistrusting policy.

Reviews.Title: “An overpriced disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: gacman17
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel via Continental. Stayed two nights in June 2006. Was very disappointed to find they had dropped the Le Meridien brand, but wonder if it wasn't the other way around! I paid â‚¬ 169 per night (over $200/night) for a room with two skinny single beds. Unfortunately Amsterdam in June is well overbooked and didn't have much choice. Needless to say, that price didn't include breakfast. Also housekeeping NEVER changed my towels/sheets despite repeated requests at the front desk. The desk also forgot about my wakeup call which I requested in person. The street noise was also very loud until the wee hours and they wouldn't let me smoke in the room! The staff seems to have given up on making this place hospitable. So why bother staying here? Until this place is overhauled, look elsewhere. Two stars at best...

Reviews.Title: “Expensive Dump”
Reviews.Author: mgb60640
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in June 2006. They had dropped the Le Meridien brand, and we were told by the bartender that a remodel was in the plans. We paid â‚¬ 245 per night (over $300/night!) for a room with no working television and two terribly uncomfortable beds. Room was street facing and no sound proofing had been done, so we listened to the street noise and drunks all night. Breakfast was not even in the rate (extra â‚¬ 20 per person per day). Staff was unapologetic, and would not change our room. That said, the location is excellent. If the room was â‚¬ 125 a night I would have expected this. Definitely a two star hotel at best.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed in the park”
Reviews.Author: worstnightmare
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as a surprise to take my boyfriend away for his birthday but on arrival was disappointed. Had booked and recieved confirmation for a double room with canal views. On arrival was given a very small twin room on the first floor over looking a roof! When i went back down to reception they said there was nothing they could do and were quite rude. They said that they didn't have to give us the room we booked and were even entitled to put us in single rooms if there was no twin room available. I was offered a double room at an extra 60 euro per night which i went to see and it was tiny so i declined. This hotel is in a great location, however and is within walking distance of everything, which attracted me to it in the first place. House keeping barge in un announced early in the morning with their master key so be sure to put up a do not disturb sign if you want to sleep. Great pity about the service cos this hotel is well located and could be very good

Reviews.Title: “Good HotelExcellent Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: yvesp
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights with my partner and we were given a room with twin beds when we had booked double bed. Receptionnist was excellent - could not move us the first night but arranged for our luggage to be moved the second night. Were given a great room with an excellent view over Amsterdam and the canal. Booked this hotel because breakfast was said to be good. Was not disappointed! The hotel itself is a bit tatty and needs a refurb but the staff were all very friendly and helpful without exception. Would stay again at that time of year - prices are attractive but it is a bit expensive later on in spring or summer. The location however is excellent. Definetely worth considering!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel - Deserves 4-Star Rating”
Reviews.Author: Ron_from_Brooklyn
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 days at the Park Hotel, from 30 March to 5 April 2006. Came from the airport at 9:00 AM after an overnight flight and check us right in. Location is superb, near the museums. We had a large room overlooking the canal with 2 comfortable chairs and a queen size bed. Fresh fruit and sparkling water in our room each evening. Great breakfast. Attentive and friendly staff. Would stay there again when in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Hotel ..”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here .. Good size, really clean room, very friendly staff, nice breakfast, good bar .. great value we thought. We didnt eat Dinner at the Hotel Resturant .. so I have no idea what this is like. The Location is brilliant, right next to the museums ... and with plenty of bars and diffrent types of resturants across the canal. .. There ars 2 very regular trams (every couple of minutes) that run right to the central train station and the middle of the town .. The canal cruize goes from just outside the hotel .. recommend you take this .. its good fun .. Whenever I go back to Amsterdam I'll stay here again ..

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: How can the Park Hotel's location be any better? With the canal, Vondel Park, casino, Hard Rock Cafe, and museums all so close, how can you not love it? The bar downstairs was nice, as was the room. I've been to 3 continents and 12 countries, and this ranks among the top 3 places I've stayed at. Oh, and its being in an amazing city doesn't hurt either.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place”
Reviews.Author: ttboydubai
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park Hotel for a 3 days business trip. It is in an ideal location, I walked absolutely everywhere from the hotel, it is very central. The Staff was very friendly, keeping my bags with them for the last day was not a problem. They even sent me a thank you letter later on in the mail for my business. It was a nice touch. Fantastic Spacious and Modern washroom. Why not 5 stars? I think the only thing holding it back was perhaps the room decor (mostly just the conforters) are a bit old school, but other then that A+++ You'll be hard pressed for a better hotel for this price, I will definitely come back...

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: brisbaneboy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located, a short walk to anything a visitor to Amsterdam would like to see really. Close to various museums, squares full of restaurants, a lovely high-end shopping strip (I can recommend Shoebaloo if you are looking for well priced designer footwear) etc etc. A little further, but still within walking distance, is the Red Light District if that is your thing. I won't rave about the decor as there is nothing to rave about, it is a fairly typical 4/4.5 star hotel setup. But there is nothing to complain about and the bathrooms are quite nice. I was also very pleased that my hotel room in Amsterdam overlooked a canal! Our booking was made through Expedia - and I must say, for the price (under 50 pound per night) this hotel was EXCEPTIONALLY good value.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and decent value”
Reviews.Author: BernieG
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park in April (Tulip season). The location was convenient and the hotel was offering a special room rate at the time. The only complaint here was that we had requested connecting rooms when booking but found none to be available. Other than that, our stay was nice, with an included and bountiful breakfast each morning. Next door to the hotel is an excellent Indonesian restaurant. Having travelled to Amsterdam many years ago, I was looking forward to reacquainting myself with that type of cusine, as Indonesian restaurants are quite rare in the states. I was not disappointed. All agreed that we would consider staying here again should we return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: rachelbsn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Park Hotel and enjoyed our time in Amsterdam. The hotel is in a great location! The staff was so friendly and helpful, and our room was above average, considering the norm for hotels in Europe. The prices were high, but the location can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “top location...friendly staff...great value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just had a great stay at the Park Hotel in Amsterdam. This hotel is really in the best location of the city. All the museums, canalboats and best shopping just around the corner. Furthermore excellent equiped rooms ( love the tea & coffee making facilities ) and especially very friendly staff. To be short, great value and all you need for a pleasant short-break in Amsterdam. What a fabulous city indeed!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park Hotel in Amsterdam, and in my opinion it is a very good hotel, and normally I stay in 4* or 5* hotels so I know what standards to expect from a 4* hotel. To be honest we were put in the Park Hotel by accident because of a booking error but I'm quite glad we did because we had a great time. Amsterdam is a brilliant, quirky, and unique city and Stadthouderskade, where the hotel is located is right near Vondelpark, and also the museum quarter. It's well away from the red light district and is on the nice side of Amsterdam. It's right near one of the canals and you can hop on a canal barge more or less right outside your hotel! The views of the canal are fantastic, but you have to be careful to try and get a canal view because at the back of the hotel all you can see is buildings. Contrary to what was said in another review, the beds aren't any lower than other beds in hotels and the rooms are cosy and attractive and the fact that there are tea and coffee making facilities is absolutely brilliant! The best thing about the hotel is it's breakfasts (there's everything!) and it has a warm and friendly atmosphere. In fact Mrs Warboys off One Foot In The Grave was staying in the hotel at the same time as us (so it can't be bad if somebody off the TV is staying there!) And trust me, it isn't... if you choose to go to Amsterdam, the Dutch people are amazingly friendly and so are the hotel staff! It's the best hotel in a city location that I've stayed in!

Reviews.Title: “Great But No Cigar”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel back in 2002 for my 2nd visit to Amsterdam. On arrving i was really impressed. The reception was really nice and the staff were really helpful and friendly. The room was clean and of decent size and in my view good value for money. However the bath was way too small. If your 6 feet tall forgot it. Also the connecting door to the room next dor was paper thin. You could here the occupents next door talking for god sake. Also didn`t help when they got up to leave at 4am the next day :-( My last grumble was that housekeeping staff started at 7.30am!!!. On the whole i would give this hotel 3 out of 5. A vast improvement on the Hotel Atlanta which i stayed at in 2001 but not as good as the Hotel Amsterdam De Roode Leeuw where i stayed in 2003. I will be staying at the NH Schiller this May so will write a report to see how they compare. Regards Ryan K

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, but.....”
Reviews.Author: LindaSeattle
Reviews.Content: My family and I booked three seperate rooms in the "new wing". When we arrived, we were told that section was for some reason closed and we were booked into the older section of the hotel. The rooms were extremely small and cramped and the beds very low to the ground and smaller than a normal twin sized bed. The pillows were lumpy and uncomfortable. On the plus side, the hotel staff were all very, very friendly, the location was excellent and the breakfast buffet outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location, great room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to Amsterdam and really enjoyed this hotel. We upgraded to the Executive room upon arriving and loved it. King size bed, balcony overlooking the canal, and - this is the best - terrific bathroom with big tub. Truly enjoyed chilling in a big bubble bath (thank you Lush) every night. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Only one minor complaint - there is no wirless internet access. From the write up on hotels.com we expected it but it wasn't there - a bit deceiving. Besides that one small tribble it was a very pleasant experience. The location is ideal - the Leidsplein is only a 5 minute walk and there are dozens of restaurants there. Also within 5-minute walking distance are the Museumplein and PC Hoofstaat - chic shopping area. Walk about 10 minutes to hit the Albert Cuypmarket. This is not on top of the Dam (Square) or Red Light District but if that's where you plan to hang out then simply take the 1, 2, or 5 tram then walk for a few minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is superb - right in the middle of everything, and opposite the brilliant Casino. The lobby was average, reception staff friendly enough - we had 3 adjoining rooms overlooking the canal, no problem, even though we were on a cheap offer through expedia. The hotel rooms were of average size, excellent clean bathroom, although all of us agreed that some updating is required as the interiors are getting on a bit. All in all, a good stay - would give this 7/10.

Reviews.Title: “Park Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have just returned from this hotel iver new year (Dec 31st to Jan 4th.) After booking it in september we were a bit wary of the hotel after reading several really bad reviews about it. We are used to nice hotels and having stayed at the Crowne Plaza in the city centre we thought The Park would be a big let down. When we arrived, the reception was very modern. We got to our room and it was perfect...just what we wanted except twin beds instead of a queen bed we had booked. After complaining to the reception staff, they advised they had a room coming available the next day with a queen bed in. When we went to get the key to this room they had upgraded us to a club room. The room was quite big with a massive bed, balcony, television and a gorgeous marble bathroom. We visited the bar a few times and the staff were really friendly, they have really cosy couches too. We have both said that we would definitely stay in this hotel again, perfect location just 2 minutes from Leidesplein, Hard rock cafe across the road and an Irish bar and the largest casino in Europe. They also gave you free entrance into the casino. Brilliant hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location with nice breakfast in a good basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: LERuth49
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews of this hotel after I had booked it in a package. I was wary of what awaited me. It was a great basic hotel. It could not have been in a better location. It is near a major transportation stop. It faces a canal. It is even across from the Hard Rock Cafe. People like to criticize the Hard Rock but for families, it is a place with a predictable menu and drinks that can be refilled. The Rijks Museum and the Van Gogh Museum are a short walk away. Behind the Park is the elite shopping street for Amsterdam. A short walk to the front gets you to the Leidse Square and a good location for drifting through some of the best and most convenient shopping I have experienced in Europe. It might not be the "Ritz" but when we travel to Europe we look for clean, convenient, near transportation, and a breakfast other than just stale bread. The Park fits our bill. I would definitely use it again.

Reviews.Title: “In No Way a Four Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really not what it claims to be. It has ended up as part of Le Meridien as a result of their various mergers/demergers but it is in no way of international 4 or even 3 star standard. Reception were friendly and efficient but the decor is very dated and the rooms are horrible - small, tatty, very badly furnished. Even the bed would disgrace even a modest hotel. Le Meridien should either sell or sort out this hotel. At the moment it lets down their group. Location is good so if u get a VERY cheap rate u might risk it for leisure. But after a hard days work you will want somewhere better than this which is barely of tourist class. Must do better.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here for business”
Reviews.Author: slinky09
Reviews.Content: Foolish me, searched the Le Meridien Web site for a convenient hotel for two nights in Amsterdam. Booked what was advertised as an executive room for E185 a night. What a disappointment ... check-in was awful and disorganised, the room was the worst part and they should be prosecuted for using the term executive. Only one telephone line that was no where near the desk, no internet conneciton, they charged for local calls that were supposed to be free. The general state of the room was shabby and it was very small. For location it's OK, but in every other respect (apart from the friendly barman) a disappointment - particularly hopeless if you need to work!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel good, but bedroom not 4*”
Reviews.Author: steveburb
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two nights at The Park Hotel with another couple, and had a great weekend trip, the hotel is in a good location for all the interesting places, it has excellent friendly service, and all the communal areas,(bar, restaurant, etc) are very good. The bedrooms we had were very disappointing, they were clean, but very dated and small, if we had been staying any longer than two nights, we would of asked for a different room. In short, a 4* hotel but 1* bedrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: KaGu
Reviews.Content: We stayed in May, and had booked a Club room, which turned out to be very ordinary, and a disappointment. If that is Park Hotel's idea of luxury, I wonder how the standard rooms must be like. I do agree with the other TripAdvisor users who say that this is no four star hotel. Location is very good for the Reichsmuseum. Front desk staff was okay, but had no knowledge when we asked about train communication for our departure airport. All in all: Stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “As somewhere to lay my weary head, it was absolutely fine!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had decided to visit Amsterdam again. What a fabulous, and fabulously entertaining city! Last time I went, about three months ago, it resulted in a somewhat euphemistically pre-anaesthetised broken ankle. This time, I determined to keep myself just that little bit more sober. I booked flights and then turned to the infamous Priceline in order to book accommodation of some sort. For the centre of the "action", you really can't do an awful lot better than the Crowne Plaza City Centre or, say, the Golden Tulip. For the Leidesplein, Rijksmuseum and a spot of culture, you'll certainly enjoy the Park hotel. And that's exactly where I was allocated. There are a load of very decent hotels in this particular region. Don't get me wrong - I adore art. The Rijksmuseum, next door, is, however, apparently closed for the next 18 months or so due to major refurbishment and my agenda meant that planned entertainments - nothing terribly untoward, you understand - meant a tram ride into the real centre. Tram lines 2 and 5 will certainly do the trick. I messed up, however, and ended walking both ways. Probably 20-30 minutes. No real problem. I'm amazed at my sense of direction. I needed it! I'd hunted down 5-star hotels on Priceline. No luck. Similarly, I fruitlessly checked out their selection of 4-star hotels. So I opted for the 3-star level, and got a night at the Park Hotel for a very decent rate of Â£45 per night. Something of a steal as, for once, I would actually take issue with the 3-star rating. If nothing else, the rating is certainly somewhat marginal. Located next to one of Amsterdam's canals (where you can buy tickets for canal tours) it is an impressive building and I entered through the revolving door to find that the reception area was spacious, reasonably luxurious and well-staffed. It was a quiet and peaceful haven. The receptionist really could not have been much more friendly nor helpful and it was not long before I had the key - and it was, indeed, a proper key - to room 221. I also had a welcome letter given to me, inviting me to enjoy a half-price breakfast in the morning. The offer price of 9.50 Euros would have been an exceptionally good deal if I had not preferred the alternative option of a post-very-late-night-lie-in to the "American buffet breakfast" that was on offer. Check-out time was 11:30am and I just about made it! I had a meeting with some friends and despite hunting down the venue the night before, could I find it? Nope! Probably because it had actually closed down two years previously. But soft! We did meet up. After checking in, at any rate, I was offered help with my luggage, but I was only carrying a small case and, having declined this, was pointed in the direction of the lift. The bar and restaurant, which I passed en route looked really welcoming. In Amsterdam, however, I think that there are better places to drink than hotel bars, so - for a change - I can't share my experience with you. I used neither. They did, however, look inviting if that's your thing, and the menus were interesting. Room service was also available 24 hours per day. I reached the lift. It was at this point that I realised that I was not staying in a terribly modern hotel. I pressed the button to summon the lift. It arrived. The doors don't slide open like in any normal 20th or 21st Century lift - nope - you pull them open like a room door and step inside. Select your floor and up you go - no internal door at all; just watch the wall slide down below you! Stand back! I've seen this once before in a budget hotel in Prague, and was truly amazed to see it again. Still, it got me safely to the second floor and my room was only a few steps away. I unlocked the room and ventured inside. I worked out how to use the lighting. Interesting room - yellow painted walls and blue carpeted floors, with two single beds pushed together to form a double. These were extraordinarily low-level and very soft. They actually provided a great night's sleep, I have to say. Standard hotel-issue remote-controlled TV with personalised welcome screen. The bathroom was reasonably large, was white and was spotlessly clean. The toiletries were decent, and the bath / shower combination was efficient; plenty of hot water. I just don't know how to sum up - it was very comfortable, and it was certainly more than adequate. It was, at the end of the day, somewhere to lay my rather weary head, and it was clean, comfortable and moderately luxurious. There was 24 hour room service. That's all you need in an Amsterdam hotel - in fact, it's probably more than you need. What probably stops me raving about the place is simply the fact that it just struck me as being somewhat tired. The reception area had an air of elegance about it yet, once out of the lift, the place had a certain shabby feeling about it. A water pipe, for instance, ran down the wall of my bedroom. Small point, but I just don't like to see such visible plumbing in my hotel room. Perhaps I'm just too picky! Check-out in the morning was friendly and efficient. Yes - I'd happily stay there again, but there are certainly better places to stay in Amsterdam - if only for the location. If you're more intent on doing the Art thing, however, this would certainly be a contender. Priceline have it down as a 3-star. Le Meridien have it down as a 4-star. I'm finding it quite hard to judge, to be honest. Customer service gives it a definite 4. The somewhat jaded fabric of the bedrooms leads me towards a 3. As a place to stay, well - it was more than adequate and I couldn't complain at the price; perhaps a star-rating is irrelevant - which is a cop-out. I guess that, whilst it would never be my first choice in Amsterdam for a variety of reasons, it suited its purpose pretty well and I've no real right, or need, whatsoever to complain.

Reviews.Title: “major works outside the Park Hotel Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Hotel Amsterdam from 2nd Oct to 5th October last. We had read the reviews on Tripadvisor and as a result decided to upgrade our room. This cost an extra E105 for the 3 nights. The street outside the hotel is completely dug up with major works being undertaken at the front of the hotel. We felt we could have been told this when we spoke with the reservations clerk. She had no problem taking extra money from us for an upgrade but did not advise of the works being undertaken. We found the staff very helpful and the hotel good - though not 4 star. It is a little far away from Dam Square - 20 minutes walk but located in a nice place if you do not wish to be in Dam square every evening. Plenty restaurants and bars around.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay at the Park Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a nice 3-day stay at the Park Hotel a couple weeks ago. We got a good price of $150 U.S. per night for a "club" room double through expedia.com. However, we were upgraded at no cost to a two-level suite due to some apparently unanticipated need to close a wing of the hotel (they never told us why). Although the suite was very nice, we were still a little bothered because it had only one bed (we needed two) and it did not have air-conditioning, which the club room we booked was supposed to have. To apologize, the management sent us a bottle of wine, which was a nice gesture. Overall, it was a comfortable hotel with all the amenities, although it's a little worn around the edges. The front desk staff were very friendly, with the exception of one sourpuss. However, they gave us misinformation on two occasions, regarding the opening hours of the Rijksmuseum and which tram to take to the Resistance Museum. The location is excellent -- the Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh Museum are right around the corner, along with trams and buses to the city centre. There is massive road construction going on outside the hotel and expected to last for at least a year, but we didn't hear any noise from it during our stay. Overall, we would recommend the Park Hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 star quality”
Reviews.Author: KarrieMac
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for two nights in August. FIRST, we were given a room with two twin beds, we had reserved one larger bed. When we wanted to change rooms, we were told the hotel was fully booked and they would put the beds together. The room was dreadfully hot (at least 30C) with a small window that wouldn't stay open. Also, the small bathroom was difficult to move around in and the shower head only dribbled water. The SECOND night we were able to move into another room. This room was much better. We were able to open the balcony doors to allow a cool breeze. The bathroom was large and newly remodeled. The hotel is in a great location. The Hardrock Cafe, Boom Chicago and loads of pubs are nearby. Also, the Van Gogh and Rijks Museums. The canal bus stops in front of the hotel and the tram stops are close by. Its not 4 star quality but if you are looking for a place to lay your head look no further.

HotelInfo.Name: Park Hotel Amsterdam
HotelInfo.Address: Stadhouderskade 25, Amsterdam 1071 ZD, The Netherlands
